Julia

story:
Thank you for everyone who donated! I am so honored to have received so much support, it absolutely blows my mind *tear*

 

Right now I'm not accepting anymore donations, I haven't honoured my campaigns perk claims yet because oh my health problems, so until then I won't be starting a new campaign.

Right now, unfortunately, the 2,000 I raised wasn't enough to cover the costs of a more aggressive treatment, however, I was able to pay for my current treatment without going farther into debt. So far the receipts for my treatment costs amount to 2,000 and by the end of this month I will have used up all I raised. So I was able to spread the funds over many months.

 

The problem with more aggressive treatment was that I would have to drive to the US to get the medications. After that they would need to be injected by a professional who could give me medical attention if I had a reaction post injection. No one in Canada would agree to do this. I would have to inject in the US then do the rest myself (if done incorrectly it could be fatal).

 

I'm not comfortable injecting myself since it's in the bum and I can't see to make sure I'm not injecting into a vein. Also, I'd have to pay for blood tests  to check my organs because again ohip won't cover it here. So I decided that I should stay on oral antibiotics.

I may have to start a new campaign if this treatment isn't effective. So far, I haven't improved, but I also haven't slid back. I am better and more capable of functioning than I was 9 months ago.

 

Because of internet harassment, I am seriously thinking about how I want to continue... we'll see.

 

Eternally grateful,

 

Ardra

story:
The Mission

Hi, My Name is Dainuri Rott.  I am a Surfer, Veteran and Founder / Executive Director of GoodLife Mobility (GLM).

GLM is a 501(c)(3) non profit dedicated to innovative engineering . We provide the world with our adaptive water sports technology.

Our mission is to improve the quality of life for people facing physical and emotional challenges by developing innovative mobility solutions for flat water and ocean recreation.

GLM's present focus is providing  individuals with limitations with electric powered Adaptive SUPs (Stand Up Paddle Boards) and electric powered Adaptive Wave Skis for surfing.

Our Ambassadors

In the flat water world of lakes, rivers, and estuaries, our ambassador is Veteran Sean Ryan.   In the video above you heard Sean talk about his experience with our innovative adaptive SUP in a San Francisco Bay Marina.  

Our ambassador is Veteran Mark Thornton, a wave-skier with paraplegia.   Mark lives in the San Diego area and is excited about sharing the joy of the Adaptive Wave Ski with fellow veterans.


Our Goals

With Sean leading the way, our goal is to build 2 robust and reliable adapted SUPs, with 1 for use by Veteran's Program Outreach, and 1 for various Challenged Athletes in the San Francisco Bay Area. We'll be working with the recreation therapists at the Palo Alto and Menlo Park Veterans Hospitals  and with established Veterans organizations such as Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA) and Disabled American Veterans (DAV.) And we'll be doing our own outreach to get veterans and challenged athletes out on the water for fun, mobility and independence.    We will also do the same for the 2 units in the San Diego area.

Where will your contribution go?

We are a lean organization fueled by volunteer labor and a minimum of cash.   In our  project to build an electric assist surfboard for an injured competitive surfer (see story below) we had 6 volunteers donating over 1700 hours, and 5 business sponsors who donated materials and labor. 

We plan to run the Water Mobility outreach program in  a similar fashion and will continue to use volunteers to cover outreach for the SF bay area and San Diego.

Here is a breakdown of our $50,000 goal that will bring 2 Adaptive SUPs and 2 Adaptive Wave Skis to veterans in the San Francisco Bay and San Diego areas.



 Our Story

How did GoodLife Mobility's mission evolve?  Our roots are in surfing, and in 2003, I built my first prototype.  As an aging surfer, I was running out of paddle power and was tired of missing literally hundreds of waves.

A pivotal moment for my work came in 2004 when I met a courageous young surfer who became a quadriplegic after being injured by a fluke wave.  With no feeling from the chest down and very limited use of his arms, he did not let his condition stop him. I watched in awe as his surfing friends pushed him into scary waves in Ventura, California.

I immediately knew that others needed electric assist technology more than I did. That realization, plus years of engineering innovations, resulted in  the world’s first joystick-controlled, steerable electric surfboard. Using this board  at a Malibu beach test session in June 2012, the  young surfer was able to surf independently again. He caught a lot of waves, hung out in the surf for over an hour, and even used the electric assist board to tow his buddies!

Below is a picture of Julia Olson (who sustained a spinal chord injury in a car accident) riding the joystick controlled board in Foster City Ca.  She had a blast and would love to have access to one.



Most of the effort put into the electric surfboard was self-funded and assisted by small donations. In 2010, we got a big boost from a quality of life grant from the Christopher and Dana Reeve Foundation; most of the engineering effort is from volunteers, individuals, and companies who have generously donated their time and resources.

To get a listing of some of the contributors and see the board in action, please click on this link:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bbq1Uz5nR3w

Where we are now

Over the years, I’ve encountered a lot of other people like the courageous young surfer who could benefit from this adaptive technology, especially our warriors who were wounded in service to our country.

I believe in the healing power or fun, recreation, and just being out on the water.  My sense is that experience helps heal all of us, especially if we're dealing with gnarly conditions like PTSD.

I am especially eager to give back the joy of being on the water to our returning vets.  I'd like to see every VA Hospital and recreation center have adaptive water sports and this Indiegogo campaign is an important beginning toward that goal.

Our ongoing supporters

We have been overwhelmed by the support provided by so many folks along the way.

Here's a picture of me with Jerry Lopez, my long time surfing and SUP hero, about to sign a SUP poster, one of the Perks available for your contribution to the campaign. Jerry has supported us along with two more of my heroes, Maverick's big wave surfers Jeff Clark and Frosty Hesson.   (Jeff shaped the electric board and Frosty has contributed signed copies of his memoir, another Perk you might receive.)

       



What you can do to contribute

Sure, we'd love for you to find a great perk or simply make a donation to our campaign. We'd love you for you to share in this adventure and get as many smiles on as many Challenged Athlete and Veteran faces as possible.

And remember, your contributions are tax-deductible (minus the retail value of your perk .)

If you are not in a position to donate please spread the word by e-mailing your friends, through your social media network - Facebook, Twitter, etc. and of course word of mouth.

In Closing:

The young men who serve in foreign wars are at the top of the list of my heroes. Please help GoodLife Mobility support them in their journeys back to civilian life. Let's make it fun and joyful. 

There is something else you can contribute that is free:

Next time you meet a Veteran, stop for a moment, look him or her in the eye, and say "Thank you for your service."   You might be surprised at what happens.

Cowabunga, 

Dainuri Rott

story:
On Thursday, August 9, 2012, we lost Dr. Clement Knight, a husband, a father and a friend. 

In lieu of flowers, we ask family and friends to donate to the following cause: Sweden Ghana Medical Centre (SGMC) Ltd. 

SGMC was a cause that was dear to Dr. Knight's heart and benefited greatly from his advice. In Dr. Knight's name, SGMC is setting up a foundation that will pay for low-income patients in Ghana to receive medical treatment for cancer.

For more information about SGMC, please visit:  http://www.sgmcltd.com/

story:
Welcome to SECURELIFE!  

We are a company and group of individuals dedicated to saving lives!  We have a patent pending system that includes two commercially available products, the SecureLife MedCard® and the SecureLife MedCard® PLUS and are asking for your help to develop the SecureLife MedApp® to complete our System!


What we have: Our Existing Products

The SecureLife MedCard®was developed as a “Stand alone” product (Card only) for use in emergency situations.  It is a well known fact that in the event you or a loved one is in an accident and unconscious, first responders (i.e., Emergency Medical Technicians ‘EMTs’, Emergency Medical Services providers ‘EMSs’, Doctors practicing in Emergency Rooms) will search through you or a loved ones wallet or purse for critical information.  

Th

e SecureLife MedCard® 

has your critical information printed on the card and includes a quick response (QR) code that can be scanned to retrieve the medications you are taking.  This product can be purchased online for $19.95 at www.securelifemedcard.com 
The SecureLife MedCard® PLUS includes the card with it's features and has online data storage capabilities for individuals who are looking for a secure method of organizing, storing and accessing all of their medical records.  This product can be purchased online for $49.90, with annual renewal payments of $29.95 per year.  As part of the registration a customer will create a four digit personal identification number (PIN) allowing physicians access to a secure server hosted by Armor Defense which is an internet cloud hosting service that specializes in HIPAA standards, internet security and hacker prevention. 

What Our Products Do

Both the SecureLife MedCard®and the SecureLife MedCard®PLUS allow first responders to gain instant access to important information including a person’s existing conditions, medication allergies, blood type and emergency contacts by reading what is printed on the front of the card.  First responders and physicians can also access additional information by scanning the QR code with their smart phone or by using their computer and entering the slmc.me uniform resource locator (URL) that is also located on the front of the card.  The Basic Records Page (BRP) that will appear will show a person’s physical characteristics to match the card with the person, the medications a person may be taking along with the dosages and frequencies, and additional contact and insurance information. 

What we are building

With the proceeds being raised from this campaign we intend to develop the SecureLife MedApp® which will be a phone application to compliment the SecureLife MedCard® and the SecureLife MedCard® PLUS that also includes Member physician login capabilities and GPS group locating functionalities with a standards-based interface system to transfer data to first responders and hospitals and between EMRs (Electronic Medical Record companies) and the Company’s data base.

By contributing to this campaign you will help build the first global accessible data base of medical records in the world!  No matter where you or a loved one are or traveling to, with our GPS locator first responders and emergency medical technicians will be able to find you or your loved one and access the critical medical information to potentially save you or a loved one's life!


What we need & what we are doing with funds

Our goal is to raise $1,000 to complete the first stage of development of our operating system, the patent process! Eventually, we will need $50,000 for the development of the SecureLife MedApp with location functionalities, $25,000 for marketing and another $25,000 for working capital.
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! By contributing a minimum of $100 to this campaign now you will receive the SecureLife MedCard, a five year free subscription to the SecureLife PLUS and the SecureLife MedApp once developed, all of which is valued at approximately $170. 
As money comes in, we will continue the development of the SecureLife MedApp with earnings that are generated from the sales of the SecureLife MedCard. 
 For more information on investing contact Jim Garlie at 702.349.6621 or jimgarlie@sasisystems.com .


The Impact

As it is estimated that over 100,000 lives are lost each year in the U.S. alone because first responders didn't have the critical information they needed, you will be making a valuable contribution to the global interactive data base we are building and the saving of lives!

Why our team?

The SECURELIFE Board of Directors, development and marketing team has a wealth of business knowledge and experience ranging from many startups to companies like Medtronic, Inc., Deloitte Touche, Pinnacle Healthcare Systems, Pierce Waterhouse and Epic Systems.

We use Armour Defense as our hosting service for all of your private information.  Armour Defense has a reputation of being the most secure HIPAA compliant hosting service in the world!  Your records will be safe with SECURELIFE!

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest risk comes from competitive products, overcoming finance hurdles and marketing challenges. We are protecting our intellectual property, and have a registered trademark and a "Provisional Patent" filed covering our overall system with the full intent of filing a "Utility Patent".  Our strategy moving forward is to grow so quickly that anyone or company that wants to infringe on our patent will simply offer to acquire us!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.  Tell a friend or loved one about our products and direct them to our website www.securelifemedcard.com !

story:
Short Summary

Mission Atletica began in 2004 to fulfill a dream that began with my first pair of shoes. I was 14 years old. Born and raised in a poor area of Guatemala, running in those loafers became my salvation and I knew while I was running that I wanted to do something big for the sport of running, and help runners like myself who cannot afford to buy a pair of running shoes.

While working for a U.S. non-profit in 2003, a donated box of used running shoes took me back to the frustration and disappointments I experienced as a young athlete unable to get a decent pair of sports shoes. It's hard if you have the will for running and you don't have the main tool which is a pair of running shoes, so I asked if I could take the shoes for runners like myself.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to support a big race taking place in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala on June 15, 2014.  Our goal is to ship 10,000 pairs of running shoes to be given to the runners of this race.  We need help funding the cost of the shipping which is $2.00 per pair of running shoes, that is $20,000 in shipping costs.  In addition we are trying to rent warehouse space in San Rafael, CA to be used to sort and ready the shoes for shipping. 

The Impact

As of today I've donated 2,500 pairs of sports shoes to Guatemala, and runners of all ages are winning in national competitions. Track, in field and road races, is growing and the entire country is benefitting as kids put energy and ambition into running/sports rather than the gangs and crime 36 years of civil war brought to Guatemala, (1960-1996).

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help by visiting Edgar Hernandez, Mission Atletica page on LinkedIn, and Facebook.  Also please see our you tube videos entitled "shoes for Guatemala.  Please spread the word.  We have a Paypal account that you can access on LinkedIn as well.

story:
Why

I spent my life in the EOD community and I have been very fortunate and blessed, there are many of my brothers out there that were not so lucky, but they gladly volunteered to save the lives of people they never met in far off lands like Iraq and Afghanistan, they came back wounded, and the least I can do is to honor their sacrifice.

When I tell people I'm running 31 miles, they think I'm crazy, and I just might be, but I can still try and run 31 miles, many of my brothers cannot.  I run for them.

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the funds will go directly to the EOD Warrior Foundation.  This site charges me 3% to manage the money, I will donate the 3% back.  What you get is to know you are helping those who would save your life without ever having met you.

The Impact

Supporting the EOD Warrior Foundation (http://www.eodwarriorfoundation.org/about).

story:
ABOUT US

One of the missions of Kidding Around Yoga is to bring yoga into the minds, hearts, souls, and bodies of children who otherwise do not have the means. Become part of the cause and help keep the dream alive!

We would like to accelerate the sense of self and provide under-served children with the tools to live peaceful, harmonious, and gratifying lives. 

We provide yoga classes at Melrose Elementary School, a title one school, located in the heart of St. Pete.  For years, we have loved watching the skeptics and children quickly become devoted to our program!  

We also teach yoga at Camp Harmony twice a year.  Camp Harmony is located in Malibu, California.  It provides sleep over camp experiences, as well as other enriching programs for homeless and impoverished kids in the Los Angeles area.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Our teachers are deeply committed to serving the underserved, so much so that they pay to do so out of their own pockets. We've received so much positive feedback from students, teachers and parents and we want to continue our efforts.  

With your help we will be able to continue and improve our Melrose Elementary School program and expand it into more title one schools in the surrounding area. Your donation will also supplement expenses incurred by KAY teachers that volunteer their time at Camp Harmony. 

About the Founder and Director

Haris “Harini” Lender is a certified Integral Yoga® teacher at the 500 level. She has also been certified in prenatal, Raja, stress management, and children's yoga.

Much of Kidding Around Yoga was developed from years of teaching wherever Haris' kids were as they grew up. From Brownie Troops to their Hebrew School, she used what she knew and loved (yoga!) to connect with the kids in each environment. Haris was also the Director of Camp Yogaville, a week-long residential summer camp at The Yogaville Ashram, for 11 years. She now runs her own residential summer camp, Camp Kidding Around Yoga, in Ellenton, Florida.  All of these experiences combined with the creative spark she inherited from her parents led her to develop this truly unique program and helped shape KAY into what it is today.

Haris currently lives in St. Petersburg, FL with her husband, four kids, and doggies. When she is not traveling the globe leading KAY teacher trainings, she also loves spending time at her lovely yurt in Yogaville, VA. 

BENEFITS OF YOGA FOR KIDS

Do kids really need yoga in their lives? The answer is YES and the reasons why are countless.

Children today live in a very fast-paced world. Between pressures from school, extra curricular activities, their peers, parents, and society, the hustle and bustle of every day life can quickly wear down on a child’s inner peace and joy. All of these pressures and expectations can lead to a whole lot of stress, and while most kids are not familiar with the concept of stress, they can still experience what it feels like without giving it a label or name.

Kidding Around Yoga, at its very essence, is stress management for kids.

In addition to managing stress, Kidding Around Yoga can benefit kids in many other capacities. Here are just a few:

  • Standing poses improve posture and strength. 
  • Balancing poses improve focus, concentration, strength, and coordination.
  • Backbends are invigorating and open and strengthen the heart and chest.
  • Forward bends are relaxing and help to massage the digestive system.
  • Inversions and difficult poses encourage practice and build strength and self-esteem.
  • The Secret Garden, or deep relaxation, allows the body to assimilate all of the benefits of the Yoga practice. In this still and quiet part of class, kids are able to create a special place in their minds where they feel peaceful, happy, and safe.
  • Breathing practices reduce stress, help with focus and concentration and also reduce allergy and asthmatic symptoms.
  • Meditation reduces stress and enhances calmness and clarity of the mind.
  • The principles of Yoga teach kids kindness, sharing, compassion, mindfulness, awareness, and much more. Tools that will serve them for the rest of their lives!

 OUR PERKS

                                                   

                           KIDDING AROUND YOGA GREATEST HITS ALBUM

Kidding Around Yoga has professionally produced music albums filled with activities for all of your little yogis.  This album contains 22 of our best songs!

                                   

                       ALL 5 OF KIDDING AROUND YOGA'S MUSIC ALBUMS

These are Kidding Around Yoga 5 professionally produced music albums filled with activities for all of your little yogis.  

                                                   

                                        KIDDING AROUND YOGA DVD

Let your kids practice Yoga, exercise, sing, dance, and have a whole lot of fun… all in the comfort of your hOMe on DVD. 

                      MEET THE STUDENTS OF MELROSE ELEMENTARY

Come witness the combination of Melrose's amazing students and KAY's fantastic program.  It's always a rewarding experience!  

        KIDDING AROUND YOGA TEACHER TRAINING - ONLINE AND LIVE

The KAY training is designed for anybody who wants to share the joy of Yoga with children. Whether you want to start your own thriving kids yoga business, or you are an elementary school teacher looking for new activities or a parent who’s child would benefit from the calming effect of Yoga, our training will fully prepare you to lead SUPER fun kids yoga classes, activities, meditations and deep relaxation. The training will enhance your career and will change your life.

story:
You never know when you are going to need a little extra help in life.  Well, today is that day for Corey & Nora Stewart. On June 29, 2014 Corey suffered from a  stroke.  He was medevacked to Anchorage for Rehabilitation. Although, he is already making progress, his recovery is going to be a lengthy and challenging road.

Corey is a hard worker who holds down two jobs to support his family, one of which is a son that will begin college in the fall.  With Corey unable to return to work for an unknown amount of time, they need our help.  Let’s join together to help relieve the burden of financial stress so Corey can focus on getting better.

story:
Hello,

My name is Vivien. Thank you for visiting our campaign page. Today I am asking you to make a donation to support a great cause: funding us to make an app to stop emotional eating disorders. Why do we want to enter this competitive space?  I had the opportunity to work in the weight loss surgery industry. One day I saw the video of a weight loss patient and was haunted by her sufferings. Weight loss surgery is for the morbidly obese individuals.  Morbidly obese individuals run the risks of heart disease, type 2 diabetes, amputation and etc. Weight loss surgery could be a life-saving choice for some, but there are risks involved - it is not for everyone. Most lose substantial weight after the surgery, but many gain it back.  Singer Carnie Wilson, for example, had weight loss surgery twice. She is still overweight today. As with any surgical procedure, death is a possibility:Gastric Bypass Weight Loss Surgery Deaths

What if that could be prevented? By changing one’s life style and eating habits before it’s too late? One could for example, stop the habit of emotional eating.

We sometimes eat or snack, not because we are hungry, but because we are stressed or bored.  Emotional eaters use food to cope with their mental issues and loneliness. Even celebrities struggle with emotional eating disorders:

Oprah Winfrey commented about her weight, “It’s always a struggle. I’ve felt safer and more protected when I was heavy. Food has always been comforting.”

Wynonna Judd struggled with emotional eating, “It’s not about size, I’ll let that take care of itself. The work I’m doing is inside.”

"The work inside" is the relationship with people, not food.  It's not food that's delicious, life is delicious!   Have a life! Stop emotional eating!


You can help the cause!  Pledge right now!  

We would like to raise $50,000, to make an iOS app, and to cover all the administration and reward expenses.

Main Features:
  1. -Rewards for Commitment
  2. -In-app Distractions
  3. -Real time messaging

Our app would allow users to interact with an accountability partner in their weight loss or control journey. Whenever someone has an urge to snack or eat because of emotional reasons, they will be able to connect with an accountability partner. It could be their spouse, friend, or someone we pair you up with. Users will be rewarded when sticking to a diet schedule.  

Our app will be different from other fitness apps in that users will be able to connect with a human on a real time basis.  It is a known fact that having an accountability partner is a very important component toward habit change. The app will have features of social network, diet, fitness and mental health.

Our team has a broad business, medical and IT background, we have the passion in fighting for this cause. 


We need your support!

Donate now, if you or someone you know is an emotional eater.  Tell your friends to pledge if they think they would become so overweight that they might need weight loss surgery in the end.  You would applause yourself for doing a good deed and a good service to the humanity!


Perks

$10 USD or more

You show a random kindness for today

You donate with no official return, we will pray for you and may God bless you, thank you!


$25 USD or more

2 Wrist Bands

A pair of wrist bands for you to share with someone you care, together we can fight the cause, thank you for your support!


$50 USD or more

Wrist Band + a 2GB Flash Drive

A wrist band and 2 GB of Goodness to the world.  To you, “…gave me the opportunity to realize the hidden goodness of kind souls that give away their humble presents in various forms,not expecting anything in return...but rejoice in the delightful sound of harmony.”


$75 USD or more

1 Wrist Band + 4GB Flash Drive

1 wrist band and a 4 GB Flash Drive, 4 GB of kindness to yourself and others. To you, “The goodness that is within you, will always shine through, where ever you may go…”
Add $7 for shipping outside of US


$100 USD or more

A DietDF T-shirt + 1 Wrist Band

Pat yourself on the back for doing goodness, and remember you never have to be alone on any journey. Wear the shirt and remember you have friends.
Add $7 for shipping outside of US


$250 USD or more

A DietDF t-shirt + 1 Wrist Band and you will receive an exclusive lifetime subscription to the App when it’s released. 
Add $7 for shipping outside of US


$500 USD or more

2 DietDF t-shirts +2 Wrist Bands and you will receive 2 exclusive lifetime subscriptions to the App when it’s released.  Share your prices with one other dear friend of yours.


$1000 USD OR MORE

Four t-shirts + 4 Wrist Bands and 4 exclusive lifetime subscriptions to the App.


$2000 USD or more

Eight t-shirts + 8 Wrist Bands and 8 exclusive lifetime subscriptions to the App. 


Donate now!

Donate now if you are an emotional eater. Ask 10 of your friends and their friends to donate if they are also emotional eaters.  You contribution will help fight obesity and mean so much to the world.  And of course, so much to us, who want so much to fight this cause!


Donate now! Share our campaign with your friends and family!  Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you, and God Bless You!

Vivien

story:
Short Summary

I have been building on this Sonic for a few years now, and its gotten to the point where I am almost satisfied with it enough to be able to give it away. In order to make it well enough though, and professionally enough, i require a CNC mill, which will cost around $600. Can you help me raise that much?



What We Need & What You Get

A decent CNC mill costs anywhere between 500 dollars and a few thousand. For these screwdrivers, we just need a basic model. Something that can cut groves and straight lines nice and neatly.

We have set this raiser up so regardless of the amount achieved, the money will go to an investment kitty, so that when we eventually raise enough, we will be able to manufacture them and send them to all those who donated.

We will not be offering any perks for this, apart from one. If you donate $75, and we raise enough for a CNC mill, We will make you your own tailor made screwdriver for free. It could have a brushed aluminum finish or painted with the authentic crackle paint similar to the paint used in Doctor Who! if you would like yours longer or shorter than the others, that can be tailored as well.



The Impact

If we manage to break our target, it will allow us to make high quality replica sonic screwdrivers that could be given away to those who want them. these screwdrivers double up as a personal torch and unlike the toy screwdrivers, these feel like a tool rather than a toy.

Given that there are two choices for authentic screwdrivers on the market today, $30ish for the toy, or $400 for the replica, why not give one of these a go instead? they may not be authentic, but they look and feel the part!



Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not feel like donating, or cannot at the moment, you could tell others of this fundraiser or even give feedback in the comments section about ideas or changes you think are justified to this design!

story:
Since the age of 7, I've had emetophobia and anxiety. Despite pleas to the doctors and educational psychologists I was written off as an attention seeker. So for years, I battled alone, interally.

In 2003, at the age of 13, I had a breakdown (crisis) which triggered agoraphobia. The NHS provided limited therapy but it helped just enough to get me out of the house and lead a semi-"normal" life. They didn't care to help with the emetophobia. They let me down.

In 2009 I had another breakdown and episode of agoraphobia. The NHS offered six sessions of CBT, nothing else. They let me down by their inflexibility and inability to treat me as an individual.  So I hired a private counsellor to help address the emotional issues associated with my anxieties. Over a period of two years, I slowly recovered from my agoraphobia. I used my then Incapacity Benefit to pay for these sessions.

In 2013 I was well enough to meet the man who is now my fiance. He knew my issues from the outset but they didn't get in the way. Chris taught me how to live. How to love life and enjoy adventures and the unknown. Christopher proposed to me in January 2015 and naturally I accepted. Unfortunately in March 2015 I suffered another breakdown and have found myself yet again stuck in a cycle of agoraphobia, emetophobia, and exceptionally low self-esteem and confidence. 

Chris and I are due to have a church wedding on 3rd September 2016 followed by a nearby reception. This is now less than eleven months away. I need to be in full health and confident in my ability to cope with life in the preparations for the wedding, and at the point of entering into marriage with the man who wants to spend the rest of his life with me, and me with him. It's the least he deserves, and it's something I desperately want.

So I reached out to secondary care mental health services on the NHS. Following an assessment it was deduced that unless I have CBT there is nothing they can do to help me, because they can offer no other service, so I was told to go private if you want psychotherapy, best of luck, and goodbye.

That is the extent of the help the NHS are prepared to give me unless I play the CBT game. I've done that many times over the years and it hasn't worked. CBT is not a cure all. I believe I need psychoanalytical therapy and hypnotherapy to really get to the root of my emetophobia which underlies my agoraphobia, and the root of the emetophobia which is the control, self esteem and self confidence issues.

We have found someone willing to help me with that. She lives close by. Following a free consultation I can undertake therapy with her. She is passionate about addressing emetophobia and completely understands my exact issues without me even going into detail about things.

Each session will cost £70 and I may need up to six sessions. I earn £200 per month working from home. Chris is on an average wage but I cannot expect him to fund my therapy, plus we have to save for our wedding. My mum has offered to help but again I cannot expect her to fund my therapy, and my parents have already given us a generous donation towards the wedding.

So I guess the point of all this is that I am asking for anyone who understand mental illness, who knows how important it is to help themselves and better themselves, who has dreamed of their wedding but knows what it's like to fear illness getting in the way of it, and ANYONE who has also been let down by NHS mental health services as I have, please, if you can, donate a few pounds to help me take the steps that will ultimately get me down the aisle in the best health I can possibly be in.

I will put the work in, but I need the help to fund this therapy. It's the best chance I've got.

If I require fewer sessions, or donations exceed the target, I will be donating all excess funds to Mind and Anxiety UK.

 

Thank you.

You can read more about my conditions and how they affect my life on my blog.

I believe I need psychoanalytical therapy and hypnotherapy to really get to the root of my emetophobia which underlies my agoraphobia, and the root of the emetophobia which is the control, self esteem and self confidence issues.We have found someone willing to help me with that. She lives close by. Following a free consultation I can undertake therapy with her. She is passionate about addressing emetophobia and completely understands my exact issues without me even going into detail about things.Each session will cost £70 and I may need up to six sessions. I earn £200 per month working from home. Chris is on an average wage but I cannot expect him to fund my therapy, plus we have to save for our wedding. My mum has offered to help but again I cannot expect her to fund my therapy, and my parents have already given us a generous donation towards the wedding.So I guess the point of all this is that I am asking for anyone who understand mental illness, who knows how important it is to help themselves and better themselves, who has dreamed of their wedding but knows what it's like to fear illness getting in the way of it, and ANYONE who has also been let down by NHS mental health services as I have, please, if you can, donate a few pounds to help me take the steps that will ultimately get me down the aisle in the best health I can possibly be in.I will put the work in, but I need the help to fund this therapy. It's the best chance I've got.If I require fewer sessions, or donations exceed the target, I will be donating all excess funds to Mind and Anxiety UK. Thank you.You can read more about my conditions and how they affect my life on my blog.

story:
A New Start:

Sometimes, new starts are long, planned out adventures.  All the ducks are in a row and all of the i's have been dotted. And, sometimes, life happens.

I have a chance for a new start that, while I wasn't quite planning on it, I'm actually extremely excited about.  It's simple.  I had a job and a paycheck and everything seemed fine.  Opening my own practice again was a "down the road" kind of thing.    And then life happened.  Now it's a "wheels on the pavement" kind of thing.  By the way, the loss of the job was a result of major cutbacks in insurance reimbursements for chiropractors in Tennessee.  Nothing "bad" happened.  There was simply no budget left to pay for my position after the cuts.  

My intention is to open a very simple, very laid back, but very effective practice.  I want to bring my nearly two decades of experience to bear in a  much more intimate setting.  I've spent the recent past in a great, but very busy practice.  As I write this, I have just turned 50.  My pace has changed.  My intentions have grown up a bit and I'm ready for a slow, but fun and results driven practice.   Building from the start with an ultra-low overhead model will allow me to do just this.  

I have an amazing opportunity to do it right here in Chattanooga.  

But,

I need your help.  Nothing like asking friends and family for money, but that's exactly where I find myself.  To be clear, I'm not asking for donations or charity.  I plan to pay you back.  And, yes, you might even get a t-shirt.

It's big.

The impact of your contribution is actually big for me.  The timing in this whole adventure is really fantastic with the one glaring exception of the ability to cover my start-up costs.  Like I said, I didn't pick the timing.  But, in the age-old "make lemonade" way, I'm going to do more than just get by.  I'm going to make it a great thing.

I'm trying to raise $7,500.  Which really isn't much to start a practice.  But it's more than I can put my hands on at the moment, and the moment happens to be here now.  So, I ask.

I anticipate needing around $3,000 for clinical equipment, $2,000 for furnishings, and the last $2,500 for a little working capital to get things started.  That's it.  

For Chattanooga locals, there are options.  If you prefer, you can use any contribution toward future care.  And, if you contribute $1,000, I will take care of you for free for as long as I'm in practice.  That should give you at least 15 years!  If you contribute $2,000, I'll take care of you and your immediate family for as long as I'm in practice.  I'd love to give you that as a show of my appreciation.

If you have any questions at all just email me at kenhickschiro@gmail.com.  I'm happy to answer any and all of your questions.  To find out a little more about what I'm doing to prepare, check out www.drkenhicks.com.

Thank you so much!!

Ken

story:
My name is Anna Clarissa and I hope to attend the Nutrition Consultant program at Bauman College. It is an 18 month program that teaches students in-depth knowledge about using whole foods as preventative medicine and promoting overall health. The goal of the program is to change the way people consume food from convenience to conscious eating. In my personal research, I have learned a lot about health, and I love sharing what I've learned with others. Currently, I share nutritional tips and recipes through my social media accounts or in person with friends, family, and coworkers. It is rewarding to be able to help others change their lives for the better, and I hope to do professionally as a Holistic Nutritionist. I have decided to do this campaign in order to make that career plan happen.

How it all began......

In the summer of 2010, I became really sick. I lost a lot of weight, I was tired all the time, and one morning, I just flat out fainted in the hallway walking to the bathroom. I went to the doctor's to see what was wrong. They drew my blood, and did all these tests. However, they were never able to figure out what made me so sick. They gave me medication to help with my symptoms, and sent on my way. The medication worked, BUT, like most medications, it had side effects. The side effects created other problems, more symptoms. I had been taking the medication for almost a year when I got fed up. I thought, "this isn't a normal life!". I began to do research on my own and looked up foods that would alleviate my symptoms. It's been six years and all my symptoms are gone! I am off all medication! I haven't taken a pill for anything in years, not even for a cold.


 


The Nutrition Consultant Program

Bauman College's program "provides students with in-depth knowledge of whole-foods nutrition as it contributes to the prevention of illness and the promotion of optimal health. By the completion of the program, students are prepared to work as nutrition professionals, providing expert evaluation of and recommendations for diet, target nutrients, and lifestyle that will support their future clients to or reverse the progression of chronic illness and obtain optimal health."

The program teaches fundamentals of nutrition: physiology, anatomy, macro- and micronutritient, and the effects on the body. Courses for the program include:

Term I

Eating for Health

Digestive Physiology

Biochemistry

Nutrition Analysis

Macronutrients

Micronutrients

Nutritional Counseling

 

Term II
Stress + Endocrine Interactions

Men’s + Women’s Health

Liver Detoxification Gastrointestinal Health

Blood Sugar Regulation

Weight Management

Case Presentations

Clinical Assessment

Cardiovascular Health

Mental Health

Musculoskeletal Health +Sports Nutrition

Immune +Autoimmune

Cancer


https://www.baumancollege.org/programs/nutritio...

Also integrated into the program's curriculum is Bauman's Business Institute to prepare students to work as nutrition professionals. Those classes include modules such as personal branding, defining a target market, social media building, food photography, writing a business plan.

https://www.baumancollege.org/programs/nutrition-consultant/bbi-nutrition-consultant/

 


 


What We Need & What You Get

The break down in more detail:

  • My tuition for the program is $7944, and money raised above that goal would go to school related expenses like books, supplies, and food preparations.
  • All of the perks are from me, and designed around your special dietary restrictions.
  • If I don't reach my goal, I will still find a way to raise the rest of the tuition as I am determined to pursue this path.

Example of ingredients used in body card products. These are ingredients used for the face lotion.

The Impact

  • With the upward trend in clean eating, there is also lots of conflicting information that say "eat that" and later say "don't eat that". I will have the scientific knowledge to support and guide individuals on the diet that is right for them.
  • I will have knowledge (beyond food) to guide people to an overall healthy lifestyle.
  • This program will provide me with the tools to succeed at building a career focused on health.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you can't contribute. Thank you for taking the time to read and look at my page! Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Spreading the word about my campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, word-of-mouth, etc.
  • Take a look at my social media accounts! There are posts with recipes, nutrition, and tips about overall health.
    Instagram:_anna_clarissa_
    Twitter:@AnnaClarissa39
    Snapchat:annaclarissa39
  • And remember to use the Indiegogo share too!

 

 

Thank you everyone for your donations and considerations!



Anna Clarissa

story:
"As someone always up at odd hours working in different time zones and feeling the jet lag, I wanted mental clarity and performance. Sometimes I felt powerless and at the mercy of the elements. No more. After trying Rich Recovery (TM), I could hardly believe there was no caffeine in it. The onset of energy cleared my mind and gave me hours of no-jitter energy with no burnout. I am able to get sleep and not fear for kidney stones like I was before when abusing energy drinks with lots of sugar. Not to mention those godawful artificial sweeteners. Aluminum cans? Leave em at the gas station. Rich Recovery (TM) is a health-conscious alternative with nootropics properties. Highly recommend you try it!"

-Gabriel Nones-Newman

story:
About Gendercast

Gendercast is a free podcast and aims to provide an accessible space to discuss relevant and current topics specific to gender identity and what it means to live in a world where an individual’s gender does not match sex assigned at birth.  We want to create and hold space for the multidimensionality of identity and empower and raise awareness for all voices experiencing oppression. We are an independepent media outlet.

Gendercast is a podcast exploration of gender and what is means to live in, challenge and exist beyond the binary. It is a conversation between all those who identify along the transmasculine spectrum, our allies and supporters. It is a commentary on our culture and a reflection on where we have come from and where we are headed.

Gendercast Needs Your Help

A New Mic  -- Getting Voices to You (see it here)

Since its inception in December of 2010, Gendercast has been a free resource to the trans* community, their allies and supporters, and to anyone wanting to learn about trans* and intersectional issues.  Gendercast has been fortunate to have folks like Rae, Joe and our interns, donate their time and talents to help us develop and share a podcast we are passionate about, and now we need a little help from you.  We need a new mic that we can take with us anywhere, so we can bring guest interviews to you whenever and from wherever. We need help with the cost of sustaining this free podcast, which offers two episodes per month -- often bringing voices to the mic that other forms of media do not give air time to, the trans* community and our intersections with other oppressed groups across race, class, age, ability and more.

Philly Trans-Health Conference (May 31 - June 2, 2012)

Gendercast is also traveling from Seattle to Philadelphia to attend and present a workshop at the Philly Trans-Health Conference.  We hope to meet and connect with many of the amazing presenters and attendees, and to bring back future ideas and interview topics to you, our listeners. We also will be doing a short re-cap on the podcast about the conference, so folks who couldn't be there get an idea of the event and how it went. Travel costs are intense and we need some help, so if you have anything extra to spare, please donate.

More about Gendercast

Our Website

Live stream on libsyn/podcast host

Listen in itunes

story:
Free dental care for vulnerable children

My name is Grischa Primage. I am from Hamburg, Germany and I visited the CWF (http://www.cambodiaworldfamily.com) in February 2012 for the first time. I stayed for 7 weeks and worked as a volunteer and treated in this time about 500 children. Now I am back to help again.

The children are so friendly and thankful for the work that the volunteers and the cambodian staff do. This medical aid project needs donations to work. It is very efficient. For the tratment of one children, they only need 2$. But at the moment they have big problems with the treatment chairs.

Two of four treatment chairs are very old and in a bad condition. Nearly everyday something is broken and need to be fixed. In this time it´s not possible to use the dental chairs. Sometimes it is not possible to treat all children. These children can´t come everyday to the clinic. Some orphanages are more than 50km away and so the children come only 1-2 times a year.

For only 6000$ they can change the two dental chairs and it would be possible to treat all children. Please help us...

story:
Heather Chauvin has dedicated her life to helping people.  She has helped many parents and children through challenging times to find spirituality and peace within their lives.  She is a caring mother of 3 beautiful children, and a loving wife of Bryan Chauvin.  

 

Just recently, Heather had been diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma.  She will be undergoing aggressive therapy, locally and possibly abroad.  Now is the time for us to come together and show Heather just how much she means to all of us.  At a time when Heather needs to shift all focus to herself, let's all focus on her and her family.  Please join us in showing spiritual and financial support to Heather, a women who has touched so many lives and selflessly helped so many people.

story:
Introducing FOR Solutions

FOR Solutions designs and markets state-of-the-art aerobic, in-vessel rotary drum digesters that transforms all food scraps (including meats, bones and shells) along with other organics into a high-quality, nutrient-dense compost in just FIVE days.  It accomplishes this with

  • virtually no odor,
  • no pests,
  • no leachate,
  • an energy-efficient process, and
  • an aesthetically-pleasing design.

Our Vision

The vision of FOR Solutions is one of a world where soil is rich and fertile; where it is sustained by the continuous replacement of vital nutrients derived from uneaten food that has been converted into compost in a biologically and economically efficient manner. A world where all uneaten food that came from the Earth is returned to the Earth: a closed cycle where there is no beginning and more important, no end. 

Our Mission

The mission of FOR Solutions is to instigate the widespread adoption of local food scraps recovery and recycling that will lead to the local production and distribution of nutrient-dense, organically-produced food. FOR Solutions will accomplish this by designing and marketing biologically and economically efficient, aesthetically pleasing, value-engineered, aerobic, in-vessel, rotary drum food scraps composting systems for local recovery and recycling of uneaten food. FOR Solutions intends to make the practice of local, on-site food scraps recovery and composting as commonplace as the now unsightly, smelly garbage dumpster for the collection of discarded organic resources.

                 

Our Guiding Principles

The guiding principles of FOR Solutions are:

  • discarded, uneaten food is not waste until it is wasted; that is, if it is not composted so that the nutrients are recycled,
  • discarded, uneaten food is a vital, replenishable natural resource,
  • we are facing a global crisis related to degraded soil that can no longer grow the food we need,
  • revitalizing that soil using nutrient-dense compost made from uneaten food is the solution,
  • local, on-site composting is the most sustainable form of food scraps recovery and recycling, and
  • local production and distribution of nutrient-dense, organically-produced food is the most sustainable way to ensure food security.

What Do We Hope To Achieve? 

The FOR Solutions technology has proven that it is now poised to make a positive contribution to the the next frontier of recycling: food scraps recovery.  We hope to raise enough funds during this campaign to allow us to dedicate the amount of time and efforts that will be necessary to commercialize fully this remarkable technology.  We hope to change the way the world perceives food scraps from one where they are considered worthless garbage to one where they are considered a valuable, replenishable natural resource!

What We Need & What You Get

As a start-up company, we need capital to pay for operating and manufacturing expenses.  We also need to educate and get the word out about food scraps recovery and recycling. All of this requires your help.

FOR Solutions is proud to walk the walk as well as we talk the talk.  You'll notice that our thank you gifts are consistent with the concept of sustainability insofar as they include items made from 100% organic cotton and contribute to environmentally responsible behaviors such as carrying a reusable water bottle instead of a single-use disposable, plastic one.

On top of our thank you gift, you'll also have the satisfaction of knowing that you took positive action to support an effort that is designed to make the world a better place by addressing one of the most pressing contemporary environmental issues.  How to manage food scraps in a sustainable manner is on the minds of almost everyone that is interested in sustainability.

What About Climate Change?

American generated 40 million tons of uneaten food in 2011, 97% of which was either landfilled or incinerated.  Both of these management options have serious negative environmental consequences, including contributing to climate change. Composting these food scraps is a vastly more sustainable option, especially when the composting is done locally on a small scale using the FOR Solutions technology!

If all of the uneaten food that is generated in America in just one year were to be composted using the FOR Solutions technology, the resultant reduction in greenhouse gas emissions would be roughly the same as if we removed millions of cars from the road!

What About Soil Revitalization?

An area twice the size of the continental United States now has soil so badly degraded that it is unable to grow food as well as it could in the past.  With our ability to produce synthetic fertilizer decreasing due to peak oil and peak phosphorus, it is vital that we not waste the nutrients that are in uneaten food by burying or burning them.  We must transform uneaten food into nutrient-dense compost so that the compost may then be used as a soil amendment to restore vital nutrients to the soil.  Only then, will we have a sustainable food cycle!

    In the Press

    Dr. Nick’s articles about on-site food scraps composting have appeared in publications such as Tech News, the Bulletin of the New Jersey Academy of Science, and Sociological Imagination. 

    Articles about Dr. Nick’s demonstrations of the practicality of on-site aerobic in-vessel rotary drum food scraps composting efforts have appeared in New Jersey Monthly, E – The Environmental Magazine, and BioCycle as well as in several newspapers.

        

         

    FOR Solutions Goes Global!

    On September 25th, FOR Solutions signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Semarak Sinergi Sdn. Bhd., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Malaysian Chamber of Commerce.  FOR Solutions CEO Ed Friedman (front right) and Semarak Executive Chairman Sabri Ahmed Tah (front left) signed the agreement in New York City in the presence of the Prime Minister of Malaysia (back center).  The agreement stipulates that FOR Solutions and Semark will collaborate to explore how the FOR Solutions technology will be the solution to food scraps management in Malaysia.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, perhaps you are able to post information about it on your social networks.  You can help advance the quest for sustainability by advocating for local food scraps recovery, local composting of those food scraps, and use of the compost locally to grow nutritious food that is distributed locally!

    Thank You Gifts

story_txt:
Introducing FOR Solutions







 

FOR Solutions designs and markets state-of-the-art aerobic, in-vessel rotary drum
digesters that transforms all food scraps (including meats, bones and shells)
along with other organics into a high-quality, nutrient-dense compost in just FIVE days.  It accomplishes this
with


virtually no odor,
no pests,
no leachate,
an energy-efficient process, and
an aesthetically-pleasing design.




Our Vision

The vision of FOR
Solutions is one of a world where soil is rich and fertile; where it is
sustained by the continuous replacement of vital nutrients derived from uneaten
food that has been converted into compost in a biologically and economically
efficient manner. A world where all uneaten food that came from the Earth
is returned to the Earth: a closed cycle where there is no beginning and more
important, no end. 


Our Mission

The mission of FOR
Solutions is to instigate the widespread adoption of local food scraps recovery
and recycling that will lead to the local production and distribution of
nutrient-dense, organically-produced food. FOR Solutions will accomplish
this by designing and marketing biologically and economically efficient,
aesthetically pleasing, value-engineered, aerobic, in-vessel, rotary drum food
scraps composting systems for local recovery and recycling of uneaten food. FOR
Solutions intends to make the practice of local, on-site food scraps recovery
and composting as commonplace as the now unsightly, smelly garbage dumpster for
the collection of discarded organic resources.

                 
Our Guiding Principles
The guiding principles of FOR Solutions are:


discarded, uneaten food is not waste until it is wasted; that is, if it is not composted so that the nutrients are recycled,
discarded, uneaten food is a vital, replenishable natural resource,
we are facing a global crisis related to degraded soil that can no longer grow the food we need,
revitalizing that soil using nutrient-dense compost made from uneaten food is the solution,
local, on-site composting is the most sustainable form of food scraps recovery and recycling, and
local production and distribution of nutrient-dense, organically-produced food is the most sustainable way to ensure food security.







What Do We Hope To Achieve? 




The FOR Solutions technology has proven that it is now poised to make a positive contribution to
the the next frontier of recycling: food scraps recovery.  We hope to
raise enough funds during this campaign to allow us to dedicate the amount of
time and efforts that will be necessary to commercialize fully this remarkable
technology.  We hope to change the way the world perceives food scraps
from one where they are considered worthless garbage to one where they are
considered a valuable, replenishable natural resource!

What We Need & What You Get
 
As a start-up company, we need capital to pay for operating and
manufacturing expenses.  We also need to educate and get the word out
about food scraps recovery and recycling. All of this requires your help.
FOR Solutions is proud to walk the walk as well as we talk the talk.
 You'll notice that our thank you gifts are consistent with the concept of
sustainability insofar as they include items made from 100% organic cotton and
contribute to environmentally responsible behaviors such as carrying a reusable
water bottle instead of a single-use disposable, plastic one.

On
top of our thank you gift, you'll also have the satisfaction of knowing that
you took positive action to support an effort that is designed to make the
world a better place by addressing one of the most pressing contemporary
environmental issues.  How to manage food scraps in a sustainable manner
is on the minds of almost everyone that is interested in sustainability.
  What About Climate Change? American generated 40 million tons of uneaten food in 2011, 97% of which was either landfilled or incinerated.  Both of these management options have serious negative environmental consequences, including contributing to climate change. Composting these food scraps is a vastly more sustainable option, especially when the composting is done locally on a small scale using the FOR Solutions technology!
If all of the uneaten food that is generated in America in just one year were to be composted using the FOR Solutions technology, the resultant reduction in greenhouse gas emissions would be roughly the same as if we removed millions of cars from the road!

What About Soil Revitalization?An area twice the size of the continental United States now has soil so badly degraded that it is unable to grow food as well as it could in the past.  With our ability to produce synthetic fertilizer decreasing due to peak oil and peak phosphorus, it is vital that we not waste the nutrients that are in uneaten food by burying or burning them.  We must transform uneaten food into nutrient-dense compost so that the compost may then be used as a soil amendment to restore vital nutrients to the soil.  Only then, will we have a sustainable food cycle!
  In the Press

Dr. Nick’s articles about on-site food scraps composting have appeared in publications such as Tech News, the Bulletin of the New Jersey Academy of Science, and Sociological Imagination. 
Articles about Dr. Nick’s demonstrations of the practicality of on-site aerobic in-vessel rotary drum food scraps composting efforts have appeared in New Jersey Monthly, E – The Environmental Magazine, and BioCycle as well as in several newspapers.

    


     

FOR Solutions Goes Global!
On September 25th, FOR Solutions signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Semarak Sinergi Sdn. Bhd., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Malaysian Chamber of Commerce.  FOR Solutions CEO Ed Friedman (front right) and Semarak Executive Chairman Sabri Ahmed Tah (front left) signed the agreement in New York City in the presence of the Prime Minister of Malaysia (back center).  The agreement stipulates that FOR Solutions and Semark will collaborate to explore how the FOR Solutions technology will be the solution to food scraps management in Malaysia.

Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, perhaps you are able to post information about it on your social networks.  You can help advance the quest for sustainability by advocating for local food scraps recovery, local composting of those food scraps, and use of the compost locally to grow nutritious food that is distributed locally!

story:
are all are about bringing real focus enhancing drinks to life.
We are aiming to revolutionize the market of drinks by bringing the first natural, healthy and effective products to life, made only from high quality ingredients.
For as little as 14USD you can fund the production of the world’s first focus drink.

“A professional esports player usually has like three-hour, five-hour long sessions, which is pretty long. You need a drink like eNgage or diseNgage, which allows you to have a higher and consistent focus that does not let you crash, like other drinks on the market do.” - Carlos “ocelote” Rodriguez

“I really do not enjoy energy drinks as they get me hyped. I preferred diseNgage because it tastes good. I do not know how to explain but I liked it. I actually drank a can of diseNgage in around five minutes. I did not even notice that I was drinking it, and then, all of a sudden, I was like 'Oh, it is gone'.” - Alfonso “mithy” Aguirre Rodriguez

“•I like the concept of having drinks with two purposes, one to relax and the other to keep you going. I would recommend these drinks because they are a little bit different and better than the other energy drinks I've tried, because of the taste and the feeling to it. ”  - Jesper ”Zven” Svenningsen

eNgage is focus enhancing recharge drink that increases your cognitive functions and raises your energy to levels for optimal performance.

Designed for the times when you start to make mistakes due to exhaustion eNgage gives you an added boost of concentration and focus. We use several natural ingredients that are known to have cognitive-enhancing abilities such as Gingko Biloba, Maca and Acai berry.

Other energy type drinks use artificial caffeine which will quickly pump your energy levels to the top. You might think that’s a good thing, but in fact it is proven that an excessive amount of caffeine intake decreases the blood flow to the brain, leading to poor concentration.

However, eNgage uses only natural caffeine in levels that have been optimized to give you the kick you need without compromising on your cognitive functionality.

Most importantly though: eNgage is currently the only focus drink made from natural ingredients.

 

Your brain needs to be in an optimal state when it’s time to diseNgage! Created for when you start feeling frustrated and agitated, diseNgage is a refocus drink that increases your cognitive functions while cleansing all negative emotions. Besides our cognition enhancing formula consisting of Gingko Biloba and Maca, we used Ginseng as the ‘remedy ingredient against saltiness’. There is absolutely no product on the market to which you could compare diseNgage, it’s the product that all of us directly fell in love with just by the taste. Give it a try and we can guarantee you that you will not be disappointed.

Sugar is a vital resource of energy for the brain. If there isn’t enough glucose in the brain, neurotransmitters are not produced and communication between neurons breaks down.

In addition, low glucose levels in the blood, can lead to loss of energy for brain function and is linked to poor attention and cognitive function.

An excessive diet on sugar however is proven to harm the brain functions in the long term as it impairs memory and learning skills.

eNgage and diseNgage are sweetened mainly by sugars from the juices and by natural sweeteners.

Research indicates that a diet high in added sugar reduces the production of a brain chemical known as brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF). Without BDNF, our brains can’t form new memories and we can’t learn (or remember) much of anything.

That’s why eNgage uses natural sweeteners such as natural juices, monk fruit and stevia to balance sugar levels to deliver optimized performance.”

With eNgage & diseNgage we wanted to bring the optimal amount of sugar to the brain that provides your brain with the energy it needs without compromising on your cognitive functionality.

eNgage and diseNgage actually contains around 40% less calories than orange juice and some leading energy drink brands.

 

We are arranging several tastings around Europe and US so join us for a chat and try both eNgage and diseNgage. More venues will be added. For the latest news check out our website.

We want to offer you innovative and completely natural, functional drinks that are more effective, healthy and taste better than today’s unhealthy energy drinks.

 

We believe that a strong brain starts from a good balance of nutrition and therefore there should be morehealthy and efficient drinks out there .

We have now worked over a year on natural formulations that supply the brain with all the nutrition needed to perform optimally over long sessions and we are now super happy with the outcome.

On our journey towards the perfect focus drink we have had a lot of help and joined forces with some of the most talented professionals in beverage, nutrition and esports.


Professionals who know the difference between success or failure will always come down to your brain. You can practice day and night but if your brain is not in the optimal state when it gets to the point you might still lose.

Currently the market is flooded with cheap and heavily sugar loaded drinks. Not only do these drinks not feature any concentration enhancing ingredients but the massive amount of sugars and caffeine contained in these drinks actually slows down the cognitive functions of the brain.

 

Currently we are in the final stage of development and are ready to produce whenever you are.

As with most campaigns here it's about us being able to reach minimum order quantities from our factory. That’s why your pre-order is crucial for us.

All the money raised in this campaign is dedicated to the first production of eNgage & diseNgage so we can deliver  these ground breaking drinks to gamers like you who care about optimal mental performance.

 

By taking part in our IndieGogo campaign you will not only get awesome all natural focus drinks as soon as we can ship to you but in several of our perks you have the chance to meet, play against or with some of the most well-known faces in esport today.


The last 5 years I worked in a company which is specializing in research and development for all types of drinks. During this time I have seen many products targeted towards gamers. Standard energy type drinks are artificial, heavily caffeinated, sugar loaded drinks produced from cheap ingredients that do absolutely nothing good to the body. Even worse many of them have counter-productive effects for people that want to stay focused over longer periods.

Because there was nothing else good in the market I decided to start to develop my own and honestly, the result is even better than what I have ever thought it would be.


We will make this happen and have gathered team from six various countries, fields and backgrounds. All to make sure you get your cans on time.

3

Currently we are in the final stage of development and are ready to produce whenever you are.

All the money raised in this campaign is dedicated to the first production batch of eNgage & diseNgage.

 

Please join in or share this with a friend and make the first drink for gamers by gamers come true.

story:
I am Steve Cersonsky, inventor, engineer, and developer of ARMore.  

    working mostly at my desk, I was always envious of those who had the time and inclination to body build.  I set out to design a machine that would :

    • allow my hands to be free.  Weights did not work.
    • be low profile, so it could be comfortably worn under clothing.
    • be lightweight, durable, and washable.
    • be simple to use, just slip on in the morning when I got dressed.

    My board of directors and consultants come from the fitness, medical, and business world.

      This campaign is to gain mentors in this field.  ARMore is looking for professionals in fitness, health, marketing: To build awareness and gain testimonials through contacts.  

      ARMore comes to market in 2015 for $69.95.

      How many of YOU want to  burn off FAT, build endurance and MUSCLE?

      Imagine if you could do so all day without the hassle?

      ARMore is a new UNIQUE wearable fitness machine.

      Invisible under your clothing, it’s a Comfortable thing.

      ARMore gives that “good” burning sensation that tones:

      Biceps, Triceps, Cartilage, Ligaments, and Bones.

      Even without traditional exercise, testing has SHOWN

      1/4 inch per week your muscles have grown!

      Adjust the knobs for up to 50 pounds of resistivity.

      Similar to chewing gum, ArmOre stimulates repetitive muscle activity.

      Toning, endurance, and burning away Fat, ARMore knows

      it' s not only for Athletes, but also Couch Potatoes. 

      ARMore is anatomically correct with a full range of motion.

      This is truly a space-age technology solution --

      Durable, Washable, Lightweight, and Comfortable.

      Fact is, you could buy two! They’re so affordable!

      The market size is 200M in just the USA, that's $1B today!

      Remember when you want fitness success,

      We build better guns at http://ARMORE.us

story:
Here's how you can help!
1. Donate any amount you would like to gift!(any amount is appreciated)
2. Share with your friends and family and encourage them to gift!
3. Anyone who gifts $20 or more will receive a Worship is a Lifestyle T-shirt from: www.praisefitwear.com
4. After gifting $20 or more please email praisefitwear@gmail.com your shirt size & ship to info!! (be sure to put #TeamJ in your subject line)

READ MORE ABOUT JESIAHS STORY BELOW!!
Jesiah is an 11 yr old boy who suffers from chronic pain caused by a condition called "hydrocephalus", or water on the brain in which his body produces excessive amounts of cerebral spinal fluid. He has endured upwards of 20 brain surgeries to fix this problem. In February 2015 he was diagnosed with an extremely rare, slow growing type sarcoma Cancer called G.I.S.T for which 1/3 of his stomach was completely removed.
Despite much pain and hundreds of days spent in the hospital Jesiah has been blessed to maintain a beautiful attitude toward life! He loves his family and really looks up to his "Grandpa". With Grandpa's help, He recently purchased a rode bike and will ride with ‪#‎TEAMJ‬ from Columbus to Cincinnati to increase Hydrocephalus and Cancer awareness.

Help us help Jesiah & his family!!

For more info see: www.hydroassoc.org and www.cancer.gov/types/soft-tissue-sarcoma
This fundraiser is sponsored by: www.PraiseFitWear.com
