story:
21 September 2016
Dear Indiegogo Community,
We were so busy with making our product better that we haven't spent any time on our campaign, no marketing, nothing. Nevertheless we have 9 contributions on Indiegogo and already two hospitals and a wholesaler got in touch with us to buy STAYCOOL Bands.
We would like to tell you that we finished the STAYCOOL design and we were testing the prototype for two weeks  now, thankfully we got %100 Positive feedback from our testers and we are ready to launch a new campaign and focus on it. That's why we decided to launch another campaign on Early 2017 in this way STAYCOOL Bands will be shipped before the summer.
This campaign ends in less than 5 Days, so we decided give away our first prototypes to everybody supported us on this campaign to thank them, all STAYCOOL team will sign the prototypes and send it to you in addition to your STAYCOOL package.
Thank you for your interest and hope to see you on our next Campaign.
Until then stay cool.
story_txt: 21 September 2016Dear Indiegogo Community,We were so busy with making our product better that we haven't spent any time on our campaign, no marketing, nothing. Nevertheless we have 9 contributions on Indiegogo and already two hospitals and a wholesaler got in touch with us to buy STAYCOOL Bands.We would like to tell you that we finished the STAYCOOL design and we were testing the prototype for two weeks  now, thankfully we got %100 Positive feedback from our testers and we are ready to launch a new campaign and focus on it. That's why we decided to launch another campaign on Early 2017 in this way STAYCOOL Bands will be shipped before the summer.This campaign ends in less than 5 Days, so we decided give away our first prototypes to everybody supported us on this campaign to thank them, all STAYCOOL team will sign the prototypes and send it to you in addition to your STAYCOOL package.Thank you for your interest and hope to see you on our next Campaign.Until then stay cool.

story:
Hole 9, par 4, third stroke, 30 yards to the pin. Before you step up to strike the ball, you take a few practice swipes. Swing one, ti.ttle shows 52 yeards. Too long. Swing two, 17 yards. Too soft. Swing three, 29 yards. Go for it! With ti.ttle on your club, you know how your swing would do before you hit the ball.

ti.ttle is a wearable golf swing analyzer that mounts on your club. It senses your practice swing without the ball and calculates the carry distance and various attributes of your shots as though you actually hit the ball. Aside from helping you with these short games situations, ti.ttle allows you to practice your swing anywhere anytime. 

Like a flight simulator helps pilots train without flying a plane, ti.ttle makes it possible for golfers to hone their game by getting the real-time feedback on the results of each practice swing. This allows you to practice your swing in the comfort of your home.

Also, ti.ttle connects via Bluetooth to your smart phone’s GPS and functions as a e-caddie on the course, pinpointing the distance left to the hole.

ti.ttle is a compact and powerful smart device that helps your game at practice and out on the course.


• I want to improve my touch in the short game.

• I want to perfect my swing with every club.

• I don’t have the time to get out to the driving range often enough. 

• I want to practice in the comfort of my home. 

• I don’t want space-consuming and extravagant equipment cluttering my house. 

• I want a simple easy-to-use device that analyzes my swing with every club. 

• I want a versatile device that can also provide the course information as my e-caddie. 

ti.ttle is a smart and compact golf swing analyzer and an e-caddie all rolled into one. Many features are engineered into the intelligent little wearable device.

CARRY DISTANCE CALCULATOR

Immediately after a practice swing, ti.ttle calculates instantly the projected carry distance using an ingenious swing analysis algorithm. ti.ttle adapts to all club types—driver, wood, iron, wedge, and putter—to produce personalized and accurate swing data. After each practice swing, ti.ttle provides a real-time feedback by displaying the calculated carry distance on the device.  

Clubs Supported: Driver, Wood (3, 5, and 7), Long Iron (3 and 4), Middle Iron (5, 6, and 7), Short Iron (8 and 9), Wedge (Pitching wedge, Gap wedge, Sand wedge, and Lob wedge), and Putter.

REAL-TIME SWING ANALYSIS 

After you swing, tap the button on your ti.ttle device to display real-time swing data. The data includes: projected carry distance, head speed, swing type, club path, and face angle.

The ti.ttle swing algorithm can analyze 9 different swing types: pull hook, pull, pull slice, draw, straight, tail away fade, push hook, push and push slice.

Using a 6-axis MEMs (microelectromechanical) sensor, this small unobtrusive device will break down your swing and give you an immediate feedback so you can adjust your shot tendencies as you practice.

You can display all the attributes of your last swing right on your ti.ttle device with just one tap. Double-tap to switch to golf course information.

GOLF COURSE GPS INFO.

When connected to your smartphone through Bluetooth low energy (“BLE”), the ti.ttle app displays golf course information for over 36,000 courses worldwide. The current hole number and remaining distance to the hole is displayed automatically on your ti.ttle device.

Search for the golf course by country or course name on the ti.ttle app. Select the golf course through the app and automatically track your location on the course through GPS. Customize course settings to choose tee box, green, pin and distance measuring unit.

INDIVIDUALIZED CLUB SETTINGS 

Although ti.ttle can analyze your swing right out of the box, personal calibration gives you even more accurate swing analysis for each of your clubs. Individual club settings can be configured using the ti.ttle app. Once configured, the customized swing analysis data appear directly on your ti.ttle device. The ti.ttle app is not necessary during practice.

Record and compare your average carry distance for each club type. Know precisely which club to grab when you take to the field by tracking average distances.

You can record your new personal best and track your progress with the ti.ttle app.

CONVENIENCE FEATURES (Call Decline & Digital Clock)

While on the course, don’t let the calls distract you from your game. Decline phone calls and check missed text messages on the go with a simple tap on your ti.ttle. (These convenience features are only available for Android users. iPhone users will enjoy all other features except these.)

1. Preparation: Attach a cradle to each of your clubs and insert ti.ttle into the cradle.

2. App installation: Download the ti.ttle app from Google Play or Apple App Store. After installing the app, pair ti.ttle with your smart phone via Bluetooth.

3. Calibration (optional): Calibrate ti.ttle with each of the clubs. Put ti.ttle in calibration mode, hit the ball in the field, and enter the carry distance in the app.

4. Practice:  Put ti.ttle in practice mode, and swing the club without hitting the ball.

5. View the results: If you swing, ti.ttle will display your swing data immediately. Click the button to scroll through your swing info.

What We Need & What You Get

In December 2015, we launched the ti.ttle project through a successful crowdfunding effort. During the campaign, we quickly learned that a 3D swing simulation feature would really make this fantastic product. If we need to raise another $20,000, so we can add a 3D swing simulation function to our ti.ttle app that will show a 3D rendering of your swing in real-time. We are hard at work to improve the ti.ttle app constantly. With your contribution, the 3D swing simulation function will likely be up and running on the ti.ttle app within a month after this campaign closes. 

Thank you for your support and let's continue to work together to make ti.ttle even better and better!!! Please continue to support ti.ttle by sharing with other golf lovers and we promise that all of this will go towards upgrading your ti.ttle experience. 


Risks & Challenges

Even though we have previous experience in the golf market, ti.ttle holds a deeper place in our hearts because it is the first product we have developed completely internally. Until now, we have cooperated with our company's partners and client but ti.ttle is unique in that it is the first golf product that is purely the result of the love and hard work of ULike.

Since our company is focused on technological development and testing, we don't employ any marketing or promotion professionals. Therefore, we are concerned that we may not have done enough to promote a product that we are very proud of.

Through consistent and thorough testing, we have confidence that ti.ttle will work as displayed in our campaign. However, as with any completely new product, there can be hurdles that need to be overcome in the mass-production phase.

We are greatly looking forward to showing ti.ttle to our backers. We thank you so much in advance for your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

Your funding contribution is invaluable. But you have no idea how important your feedback is to us. We invite you to engage in dialogues with us to help us improve ti.ttle. If you happen to wander dangerously close to Orlando, FL around Jan 27-29, please come visit our booth at the PGA Merchandise Show. Come and try ti.ttle yourself. The information is shown below:

Free Registration for PGA Merchandise Show

Click the link above to register for the show. The registration fee is on us! We are at booth 2711.

story:
THE HANGOVER IS OVER!

Over EZ is the only all natural supplement with the unique and exclusive Two Pellets Phase technology TM. Over EZ has time released pellets to protect the liver from alcohol damage helping your body to recover faster.

There is nothing worse than feeling the effects of a hangover and it ruining your next day. Hangovers can happen to anyone, even after only a drink or two. Hangovers occur when a toxin called acetaldehyde is created within your body when alcohol passes through your liver. The all natural Over EZ formula contains essential ingredients that help to flush out this toxin from your body faster resulting in a better morning.

To help flush out the toxins quicker, Over EZ has all created an all natural formula bringing together essential ingredients that work to flush out the toxins caused by drinking alcohol, quickly.



I’ve tried a few hangover products before

"but none of them really worked so I was pretty skeptical when I heard about Over EZ. I have to admit that I was surprised and impressed with how good I felt the next morning. Over EZ is the real deal."
Mark Birnbaum | EMM Group Inc

Not one who usually buys into hype... in this case the hype is real!

"No way to dispute the effects of taking one of these pills. Tried and tested. My productive Friday thanks you!"
Jazz Chohan

Thanks Over EZ for saving me this week!

"This definitely saved my mornings during Art Basel. LA needs Over EZ!" 
 Charlene Woods | SBE Entertainment

Over EZ is a product of EZ Lifestyle, a company committed to providing healthy nutritional supplements using the most advanced herbal formulas to enhance your dynamic lifestyle. Over EZ is the first in a series of lifestyle supplements engineered and developed for those living an active, healthy social life.


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


1. WHAT IS OVER EZ?

Over EZ is an all natural dietary supplement specially formulated to help reduce the hang over effects of alcohol.

2. HOW DO YOU TAKE OVER EZ?

For best results, take 1 capsule with water sometime during alcohol consumption.

3. HOW DOES IT HELP PREVENT HANGOVERS?

In addition to dehydration, a primary cause of hangovers is the result of a toxin called acetaldehyde. Over EZ helps neutralize this toxin and supports the body to defuse it, therefore helping reduce the effects of a hangover by rapidly flushing out acetaldehyde from your body. Alcohol is a diuretic that causes the depletion of beneficial nutrients and vitamins from the body. One Over EZ capsule contains vitamin B2, vitamin B3, vitamin B5, vitamin B6 e vitamin B12, which together make up the B-complex vitamin. The vitamins in conjunction with minerals (magnesium and zinc), Amino acid (L-Cysteine) and others ingredients, such as chicory root extract, milk thistle extract, amla extract, chinese date extract, grape extract and beet juice may help restore balance to the body and can assist it in replenishing depleted nutrients resulting from alcohol consumption. The B-complex vitamin as well as many others nutrients are rapidly depleted from the body due to the diuretic effect of alcohol. The loss of these nutrients adversely affects the central nervous system, which creates the condition we all know as “the hangover.” Over EZ can help replenish these nutrients, thus potentially assisting the body in restoring its natural balance.

4. WHO NEEDS OVER EZ?

Occasional social drinkers and regular heavy drinkers are all subject to the harmful effects of alcohol. The toxin acetaldehyde is produced in the body right from the very first drink. So whether you are about to have mimosas at brunch or party the night away, you need Over EZ.

5. WILL OVER EZ PREVENT INTOXICATION?

No, Over EZ will not prevent intoxication and is not intended to treat or prevent the consequences of excessive alcohol consumption. Please drink responsibly and never drink and drive. Consult a physician if you believe you may have a dependency on alcohol.

6. IS OVER EZ FDA REGISTERED?

Yes, Over EZ is FDA registered and notified.

7. ARE THERE ANY SIDE EFFECTS?

Yes, the side effect is you will wake up feeling better regardless if you have consumed alcohol or not. The ingredients in Over EZ are all natural and promote a healthy balance within your body.

8. IS OVER EZ SAFE?

Yes, it is 100% safe. Over EZ is made of all natural herbal ingredients that are beneficial for your body.

9. DO YOU SHIP INTERNATIONALLY?

Yes we can ship anywhere in the world!

story:
Our Story

 

 After a near drowning experience about five years ago in  rather large surf, I came up with an idea of building an emergency supply of air into a wetsuit. That process has evolved into a design that not only provides emergency air, but distributes floatation in such a way as to increase swimming performance. a swimmer wearing this suit will now be able to swim faster through the water. It doesn't feel like you are wearing anything, you are just kind of suspended. My observation while snorkeling in Hawaii was this is what the astronauts must feel like when floating in space. 

 

My intended focus was to turn this into a surfing tool, but have discovered that there is an endless number of applications. Surfing, snorkeling, boating, rehabilitation, swimming pool recreation, military, river and lake recreation, etc. Designing the vets with food grade Poly urethane also adds the luxury of carrying edibles and drinkables. When inflated, the bladder can sustain a load of several thousand pounds (it could be literally be used a a car jack). 

 

The Impact

 

By making people aware of our Vest, we hope to get the first vests into the hands of our contributors. This is the next big step for us, and you will be a part of the process that launches something that everyone will want to have. By contributing to our project you will make this happen a lot quicker.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need to raise approximately $10,000. This is where we hope you can help us. We still still have some steps in order to finish our tooling and manufacturing, legal and marketing.  Even though we know we will eventually succeed because of the interest we have generated, with the help of your service, we will get there a lot sooner. Presently we are 75% done with tooling on then poly bladders and once that is done we can start building the "Vests". Over the last several years, we have cultivated a very large contact base, so once we have product, we can start world-wide distribution. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Short Summary

LinuxonAndroid is an on going project seeking to get Linux Distros running on as many Android devices as humanly possible! So far we have been able to get over 400+ known working ROM/Device combinations on over 200+ devices.

However, our own range of testing devices is very limited. I myself (The Lead Dev) am a University Student, and one of the other two devs is still in school, thus our income is very, very limited and we are unable to get extra devices.

This has been ok as we have been able to rely on the community to test and report working devices.

But it has come to a point where large bugs on certain devices are unable to be fixed, due to our lack of said devices. We cannot work on the bugs and test our solutions without the device itself to work on.

What We Need & What You Get

This is simple, we need the funds to get the devices that need extra work - these devices will be bought second hand and as cheaply as possible. The more we raise, the more devices we can buy and the more devices we can 'officaly' support and test on!

This is the break down of what the money will go towards (subject to change*)

  • First $250 Will go to buying an Atrix - This device currently has alot of issues with rendering the GUI on some ROMs, we need to know why! Motorola have been kind enough to Donate a Atrix so we don't need to buy one!
  • First $325 will go to buying an Samsung Galaxy Nexus - Being the flag ship google phone this should have offical support!
  • Next $80 will go towards buying a Motorola Lapdock to build a lapdock version of the images
  • Next $250 will go to buying a Nexus 7 - This device has a Tegra 3 processor which currectly can't render Unity correctly (and none of us have a tegra device!)
  • Next $500 will go to buying an Asus Transformer Prime - with the keyboard and docking this is a device (and the other transformers) that will benfit from offical support so we can test and fix all the little bugs with the mouse etc.

*This list is subject to change as we are talking with manufacturers to see if they will donate to the project, if this happens the list will be adjusted to reflect this

The Impact

Currently only 3-4 devices are 'officaly' supported. There are over 15,000 active LinuxonAndroid users, if everyone donationed just 10 cents we would be able to increase this list to 10+ devices!

Check out the perks to see what you can get extra for helping the fund!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but want to help? Spread the word! Make some noise in the Android forums, let people know about the project and this fund raiser!

Next $80 will go towards buying a Motorola Lapdock to build a lapdock version of the images
Next $250 will go to buying a Nexus 7 - This device has a Tegra 3 processor which currectly can't render Unity correctly (and none of us have a tegra device!)
Next $500 will go to buying an Asus Transformer Prime - with the keyboard and docking this is a device (and the other transformers) that will benfit from offical support so we can test and fix all the little bugs with the mouse etc.

*This list is subject to change as we are talking with manufacturers to see if they will donate to the project, if this happens the list will be adjusted to reflect this


The Impact
Currently only 3-4 devices are 'officaly' supported. There are over 15,000 active LinuxonAndroid users, if everyone donationed just 10 cents we would be able to increase this list to 10+ devices!
Check out the perks to see what you can get extra for helping the fund!


Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate but want to help? Spread the word! Make some noise in the Android forums, let people know about the project and this fund raiser!

story:
UPDATE:

With all the donations coming in, Sarah is doing really well financially and we are no longer stressed out about her hospital bills. As of right now, we don’t need any more monetary donations, but if something changes in the future we will let you know! Thanks everyone who has donated money! She would not be doing so well without everyone’s help.

Who is Sarah and why does she need our help?

Sarah is an English teacher in Korea. She is in the hospital with ulcerative colitis and blood clots. She has been in the hospital for over a month now and had two surgeries. She is actually having her third surgery as I write this now and her hospital bills are approaching 10 million Korean won (~$10000) with no end in sight.

In addition, she will be losing her job and with it her health insurance (UPDATE: Joseph Cutler was able to get her insurance extended! So, she has been able to keep her insurance!) because she has been sick so long and unable to work. So, her bills are only going to grow faster from here on out.

On top of all of this, Sarah's husband, Carlos, and her son, Balthazar, live in Colombia and have been unable to join Sarah in Korea. Their original plan was to come to Korea together, but at the last minute, Carlos had issues with getting a visa. They decided that Sarah would go ahead of the family and they would meet her in Korea. After many headaches and piles of costly paperwork, they were just a few weeks away from getting the visa when Sarah got sick.

What We Need...

Right now, we are just focusing on raising enough money to pay part or all of Sarah's hospital bills, but that's really just the tip of the iceberg. Depending on how well the fundraising goes, there is much more that could be done:

  • Medical Expenses: ~$12,000 (This is really only a guess. Hopefully she gets better soon!)
  • Plane Ticket Back To England: $1200
  • General Living Expenses: $2000 to help her while she convalesces and gets back on her feet.

Of course, that is being extremely optimistic. Right now, our main goal is to just make a dent in her hospital bills. If we manage to raise just $500, that would help a lot. If we manage to raise 15 or 20 thousand dollars, then maybe we can help reunite her family!

Why You Should Donate To Sarah...

Here is a little bit more information about Sarah and why you should donate to her:

  • She is genuinely one of the nicest and most caring people I have ever met.
  • As a teacher, she has helped change the lives of children around the world from England to Colombia to Korea.
  • She is the sole supporter of her family back in Colombia.
  • While in Korea, she took on extra work to help teach for an Environment Awareness Program in rural schools to help teach children the importance of keeping our environment clean and using our resources wisely.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, then please spread the word! Persuading someone else to donate is just as good as donating yourself!

story: My mother Nancy is having treatment for small cell cancer in her left lung. She cannot work during this time and cannot make her mortgage payments. Please help me save my mother's house so she can just get better. She should not have to worry  about loosing her home during this terrible time.  As of right now we are no where near our goal.  None of the organizations contacted have helped. Only a few kind hearted people have donated. Time is running out and this is our last hope. Please help.

Please help me save my mother's house so she can just get better. She should not have to worry  about loosing her home during this terrible time.  As of right now we are no where near our goal.  None of the organizations contacted have helped. Only a few kind hearted people have donated. Time is running out and this is our last hope. Please help.

story:
Okay, see that house up there. We're trying to buy it, but there's a problem. We have the money to buy the house but it's a "fixer upper". Namely there's no door, a few broken windows and a giant hole in the floor. Also no appliances. We've been saving up the last few months but still may not have enough to afford the house, the deposits for moving in (electricity, rent, water, etc) AND fixing up the house to make it livable. Which is worrying since we only have until March 20th to effectively find some place to live, this is one of the most viable options for our level of income in the area (lot rent is hella cheap, yo.) and thus, I thought I'd run a flash sale of my stuff from my business to make extra cash.

Unfortunately Storenvy has started sucking and I don't use etsy because it takes out so many fees. So until I find a new place to sell my wares, I thought I'd try out running it through here! You can just donate if you like as well I can't exactly stop you.

But any and all money raised through this site will go to moving expenses, fixing up the house to a livable condition, and turning all the utilities on! After that, Trish and I can survive pretty well on our own two feet.

Here's a link to my FB page for The Potion Shop.

And a list of my currently available scents!

story:
Clearwater is a place for women who have experienced trauma to find healing.  

In 2012, a group of people devoted to trauma recovery founded Clearwater Center for Healing, an Oregon-based nonprofit corporation.  The purpose of Clearwater is to offer cleansing, restorative, and empowering programs for women recovering from trauma. Clearwater provides a safe environment, a sense of community and support, and access to comprehensive and compassionate services.  A pilot program in 2013 was very successful.

In 2014, Clearwater needs to scale-up.  The team will deliver five 8-week programs over the course of the year, spread our message, professionalize and train our peer staff, and make investments to secure Clearwater's future.  

That's where you come in.  We need help.

Clearwater is awaiting approval as a publicly supported, tax-exempt organization. Until we have that approval (which may take up to two years), we can't qualify for most grants, and we can't effectively use many of the traditional fundraising methods.

If we meet this fundraising goal, we can conduct outreach, insure against liability, train our peer staff, secure meeting spaces, and plan for the growth of Clearwater into a robust and vital organization that leads the way in trauma recovery.

What it Really Means

If you help us scale-up in 2014, we can deliver cleansing, restorative, empowering programs to as many as 50 women.  In addition, these funds will help ensure we can stick around--and grow.

Clearwater's program not only helps individuals, it promotes the development of a healthy community.  The lasting effects of trauma--which may stem from many different sources, from intimate partner violence to homelessness and war--are one of the most substantial factors in community deterioration.  Our program brings healing, self-worth, and independence that is at the root of strong communities.

Still Not Sure?

Please watch our video.  Or, Maybe our story can convince you.

One more thing:  Clearwater is focused on delivering programs.  Public support funds go directly to our programs and fundamental operations.  Much of our work is done on a volunteer basis for no pay.  As the organization grows, we will leverage our public support to grow and professionalize the organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this post with friends via Facebook, Twitter, or your favorite social media.
  • Share our story in person.
  • Donate after this fundraiser via our website.
  • Reach out to us.  Join our community of supporters or participate in the program.

story:
Short Summary
My name is Umi Hagitani, and I am an anti-nukes activist who have been active in California since March 11th's Fukushima nuclear accident. I’ve helped build a powerful anti-nuclear organizing network on the west coast and begun building international grassroots collaboration around these issues.

My work visa is recently expired. I am currently in Japan while I attempt to apply for another visa.  I need funding to apply for a new internship visa for another year and half in order to keep my anti-nuclear activism through No Nukes Action. I am also offered an internship at Japan Pacific Resource Network (JPRN) where we will provide support the struggles of immigrants in North East disaster stricken area through bridging the US and Japan grassroots activism. Please help me stay in the United States for another year and a half to solidify these projects so they can continue to thrive and flourish without me. To these ends, I need to raise $5,000 to cover (most of) the costs of renewing my visa, and to do this I need your help! Please contribute to my efforts, a little bit helps, a lot is incredible!

A Brief Summary of What I've Done between 2011 and 2012.
Please see the video above, and some links to my recent works and media appearance.

  • No Nukes Action Committee http://nonukesaction.wordpress.com/
  • Japan--Fissures in the Planetary Apparatus http://www.jfissures.org/
  • May 22nd, 2012 "Nuclear Hotseat" http://www.nuclearhotseat.com/nuclear-hotseat-49-umi-hagitani-the-japan-connection-and-nrcs-jaczko-resigns/
  • May23rd, 2012 "Flashpoint" (From 4:44) http://archives.kpfa.org/data/20120523-Wed1700.mp3
  • Japan Multicultural Relief Fund http://relief.jprn.org/

Why Another 1.5 Years? 
I need to stay in the Bay Area for the next year and a half to continue building on the work I started with No Nukes Action and fulfill the internship position at JPRN. 

First of all, in my opinion, Japan is not a safe place to live right now. This is both because of the direct health risk due to high levels of radiation (air, food, water) and the consistent government deception regarding the nuclear disaster. The government and the media continue to deny the risks people take everyday with actions as simply as gathering in the part or eating out. This affects me personally. I have a heritage in one of the nearby prefectures to Fukushima, Ibaraki. Radiation levels in my mother’s village are incredibly high. Earthquakes, although smaller than the March 2011 Earthquake, still threaten the region. The situation reminds me of Mississippi's after Hurricane Katrina, devastated, but largely overlooked. Still-occurring daily earthquakes keep people on edge, and more crucially, distracted from demanding evacuation from the nuclear contamination.

Everyday that I am in Japan I am forced to make decisions on where I will go, what I will speak out on. I grew up near the beach and spent many years appreciating the Pacific Ocean. However, the Fukushima accident has made being a beach bum impossible, undesirable, and, most importantly, a health risk.

People in Japan are currently trying to establish a legal force to demand compensation (similar to the case that occured after the Chernobyl accident). At the same time, everyone faces the day-to-day threat of exposure to both internal and external radiation. I foresee that Japan will soon be more ready to admit the seriousness of the generational effects of radiation due to Fukushima. 

In the meantime, organizing here in California is helping me to determine how to strategize my next move in order to effectively work on anti-nukes causes eventually in Japan. Right now I believe that I can learn to become an even better “bridge” between Japan and the US by staying in the United States longer.

Ultimately I would like to evacuate my mother from the highly irradiated place where she lives, as well as my friends in Tokyo, but in order to do that, community education and solidarity are needed beyond Japan, which I feel confident in building.

I see Anti-nuclear work as an area to highlight the similarities between the United States and Japan in their lack of democratic process (in regard specifically to energy but not exclusively), as well as masked state violence which is shown through these environmental injustices!

The political impact of the Fukushima nuclear disaster affects multiple communities I've been part of, but their stories are their own and not mine to tell without their participation. I am still dealing with my own trauma from the earthquakes (I lost 7 of my friends in Miyagi Tsunami, and some part of my mother's district was also swiped away), but fortunately I have friends in California and in the places I've traveled and lived who can support my healing process. My own story is much smaller and easier than many, but the effects of the nuclear disaster the tsunami triggered have left me rootless, unwilling and unable to live in my own country, where radioactive contamination is immense and government deception around it is doubly terrifying. 

What I Want to Accomplish:
In the next year and half in the Bay Area, I will work on specific issues, solidifying the projects I’ve begun or helped build. I have 3 main ideas, all of which have to do with creating a both local and international network of Anti-Nuclear struggle:

  1. On the hyper-local level, I am interested in connecting the efforts of Anti-Nuclear activists and projects of the Bay Area. This includes connecting anti-Nuke work against Livermore Lab (trivalleycares.org, http://www.wslfweb.org/) to resistance at Diablo Canyon and San Luis Obispo(mothersforpeace.org). 
  2. On a semi-national level, I am interested in creating a broader network of connection between Anti-Nuclear resistance throughout local sites across the West Coast. This includes connecting resistance at the Hanford site (http://nonukesnw.wordpress.com/) and its downwind/ downstream communities, as it is one of the most radiated sites in the world (http://brainz.org/ten-most-radioactive-places-earth/) to the communities in San Onofre (near LA) resisting Nuclear power.

  3. On the international level, I would like to build a bilingual website and produce a directory of anti-nukes communities in the US and in Japan that each of the communities can utilize as a resource to further connect and aid each others efforts.

  4. In addition, I plan to build more survivor-led self-determination projectsin Immigrant communities in Japan through my work for Japan Pacific Resources Network (JPRN, http://jprn.org/relief).

A Gift for you too!
As an experimental comic artist, I would like to produce more bilingual (or could be monolingual for this time!) comic strips to create an alternative narrative about what I see as an on-going nuclear slavery that will continue giving us generational PTSD. I am hoping that my activist work will inspire me to expand my artwork, and to create comic gifts for my supporters!

If I Don't Reach My Goal
There is a possibility that my visa application will be denied. According to some immigration experts, my experience as an independent learner (I quit schooling at the age 10, and worked and organized for self-taught education, queer issues, adult and immigrant literacy programs) might look like that I am not good enough to reenter the US. In Japan, I graduated high school equivalent of institution through corresponding course works, and only have a proper junior-high school diploma.

If my visa was denied at all, I would like to prepare myself to go back to the US as a tourist to do the anti-nukes reaserach projects (Hanford, Livermore or Diablo) in the West Coast with your support.

Other Ways You Can Support Me...
You can help me out also by: 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Join the facebook event page for this campaign!: https://www.facebook.com/events/118425694973842/
  • To those ends, I'm trying to raise money to cover visa costs, and other legal fees. Of course any amount helps, but please consider contributing as much as you can. 

Thank you for being well, and (with your help) see you soon!

story:
My name is Danielle and I am a firm believer that everything happens for a reason and I have a purpose in my life. God lead me to a very beautiful person in my life a year and a half ago. I have watched my friend struggle for the last year and a half that I have known her. It is one thing to hear a story... but to watch helplessly as your bestfriend and her husband struggle through the battles of cancer is one of the worst feelings in the world and that is why I'm doing this. Here is the story and I hope you would find the kindness in your heart to take a brief moment out of your day to read it, be thankful for what you have, and pray.
 
My friend Chrissy has a husband named Trevor with a very rare and extremely painful terminal cancer that has caused malignant tumors to spread all over his body. You can read about this cancer here:
 
http://www.upmc.com/services/neuroendocrine-cancer/conditions/pages/neuroendocrine-carcinomas.aspx
 
The couple used to make trips once a month from Virginia just to fly down to Florida for chemo treatments at Moffitt Cancer Center because there is only 1 doctor in the whole state that treats this rare kind of cancer. However, the travel took its toll so they both decided to leave everything they have ever known, family and friends in their hometown in Virginia to make a giant move to the state of Florida so they can be closer to Moffitt Cancer Center.
 
Trevor has undergone many chemo treatments and very recently has been in the worst pain of his life and in and out of the hospital. They also just discovered 2 more tumors growing inside of his lungs. Everyday is a struggle for both Chrissy and Trevor. They are a couple entirely devoted to each other and found out of Trevor's cancer very shortly after their wedding day. They are both so young and have a whole life ahead of them but time seems to be of the essence. The struggle has gotten worse as the cancer progresses throughout his body. Each chemo treatment costs thousands of dollars that they cannot afford to pay.
 
In addition to struggling with treatment and doctors bills leaving them thousands of dollars in debt, they also now struggle with common household bills such as power in their house, cable, water, food, and gas etc. Each chemo treatment costs $20,000. To top it all off, Chrissy has tried to do everything she possibly can to help Trevor and her's financial situation and the little health insurance they did have is going to end. She has reached out to various different centers for funding (including Dr. Phil which she is waiting to hear back from) and has been rejected time and time again for no reason at all.
 
It breaks my heart to see someone suffer who doesn't deserve to. I have never met more generous people in my entire life, Chrissy and Trevor have taken care of me and my fiance and continue to do so. They watch our cat while we are away, they let us borrow things whenever we need, and they introduce us to new people and places in our new hometown. Overall they are extremely kind-hearted, true friends and they are always there willing to give a helping hand to me or anyone else in need, but now it is their time, and I want to help return the favor and send blessings and prayers their way.
 

What you can do to help:

Any offering and donation makes a world of difference, even if it is only a couple of dollars. The situation should be a reminder of how grateful we should be in our everyday lives and that life is too short, anything can happen. Anything you can do to help support Trevor's treatments and the bills that keep piling up will be greatly appreciated. Thank you and God Bless.

 
Sincerely,
 
Danielle Pavone
story_txt:
My name is Danielle and I am a firm believer that everything happens for a reason and I have a purpose in my life. God lead me to a very beautiful person in my life a year and a half ago. I have watched my friend struggle for the last year and a half that I have known her. It is one thing to hear a story... but to watch helplessly as your bestfriend and her husband struggle through the battles of cancer is one of the worst feelings in the world and that is why I'm doing this. Here is the story and I hope you would find the kindness in your heart to take a brief moment out of your day to read it, be thankful for what you have, and pray.
 
My friend Chrissy has a husband named Trevor with a very rare and extremely painful terminal cancer that has caused malignant tumors to spread all over his body. You can read about this cancer here:
 
http://www.upmc.com/services/neuroendocrine-cancer/conditions/pages/neuroendocrine-carcinomas.aspx
 
The couple used to make trips once a month from Virginia just to fly down to Florida for chemo treatments at Moffitt Cancer Center because there is only 1 doctor in the whole state that treats this rare kind of cancer. However, the travel took its toll so they both decided to leave everything they have ever known, family and friends in their hometown in Virginia to make a giant move to the state of Florida so they can be closer to Moffitt Cancer Center.
 
Trevor has undergone many chemo treatments and very recently has been in the worst pain of his life and in and out of the hospital. They also just discovered 2 more tumors growing inside of his lungs. Everyday is a struggle for both Chrissy and Trevor. They are a couple entirely devoted to each other and found out of Trevor's cancer very shortly after their wedding day. They are both so young and have a whole life ahead of them but time seems to be of the essence. The struggle has gotten worse as the cancer progresses throughout his body. Each chemo treatment costs thousands of dollars that they cannot afford to pay.
 
In addition to struggling with treatment and doctors bills leaving them thousands of dollars in debt, they also now struggle with common household bills such as power in their house, cable, water, food, and gas etc. Each chemo treatment costs $20,000. To top it all off, Chrissy has tried to do everything she possibly can to help Trevor and her's financial situation and the little health insurance they did have is going to end. She has reached out to various different centers for funding (including Dr. Phil which she is waiting to hear back from) and has been rejected time and time again for no reason at all.
 
It breaks my heart to see someone suffer who doesn't deserve to. I have never met more generous people in my entire life, Chrissy and Trevor have taken care of me and my fiance and continue to do so. They watch our cat while we are away, they let us borrow things whenever we need, and they introduce us to new people and places in our new hometown. Overall they are extremely kind-hearted, true friends and they are always there willing to give a helping hand to me or anyone else in need, but now it is their time, and I want to help return the favor and send blessings and prayers their way.
 
What you can do to help:
Any offering and donation makes a world of difference, even if it is only a couple of dollars. The situation should be a reminder of how grateful we should be in our everyday lives and that life is too short, anything can happen. Anything you can do to help support Trevor's treatments and the bills that keep piling up will be greatly appreciated. Thank you and God Bless.
 
Sincerely,
 
Danielle Pavone

story:
Short Summary

The PNF is where we raise money for children with cancer, brain tumors, and life threatening diseases.

Who I Am

My name is Emmaleigh Butler and I am an A.L.L. Leukemia survivor. I know that children with sicknesses feel icky at times. Weak at times. And they just wanna give up. And that’s why I’m here. To let them know to keep going no matter what! I want to give them hope. I want them to follow their dreams! I want them to fight. So I am going to raise money for the ill children. Visit them in the hospital! Give them gifts. Keep in mind that I am just starting off. I have not covered too many children. I am trying my best though! The children that I am starting off with are the children in Arizona.

            This cause is important to me because I want to let the kids know that it will all be okay, no matter what. I know I wanted to give up… So many times! But the people in my life made it better. Made me believe! I want to be that person in their lives. That person that makes them believe.

            What your donations will help me achieve is:

A 501(c)(3)

Events for the children

Items we will need to help raise more money

And much more!

            My history of raising money:

Bake sale for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society

Door-to-Door multiple times, all the houses in my neighborhood have been visited by me

In the process of a benefit concert

            We need to spread the word! We need to let people know about the PNF! Please Facebook share, twitter share, MySpace share, and text, telephone, however you’d like! We need you to help us. Will you?

story:
This summer ViviendasLeon is taking soccer coaches and soccer players from the U.S. to Nicaragua to run a youth soccer camp in the León community for about 60 local participants ages 5-18. 

Programming:

In conjunction with the Women Win program design tool kit, the Goal Program Life Skills Curriculum, and U.S. Peace Corps Youth Leadership Training modules; VL has created a training program designed to incorporate education in all areas of life and using soccer as a tool to and platform to apply these skills. This training camp is made possible through a partnership with the USF Women’s Club Soccer team. Staff members in the U.S. responsible are Brianna Russell, Program Director and youth soccer coach for SF FC club teams, and the USF Women’s Club team. Leon staff involved include Indiana Garcia, Leon office director and Adolfo Pacheco, Leon travel programs director. Additionally VL is using an international communications resource with The International Platform on Sport and Development.

Outcomes:

Two years ago at our first soccer camp in Leon, Nicaragua VL was able to donate 20 soccer balls, 40 cleats and 50 jerseys and shorts. The camp had 40 percent girl participants and 60 percent boy participants that were living in Leon. Of the seven U.S. participants, four were girls and three were boys. This year our goal is to increase the number of participants from Nicaragua as well as the U.S. and increase the percentage of female participants to be 50 percent from both groups.

Partners:

In collaboration and support from the sports equipment donation non-profit Providing the Gift of Sports (PGS), we plan to attract more partnerships for future camps and to build up a support network to keep this program running for the next five years.

How to get involved:

  • Discuss this opportunity with your soccer teams and organize a team trip together.
  • Come on your own as an all-star soccer coach to help run the camp and experience vibrant Nicaragua!
  • Donate used soccer shoes, equipment, and clothes!
  • Donate on Indiegogo to make this camp happen!

Visit our website for more info: http://viviendasleon.org/wordpress/?p=886

Contact Brianna at: brianna@viviendasleon.org

story:
J o s h began with Mud

Hi! I am Joshua Nece, creator of J o s h Skincare. As a long term sufferer of eczema I personally had the need to create skincare products that would not only alleviate my eczema but also help heal and keep in control. Years ago when living in San Francisco I was introduced to the idea of infusing oils with medicinal plants and herbs. Seeing almost immediate results I started learning everything I could about plants, herbs, essential oils, and anything else that came from the earth that had medicinal qualities for the skin, and started creating products for my personal use. The first product being the Mud mask. After gifting the Mud to some friends, they started encouraging me to actually create a business with these products because they loved the way it made their skin look and feel. In a word: glowy!

So, in 2015 I launched J o s h Skincare in Downtown Los Angeles with a line of 4 skincare products, beeswax candles and incense. I started this venture with an idea, passion, a truck load of determination, and by maxing out all my credit cards. Truly a passion project, as I gave it my everything. The first launch was well received, selling out at events, boutiques, and on Amazon.  I quickly understood their was a return clientele that truly loved the products. So now I am taking all the knowledge and skill from the past four years and restoring the J o s h foundation by creating new products and fine-tuning all procedures. I plan on relaunching J o s h in Palm Springs Ca, with the desire to take J o s h to the next level.  

The Goal

I have set the goal to relaunch J o s h at $35,000 

By relaunching with capital behind me I will be able to take some major steps to grow this business:

-Proper Production Space- I will have an ample space to to manufacture and store supplies will allow me to buy materials in bulk quantities and ensure efficiency and consistency in my products. 

-Equipment- I will be able to buy equipment so I can produce the products in greater scale. For example: mixers, heat plates, wax warmers, 2 stills (to make my own hydrolsols that are used in products), a die cut machine and a printer. 

-Materials- I will be able to restock all the raw ingredients I use at the highest quality and able to buy in bulk prices, bringing down overall costs and making for better price points and profit margins.

-Assistant- I will be able to hire an assistant at 20 hours a week, allowing me to produce more and get the product to more events and in more shops. 

-Marketing- I will be able pay for advertising through Amazon, Google, and Instagram 

The Impact

The impact of your investment is huge for J o s h  to really take the next step in scaling up and becoming a major brand. With this capital I will take the brand to the ultimate level and J O S H will be found on the shelves of stores like Sephora and Ulta.

Continuing J o s h for me is a personal dream. Everything I have experienced and learned through doing this project has had a huge impact on my personal life. It has shown me how creative and strong I actually am. I have learned that I am a very capable person and can rely on my own passions. I have felt empowered through all of this process which has been amazing and new for me. What used to hinder me (my eczema) has become the very thing that drives me to push further. It is amazing and I feel I've only just begun.

Please feel free to review Business Plan here https://pitch.liveplan.com/XdrTh/gQHPi

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help by donating here, I urge you to tell your friends about it. Getting the word out is hugely helpful. No donation is too small. Every dollar really helps to make this happen!  

THANK YOU!.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Friends, Aaron Lerner here.  If we don't already know each other, I am 34 years old, born in Kansas City, MO, live in KCMO, and am creator of the Doc Lerner Quality Goods speciality line of all-natural, handmade skin products.  

At age nine I was diagnosed with severe plaque psoriasis. This was the first major turning point in my life. It forced me to start paying attention, closely examine and become a student of the body's largest organ--the skin--from a very early age.  The older I got, the more passionate I became about learning everything I could about skin. Specifically, how, what and why one's skin might react in adverse ways.  After more than 20+ years of dedicated research, personal experience, and extensive study, these carefully-crafted products were born out of need. They represent the culmination of my life's work in this area (thus far), and for that reason, this campaign is more than simply important; it is necessary.  

It can't be done alone, however.  Hence, the creation of this site, and the hope of earning enough trust, product belief and excitement among friends, family and anyone else who sees the need for these products to gain your support. 

Put simply, I need believers: people who see the potential, and have the desire to play an integral part in bringing these one-of-a-kind products to the people of Kansas City and beyond.  Whether a small financial donation is something you have the ability to contribute, or not, you can still help simply by passing the word along to a friend who might be interested.  This can be every bit as helpful, and is certainly equally appreciated.

With your assistance, we have the chance to turn this project into something big.  The feedback has been thorough and outstanding.  If you can part with a few bucks--no more than the price of a latte at Starbuck's--you could potentially help improve the lives of thousands of people, while also taking pride in knowing that you had an integral role in helping turn this dream into a reality.  And for that, I will forever be grateful!

What We Need 

  • In order to take this project to the next level, a team of creative and talented professionals must be brought in.  That said, I have chosen to work with the great people at Utilitarian Workshop, a small marketing and brand development company that specializes in handmade goods. I am confident that with their help, and yours, we will be able to bring Doc Lerner's Quality Goods to a store near you, wherever you may live!
  • The plan has already been set in place, and will compose of three phases, each of which will cost approximately $3,500--hence the $10,000 goal.  The first phase will consist of refining the concept, the brand and the visual direction.  Phase two will take care of all print and collateral development, and phase three is for web design and development.  It goes without saying that all of these things are extremely important--essential, in fact--for any small business hoping to expand.
  • If the $10,000 goal is not reached, any effort--whether financial, or by simply spreading the word--will not be wasted.  Anything and everything helps, and every penny raised will be used for nothing other than to get this project launched!

The Impact

  • Besides playing an integral role in advancing what has been a lifelong process for me, your contribution goes much further than that.  Whether you knew my dad as a patient, friend, colleague or acquaintance; or only knew of him through one of his five children or other family members, his legacy was a powerful one and should be kept alive.  By further educating people on health, well-being, and offering products that will improve complexion, address various chronic conditions and enhance natural beauty, the intention is to do just that. 
  • The bottom line is that I have taken this as far as I possibly can on my own.  With banks not interested in lending money to ventures as important as this one, the impact that each individual can make is much greater than they could ever know.
  • To learn more about this project, see the products, and get more information on the unique niche that has been hit upon, please visit etsy.com/shop/DocLerner, or Like us on Facebook at facebook.com/DocLerner. There you will find everything needed to know exactly what sets us apart from the thousands of other skin care products that currently exist and why there is a need for products such as these.  As I like to remind people, "Burt knows Bees.  Doc knows Skin."

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Times are tough for most these days, and I am fully aware that dollars are hard to come by.  For that reason, not everybody will be able to make a financial contribution, and that is ok.  There are still plenty of other ways to help, such as helping to get the word out, and make some noise about this campaign through your social media accounts and good ol' word of mouth.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to help make spreading the news as simple as could be!
  • Our goal is to get 1,000 people to donate an average of $10 each.  So if you can only donate $5, not only will your donation be as valued and appreciated as any other, but maybe you know someone else who might be able to donate $15.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The RightFit Prosthetics Initiative

Making Prosthetics That Fit Lives

We are a team of engineers and prosthetic practitioners from Johns Hopkins University. We are designing a low-cost prosthesis to improve rehabilitation and mobility for amputees in the developing world. It’s not just about making a cheaper device. We want a solution that fits patients’ lives and gives them the freedom to do the things they want and need to do.

THE NEED

Globally, there are 10 million amputees, and that number is increasing. Every year, over 100,000 below-knee amputees alone are added to that number. However, 80% of people who need a prosthesis cannot obtain one. In the developing world, many civilians live with disabilities as a result of war, conflict, and vehicle accidents.  They are unable to work and participate as integral members of family and society because of their lack of mobility and social stigma.

The socket – the component that directly contacts the patient’s limb – is the most important part of a prosthesis. If the socket doesn’t fit, the entire prosthesis is useless. Molding an intimately fitting socket requires training and often special equipment only available at prosthetic clinics. As a patient’s limb changes over time, the socket that once fit can become painful, but it is difficult to make these adjustments without an entirely new prosthesis. Patients need 15-20 devices in a lifetime to accommodate these physical changes and wear-and-tear. In low-resource settings, where many people are below the poverty level, the cost is prohibitive due to the long distances to prosthetic clinics, expensive components, and limited trained personnel.

OUR SOLUTION

We have designed a low-cost and easily adjustable below-knee prosthesis. The unique material we are using for the socket can be shaped and re-shaped so that the fit can be modified as the patient’s limb changes over time. Most of the components can be purchased locally, making repairs and adjustments convenient and affordable. With our method, the time to make a prosthesis can be reduced from weeks or days to hours, so patients and the technicians making their prosthetic devices can be more productive members of society.

What You Can Do

In the next year, we’re heading to Guatemala, India, and Nigeria to share our device with partners in the field to get real end-user feedback on our device and learn more about organizations and health networks already in place. Here are our objectives:

1) Speak with health officials, physicians, physical therapists, prosthetic technicians, social workers, patients, and other people that are affected directly and indirectly by amputation and disability to expand local networks and assess customer needs.

2) Fit 10-20 patients in each region and train local technicians to use our fabrication process so we can introduce our idea. 

Your generous donations will help us travel to these locations so we can move one step closer to our goal of bringing affordable prosthetic care to those who don’t currently have access. Most of the funds will go towards airfare and in-country housing, but we also need to bring materials with us so we can fit people with our device. Every dollar counts!

To give you a sense of our costs:

$25 = 1 prosthetic socket

$75 = 1 whole prosthesis

$150 = 5 prosthetic feet

$500 = All in-country transportation in Guatemala and India

$1000 = 10 whole prosthetic devices + technician training

$2000 = 1 roundtrip to Guatemala for 2 team members (airfare+housing)

Here are the funding benchmarks that we need to reach:

1) Raise $3,500 to pay for our airfare, in-country transportation, prosthetic devices, and technician training for our entire Guatemala campaign in Fall 2014

2) Raise $5,000 for our entire trip to India in Winter 2014

3) Anything raised above $8,500 will go towards our trip to Nigeria in Summer 2015

*4% of the donations will go to Indiegogo for running this service, but 100% of the remaining funds will go towards materials and travel expenses specifically for these three trips. No member of our team will be receiving income or administrative fees.

What You Get

To thank you for your donation, we will keep you updated on our project via updates on our Facebook page. We also want to support local members of the communities that we visit, so we will be sending you hand-made artisan crafts.

Your Impact

A prosthetic leg does not just affect the individual who wears it. A prosthesis is part of a greater system. A ten-year-old child with a prosthesis can return to school, participate in sports, and help out his siblings. The child no longer needs around-the-clock care, so the parents can work without worrying about who will watch him. The child will grow up and get a better job than he would have without a leg because of his education. 

Your support will help thousands of people around the globe regain their mobility and independence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t donate, please spread the word about our project!

-  Post on Facebook, Twitter, your personal blogs, etc.

-  Share this campaign with friends and family using the links below the project title

Other Information

If you want to know more about who we are and what we’re up to, please visit our Facebook page or email our team leader Rochelle at rdumm1@jhu.edu.

A special thanks to our partners and advisors at:

-  The Center for Bioengineering Innovation & Design (CBID)

-  The Johns Hopkins School of Medicine

-  The Johns Hopkins Whiting School of Engineering

-  Dankmeyer Incorporated

- Transitions Foundation of Guatemala
story_txt:
The RightFit Prosthetics InitiativeMaking Prosthetics That Fit Lives
We
are a team of engineers and prosthetic practitioners from Johns Hopkins
University. We are designing a low-cost prosthesis to improve rehabilitation
and mobility for amputees in the developing world. It’s not just about making a
cheaper device. We want a solution that fits patients’ lives and gives them the
freedom to do the things they want and need to do.
THE NEED
Globally,
there are 10 million amputees, and that number is increasing. Every year, over
100,000 below-knee amputees alone are added to that number. However, 80%
of people who need a prosthesis cannot obtain one. In the developing world,
many civilians live with disabilities as a result of war, conflict, and vehicle
accidents.  They are unable to work and participate as integral members of
family and society because of their lack of mobility and social stigma.
The
socket – the component that directly contacts the patient’s limb – is the most
important part of a prosthesis. If the socket doesn’t fit, the entire
prosthesis is useless. Molding an intimately fitting socket requires training
and often special equipment only available at prosthetic clinics. As a
patient’s limb changes over time, the socket that once fit can become painful,
but it is difficult to make these adjustments without an entirely new
prosthesis. Patients need 15-20 devices in a lifetime to accommodate these
physical changes and wear-and-tear. In low-resource settings, where many people
are below the poverty level, the cost is prohibitive due to the long distances
to prosthetic clinics, expensive components, and limited trained personnel.OUR SOLUTION
We
have designed a low-cost and easily adjustable below-knee prosthesis.
The unique material we are using for the socket can be shaped and re-shaped so
that the fit can be modified as the patient’s limb changes over time. Most of
the components can be purchased locally, making repairs and adjustments
convenient and affordable. With our method, the time to make a prosthesis can
be reduced from weeks or days to hours, so patients and the technicians making
their prosthetic devices can be more productive members of society.
What You Can Do
In
the next year, we’re heading to Guatemala, India, and Nigeria to share our
device with partners in the field to get real end-user feedback on our device
and learn more about organizations and health networks already in place. Here
are our objectives:
1) Speak
with health officials, physicians, physical therapists, prosthetic technicians,
social workers, patients, and other people that are affected directly and indirectly
by amputation and disability to expand local networks and assess
customer needs.
2) Fit
10-20 patients in each region and train local technicians to
use our fabrication process so we can introduce our idea. Your
generous donations will help us travel to these locations so we can move one
step closer to our goal of bringing affordable prosthetic care to those who
don’t currently have access. Most of the funds will go towards airfare and in-country
housing, but we also need to bring materials with us so we can fit people with
our device. Every dollar counts!
To
give you a sense of our costs:
$25 = 1 prosthetic socket
$75 = 1 whole prosthesis
$150 = 5 prosthetic feet
$500 = All in-country transportation in Guatemala and India
$1000 = 10 whole prosthetic devices + technician training
$2000 = 1 roundtrip to Guatemala for 2 team members
(airfare+housing)
Here
are the funding benchmarks that we need to reach:
1) Raise $3,500 to
pay for our airfare, in-country transportation, prosthetic devices, and
technician training for our entire Guatemala campaign in Fall
2014
2) Raise $5,000 for
our entire trip to India in Winter 2014
3) Anything
raised above $8,500 will go towards our trip to Nigeria in Summer
2015
*4%
of the donations will go to Indiegogo for running this service, but 100%
of the remaining funds will go towards materials and travel expenses
specifically for these three trips. No member of our team will be receiving
income or administrative fees. 
What You Get
To thank you for your
donation, we will keep you updated on our project via updates on our Facebook page. We also want to support local members of the communities that we visit,
so we will be sending you hand-made artisan crafts. 
Your Impact

prosthetic leg does not just affect the individual who wears it. A prosthesis

story:
UFO-Track™ is a real-time UFO alert system

Would you like to receive an alert
that a UFO is nearby?
That's just ONE of the perks of
becoming a Track Member!



We have collected over 40% of the funds we wanted to collect, from here and elsewhere, so we've already hit the 'go' button for the planned project finalization and launch. Now is the best time to lock in your lifetime Track Membership!

Will you be ready?

We are developing a network of socially interactive smart phone apps, integrated with a website to automatically detect and alert our members of the presence of anomalous events near them.  Starting with a smart-phone apps integrated with a database, website, we can automatically detect the presence of an anomaly, calculate a path and send out alerts to Track Members - even telling them which direction to look.

By proactively engaging multiple witnesses, multiple cameras, and automatically logging exact time, date, location, and multiple witness pattern information, we can dramatically increase the credibility level of UFO sighting events. This grand experiment has the potential to provide earth-shattering evidence of the existence of UFOs. Will you join us in this quest?

We are creating a network of smart phones running a background app that detects changes in the earth’s magnetic field in real time. 

Users will be notified immediately when their phone detects an anomaly. More importantly, Track Members, even those not running the app, will receive text notifications when magnetic anomalies are occurring near localities of their choice.

The app is under development. It uses the equipment already present in today’s smart phones. When the phone is at rest, such as at night, while being charged, or just sitting on a table, it automatically monitors the magnetic field of the earth. Alerts happen as soon as one or more of these phones detects a significant disturbance in the field. A local notification will alert the user, and report back to a central computer system the event’s location, date, time, and magnetic signal data. That system will send out text alerts to Track Members near the anomaly, to alert them that something has been detected nearby, perhaps headed in their direction. This should provide an opportunity to quickly go outside (camera or binoculars in hand) and "look up" to see if there is anything in the sky. As a Track Member, you also get text alerts about sightings nearby, or at multiple locations of your choice around the country, perhaps where friends or relatives live.

UFO Track wants to get more eyes on the skies and have people at-the-ready with their cameras and equipment, so that we can verify UFO events with multiple-source, undeniable, verified, quality hard evidence.

 NOTE: During this campaign the newsletters are available for all to review. Click here. Then lock in your lifetime Track Membership to get them every week! 


Yes, there is evidence this will work to detect UFOs 

There is strong evidence that magnetic field anomalies do occur in association with at least some UFO sightings where compasses or similar navigational equipment is in operation. For example, in 1969 the Air Force sponsored Project Blue Book study was closed, with all but 701 of the 12,618 researched sightings explained away as balloons, birds, aircraft, clouds, planets, and swamp gas. Those 701 remaining cases were sightings they couldn't explain away, no matter how hard they tried. Several of those high-quality sightings involved significant military compass anomalies while UFOs were being observed by multiple witnesses.

Today, a typical cell phone's sensors are sophisticated enough to easily detect even a minor disturbance in the Earth’s magnetic field.

 

Anyone can watch where events are happening

Once a reading has been received by the central processing website, it displays a blip on the map at UFO-track.com. Anyone can monitor this web site at any time, but as a Track Member you also get the all-important instant text message alerts, a members-only real-time chat room, a weekly newsletter containing summary data, access to archived weekly data, and other benefits.

If a significant, correlated pattern of magnetic anomaly events is detected at the central processing website, a 'level 2 event' will be recorded and displayed on the online map, and Track Members in those areas, or on a projected trajectory, will be immediately notified via text or email messages. This should provide a way to get out in front of a UFO and get great evidence.

About us

John, EJ & Mike came up with the concept of the UFOTrack™ project when they considered the question, "What would it take to determine the path of a UFO and alert the people out ahead of it so we could document the event?"

John Craig is a certified UFO investigator and has been interested in the field all of his life, having experienced several unexplained events by constantly watching the skies. He also has debunked many UFO sightings, including some of his own, by using advanced mathematics, physics, astronomy, plus some critical thinking and analysis. He has authored multiple computer programming books for Microsoft Press and O'Reilly, and created cutting edge programs to compute precise sun position for solar energy fields. Recently he has created software for Archaeoastronomy researchers to help understand archaeological sites that engage celestial movements. UFO-Track, and his soon-to-be-published book How to Investigate UFOs with your Smart Phone, are the product of a lifetime of John’s accumulated skills, experiences and knowledge.
  

EJ Thornton is a business owner, author, lecturer, and educator who has published acclaimed books through her publishing house, Books to Believe In.  EJ is the coauthor of Spirit Mound, a book about the “short, gray, large headed people” who, according to Lewis and Clark’s journals, lived at the top of Spirit Mound in South Dakota, a hill where Native Americans refused to venture.

 


Mike Flanagan is an IT expert and software engineer. Mike is creating UFOTrack’s superior smart phone app as well as core server database and reporting software to expedite monitoring and reporting of anomalies as well as informing and mobilizing Track Members.

 

Make history!

As one of our Track Members, you could be part of a history-making event should this system be able to notify you in time to witness an event. This is a grand experiment, with no promises of success, but we sincerely hope and believe that a proactive approach to UFO studies might unlock cosmic secrets of earth-shattering significance. Imagine how it’ll feel to be a part of this historic turning point for this planet!

To our knowledge, nothing of this scale has ever been attempted before. It’s a ground floor opportunity, and the sky's the limit, literally, as to what can be discovered when we coordinate our search efforts in a socially interactive and cooperative way.

Why wait for any government or military disclosure? Let's proactively go after the truth now!

UFO-Track™ is truly an idea whose time has come.

Goals of this project

The app has passed proof of concept stage, and the web site development is underway. 

The app and the web server functionality are targeted for completion before Feb 15. Join now to help us get there!

Now we need:

  • A PR campaign for users to download the app to create a network of coordinated sensors.
  • Mobilize Track Members who wouldn't miss this opportunity for the world, or any other world!
  • Scalable, high quality server software and database components to allow handling as many app users and members as possible, with near 100% up-time with top security.
  • Publish a weekly newsletter for all Track Members. (See example here)

Going further

John has created several award winning consumer electronics inventions. If sufficient funding becomes available, a stand-alone detection and reporting device is on the drawing board. Schools, clubs, businesses, homes, and other fixed sites would benefit from this increased ability to monitor the Earth’s magnetic and gravity fields. Where possible, combining these sensors with all-sky cameras at these fixed locations could provide amazing results.

Be part of the team

If you are a member of a UFO organization or paranormal research group of any size, we want to hear from you. How can we integrate your goals and efforts with ours? Sharing this project with your members can help us all.

We need lots of app users, so spread the word about this important project, and how easy it is to help by simply running the app on your smart phone. You can buy a stand-alone “UFO Detector” at Amazon for about $50, but this UFO-Track app goes so much further, adding the unique and very important proactive social elements and analysis to this project.

Become a Track Member of this project. As a Track Member you get those all-important text and/or email notifications when events occur at geographic locations of your choice, gain access to the members-only real-time chat room, receive our weekly newsletter containing summary data about this project, and links to UFO sightings and related topics in the news. As we build an archive of this data over time, Track Members will have access to it all, for review or research efforts. During this campaign, your one-time membership donation makes you a life-time Track Member. After the campaign, the membership subscriptions will be on an annual basis. Join today to ensure your lifetime membership!

Take action now

Check out our great selection of backer rewards. We're sure you'll find the option that's just right for you. Don't wait, now is the time to cooperatively share in this important proactive effort to uncover the truth!

  • Sign up for our weekly newsletter.

  • Run the soon-to-be-launched UFO Detector App if your smart phone allows, and encourage others to run it too.

  • Become a "lifetime" Track Member at a special one-time low cost to join.

  • Become a "lifetime" Track Member and get a cool T-shirt.

  • Pre-order John's new book, How to Investigate UFOs with your Smart Phone.

  • Use Indiegogo's nice sharing tools to help us spread the word about this important project.

  • Please share on Facebook, Twitter (#ufotrack), and any other social media sites. 

Now imagine this…

What if the UFO-Track project had been up and running when the “Phoenix Lights” event occurred in 1997? A large object, seen by many witnesses (including the governor), flew low and slow over the city early in the evening, and the Air Force dropped flares at the edge of the city two hours later. How many more witnesses might the UFO-Track project have created? Imagine the impact that precisely time-logged data and the mapped path of the object could have provided, and how easily the confusing flares could be isolated from the real object sighting! If Track Members had been notified as the detected events continued to move in their direction, how many quality, cross-correlated photographs and videos would have been captured? 

Let’s be ready for the next big UFO event. Let’s make history together.

 

Will you be ready?
