story: .

At Amino Labs, our goal is to make genetic engineering accessible to everyone and enable the next wave of personalized manufacturing using  biology. 


Amino is our first product, a counter-top sized biolab that enables anyone to grow living cells to create new and interesting things - like fragrances, flavours, materials, medicine, and more.


To get you started, Amino ships with Amino Glow App - your own ready-to-engineer living nightlight.






Everything in Amino is easy to follow and to understand —we try to explain it all in a very friendly way, but it is also a very sophisticated system that can be used in pro labs too— Amino enables you to to continuously grow living cells and collect multiple sources of data in real time. When you get your Amino, we will cover all the basic terms, concept and science but if you want to go much deeper in the science and creation, we will help you do that too! 

Amino is a small and simple-to-use hardware system that enables anyone to grow and take care of living cells. We are the world’s first publicly available bioengineering platform that can be used at home, in labs or in schools.


Here is a timelapse of bacteria we engineered to be red! 



All living cells have DNA in them that tell the cells what to create, how to grow, and how to interact with their environment. DNA is kind of like a software program for living cells, and the cells are like the mini factories that run the DNA programs. At Amino, we think of DNA programs like an Android or iPhone "Apps" for living cells.

But even more, keeping living cells alive outside of their normal environment requires other growth liquids, like food, and chemicals. Amino Apps are a combination of the DNA programs and the growth liquids.

Living Cells + DNA program + Growth Liquid = Amino App

We are also developing a way for you to be able to add your own substances too (create your own growth liquid) — what happens if you give you living cells coffee, vinegar, apple juice?  You tell us! 

With Amino, you can create endless applications and, as the system develops it will be easier to share, compare and create new Apps for yourself and the community.



Amino replaces traditional bulky lab equipment with a self-contained desktop system -- what is special about the technology behind Amino is that it reduces what usually costs thousands of dollars to just a few hundred. And with the automated data capture, you'll learn more about how your cells are growing than it is possible with present day lab equipment.

Amino was started at the MIT Media Lab by founder Julie Legault. After experiencing the difficulties of learning synthetic biology from textbooks and online material, Julie decided to create a mini-lab that could help other people learn science by doing it. Having the opportunity to learn and explore an impactful science like bioengineering should be given to everyone -- just think of what we can achieve when a 1000x + minds are working on problem-solving and creating for the next century!

If you want to know more about the story behind Amino coming out of MIT's Media Lab, read our blog post here 

Following graduation, Julie teamed up with her old Concordia University and Montreal maker friends at Robocut Studio in Montreal to develop a reliable, multi-use system. And now, Amino Labs is made up of a talented anti-discplinary team of people with expertise transcending design, manufacturing, electrical / mechanical engineering, product development and synthetic biology.  We are now a multi-location team as well, developing the hardware in Montreal, the science in Toronto, the business in San Francisco, the software in Boston, and the design wherever Julie happens to be. We are also fortunate to have the support of amazing mentors and partnerships without who developing Amino would not be possible .

Amino is for everyone -- that means that the user interaction and the reliability of the platform is crucial. We've made sure to keep our Aminos friendly, playful and powerful, focussing on user feedback to lead the design development.  

Here are a few picture of some of the early prototypes, and design research that got us this far!

"I think of Amino like Tamagotchi pets, except rather than taking care of a digital dog or cat, here you’re taking care of bacteria or yeast. In that process you, your family, and your friends will learn about how your microbes work - you might even love them"  - Julie, CEO, on the inspiration for the user experience of Amino



Fall 2015 - Beta Test with Schools and Museums

Winter 2015-16 - In house production (First 25 units)

Spring - Summer 2016 - Small batch production (Next 50-100 units) & New DNA kit Development

Fall 2016 - Launch of new DNA kits & Amino Companion Units Development

Winter 2016- 17 - Large scale production / Manufacturing

To get to our first batch of 25 hardened, hand crafted Amino One's, we need to raise $12,500. Further Amino One production is a matter of materials and time for assembly, which are covered by the rewards. 

After Amino One’s are delivered and deployed, we'll ask you for feedback and make future Aminos even better before we move into full-scale manufacturing.
story_txt:
Supported by        

At Amino Labs, our goal is to make genetic engineering accessible to everyone and enable the next wave of personalized manufacturing using  biology. 
Amino is our first product, a counter-top sized biolab that enables anyone to grow living cells to create new and interesting things - like fragrances, flavours, materials, medicine, and more.

To get you started, Amino ships with Amino Glow App - your own ready-to-engineer living nightlight. 










Everything in Amino is easy to follow and to understand —we try to explain it all in a very friendly way, but it is also a very sophisticated system that can be used in pro labs too— Amino enables you to to continuously grow living cells and collect multiple sources of data in real time. When you get your Amino, we will cover all the basic terms, concept and science but if you want to go much deeper in the science and creation, we will help you do that too! 
Amino is a small and simple-to-use hardware system that enables anyone to grow and take care of living cells. We are the world’s first publicly available bioengineering platform that can be used at home, in labs or in schools.

Here is a timelapse of bacteria we engineered to be red! 




All living cells have DNA in them that tell the cells what to create, how to grow, and how to interact with their environment. DNA is kind of like a software program for living cells, and the cells are like the mini factories that run the DNA programs. At Amino, we think of DNA programs like an Android or iPhone "Apps" for living cells.
But even more, keeping living cells alive outside of their normal environment requires other growth liquids, like food, and chemicals. Amino Apps are a combination of the DNA programs and the growth liquids.
Living Cells + DNA program + Growth Liquid = Amino App
We are also developing a way for you to be able to add your own substances too (create your own growth liquid) — what happens if you give you living cells coffee, vinegar, apple juice?  You tell us! 
With Amino, you can create endless applications and, as the system develops it will be easier to share, compare and create new Apps for yourself and the community.


Amino replaces traditional bulky lab equipment with a self-contained desktop system -- what is special about the technology behind Amino is that it reduces what usually costs thousands of dollars to just a few hundred. And with the automated data capture, you'll learn more about how your cells are growing than it is possible with present day lab equipment.

One year in the making with an amazing team from MIT Media Lab and Montreal Makers, the Amino is to biotechnology what 3D printing did to manufacturing. With Amino, we hope to help make genetic engineering and synthetic biology accessible to everyone and enable the next wave of innovation in science, like 3D printing has done for physical products. 
Synthetic biology and wetware is poised to be the dominant technology of this century, the way electrical engineering was for this last century. It allows scientist to problem-solve food, energy, health and materials in sustainable new ways. By bringing the science out of the labs with the Amino, we are enabling everyone to take part in their own future by creating and problem-solving at home and in the DIY labs.  Amino gives you a chance to experience this impactful technology, hands on.
What if many millions of people from around the world could help solve cancer, instead of a small number of scientists?





For our first product, the Amino One, you get to choose between Amino Glow which glows like a night light and Amino Explorer which allows you to explore a variety of DNA programs, like optimizing the pathway for violacein production, an expensive anti-cancer, anti-parasitic research compound. 
Amino is a general platform that allows you to buy different Amino Apps to grow and take care of different living systems in your Amino! This means that whatever Amino One unit you end up buying, you will be able to run different Amino Apps as we develop them. Apps will be priced between $150 and $400, depending on the DNA program and number of components. Amino also comes with an automated cleaning system to allow you to run a new app, and you will also be able to buy food refills to keep your apps growing longer and brighter!





Amino Glow - Early Adopters - $499
Early Adopter Amino One with the Glow App ships in March 2016 and is $499 with a limited quantity of 25 -- hand assembled in the cold Montreal winter. With a follow up production run slated for shipping in June 2016.
Amino Explorer, Amino Glow Aluminium and Amino Glow Mahogany $699-1799
Other special edition Amino Ones will ship in June 2016 with either the Glow App or the Explorer App. 
Want to learn more? Pick a workshop!
Amino Labs and Synbiota offer you the chance to have an exclusive 3 day workshop where you will design and create a DNA program, and use your Amino One to the program in your living cells, grow them and keep them alive.  Not only will this be a great chance for you, your friends and kids to learn more about synthetic biology from an expert Dr. Justin Pahara and explore the creative side of making with designer Julie Legault, but you will also get to keep an engraved Amino to continue exploring and making in the future!



(Left: Founder Julie attends her first synbio Synbiota Workshop!  Right: Julie leads her first workshop in the first synbio track of Media Lab Design Innovation Workshop  2015)

You can also support accessible science and look cool doing it! 
Cory Schmitz is an amazing designer. AND an amazing friend who agreed to make our logo, stickers and all the swag we can think of (...we're still thinking of more!) 




As a kit-based system, Amino is for everyone -- want to create something we haven't mentioned yet ? See below for future things you can build, and let us know your ideas!

The array of possible Amino Apps is endless. We are already thinking about what is next. What about Amino Apps that could enable you to practice engineering bread, beer, cider or wine yeast? Or yogurt bacteria? What about smells or colours? You could even practice making medicine. And, if you’re up for the challenge, you can develop your own DNA program, and grow and culture it using your Amino. And, by partnering up with Synbiota, a DNA programming company, we are opening DNA creation to everyone - by using their technology, you can create your own genetic programs and insert them into cells with Amino. The possibilities are endless!  Let us know what you'd want to use amino for! 





Amino takes you on a journey.1. Make it: you get to put a DNA program into living cells using Amino2. Grow it: with Amino you keep tabs on how your living cells are growing3. Keep it: by choosing when and how much food, chemicals, and what temperature to grow the cells at, you really do get to take care of your living cells. To keep it alive for long periods of time, you will need to 
refill its food supplies. Each 
refill kit will be available from our shop and distributors. 
Here is an overview of the Amino App components you will encounter. Don't worry, everything you need - DNA, microorganisms, liquids - is included in your Amino kit, and all the instructions will be easy to follow. 



Amino can be used by makers, students, bakers, brewers, explorers alike.  Amino is a general platform for growing living cells like friendly bacteria or yeast. Bacteria are used in products like yogurt, cheese, soy sauce, medicine and cosmetics.  Yeast are used to brew beer, bake cakes, breads and other yummy things. Both can also be used to create flavours, scents, materials. 

  
Our simple 1-2-3 step process makes it easy to program DNA into living cells and then grow, and take care of those cells to learn about biology and to create awesome things. These easy-to-use Amino Apps make learning about biology, genetic engineering, bioengineering, biotechnology, and synthetic biology suitable and safe for home, DIY, Labs and School use. 

Amino One is optimized for use with a friendly type of bacteria used by scientists for research in labs. This bacterial strain can safely be used by anyone, anywhere in North America. Please check your local regulations if you are outside of North America as these might be different. Contact us at info@amino.bio for any questions. Amino has a set of on-screen, real-time instructions and status indicator lights, as well as online videos and walk-throughs to guide you. 



Amino is a sophisticated piece of hardware with circulation and temperature controls for the user, as well as sensors that help you keep tabs on how fast your microbes are growing and how much food they’re eating. It has modular chambers, that allows you to swap in new microbe food and nutrients, pH balancing solutions, and even other chemicals that help control your DNA program in your microbe.  
Amino has a screen for real-time instructions and indicator lights to guide you through the creation process. Amino reduces the size and complex nature of large laboratory equipment into a counter-top sized system
Sensors


 pH (1-14)


 Optical Density (calibrated for OD600)


 Temperature (two sensors: T1: +/- 2 C; T2 +/- 0.1 C)


Functionalities compared to traditional lab technoloogy


 Water baths, heading blocks become Incubation stations ( plate ) with temperature controls (30 C - 42 C)


 Shaker incubation becomes continuous liquid growth with temperature & flow controls (flow & dimensions optimized)


Instead of having to collect samples and use equipment like a spectrophotometer, you get real time data analysis in a browser


Autoclave is replaced by Amino's contained inactivation protocol (uses contained chemical inactivation)





A real example of data comparing one of Amino's sensors  to a large and expensive Absorbance spectrophotometer.
                 





Amino was started at the MIT Media Lab by founder Julie Legault. After experiencing the difficulties of learning synthetic biology from textbooks and online material, Julie decided to create a mini-lab that could help other people learn science by doing it. Having the opportunity to learn and explore an impactful science like bioengineering should be given to everyone -- just think of what we can achieve when a 1000x + minds are working on problem-solving and creating for the next century!
If you want to know more about the story behind Amino coming out of MIT's Media Lab, read our blog post here 


Following graduation, Julie teamed up with her old Concordia University and Montreal maker friends at Robocut Studio in Montreal to develop a reliable, multi-use system. And now, Amino Labs is made up of a talented anti-discplinary team of people with expertise transcending design, manufacturing, electrical / mechanical engineering, product development and synthetic biology.  We are now a multi-location team as well, developing the hardware in Montreal, the science in Toronto, the business in San Francisco, the software in Boston, and the design wherever Julie happens to be. We are also fortunate to have the support of amazing mentors and partnerships without who developing Amino would not be possible .




 


Amino is for everyone -- that means that the user interaction and the reliability of the platform is crucial. We've made sure to keep our Aminos friendly, playful and powerful, focussing on user feedback to lead the design development.  
Here are a few picture of some of the early prototypes, and design research that got us this far!
"I think of Amino like Tamagotchi pets, except rather than taking care of a digital dog or cat, here you’re taking care of bacteria or yeast. In that process you, your family, and your friends will learn about how your microbes work - you might even love them"  - Julie, CEO, on the inspiration for the user experience of Amino




  




Fall 2015 - Beta Test with Schools and Museums
Winter 2015-16 - In house production (First 25 units)
Spring - Summer 2016 - Small batch production (Next 50-100 units) & New DNA kit Development
Fall 2016 - Launch of new DNA kits & Amino Companion Units Development
Winter 2016- 17 - Large scale production / Manufacturing

 


To get to our first batch of 25 hardened, hand crafted Amino One's, we need to raise $12,500. Further Amino One production is a matter of materials and time for assembly, which are covered by the rewards. 
After Amino One’s are delivered and deployed, we'll ask you for feedback and make future Aminos even better before we move into full-scale manufacturing.  

 

Amino Labs has tested the working prototype. Micro-organisms have been successfully grown, and the sensors have been validated to be functional. The primary challenge that the Amino team is currently facing is a slight re-designs of a couple components to improve functionality (but don't worry, it will still be beautiful!). The team has a lot of experience in iterative product development and this is a natural part of the process. We are confident that our timelines are reasonable and we will strive to deliver the Amino Ones as estimated or earlier.
There are always challenges around the subject of biosafety and biosecurity. Amino Labs has aligned itself with President Obama, the National Security Counsil, and The National Strategy for Countering Biological Threats, who have asserted that "The beneficial nature of life science research is reflected in the widespread manner in which it occurs. From cutting-edge academic institutes, to industrial research centers, to private laboratories in basements and garages, progress is increasingly driven by innovation and open access to the insights and materials needed to advance individual initiatives." Moreover their strategy is targeted to reduce biology threads by "improving global access to the life science to combat infectious disease regardless of its cause". 
Check with your local laws and regulations to see if you can use an Amino. In certain jurisdictions, such as in Europe,  extra certification is required to learn genetic engineering.
We believe that increasing meaningful engagement with and understanding of biology can only be done in a learn-by-doing manner, but this means making synthetic biology technology available. This will naturally create concern.

story:
Let's get started...

But before we do, we know lots of people just read the FAQ's, they are at the bottom of the page.

Cancer burdens all who are going through it or have been through it. The affects of cancer are never really over, even in remission and especially for those have who lost someone to cancer. 

After being in remission from plasmacytoma cancer for three years, my brother went with me for a CT Scan to see if the cancer had returned.

Later that night I realized his simple act of kindness made a bigger impact on me emotionally than all the times kind friends or family did a 10K race in my name. 

I knew I wasn't alone in feeling this way. A revolutionary idea was born - hOurs To Share - an event and community where friends and family share time and love to those who have been affected by cancer. 

What We Need & What You Get

Going through cancer can be physically and emotionally isolating. Many not going through it don't know what to do or say. 

Our vision for hOurs To Share is two fold to inspire the world to directly help those impacted by cancer:

  1. Bridging that gap through an annual act of kindness event helping those affected by cancer. 
  2. hOurs TO Share will have an online community to share ideas and connect people who want to help those affected by cancer. 
The Perks listed on the right hand side give the options of registration for the first hOurs To Share event on Oct. 3rd.
Purchasing a gel wrist band or t-shirt (or both) not only registers you for this year's hOurs To Share event, it's also your commitment to do an act of kindness for someone affected by cancer for about an hour on October 3rd.  Then you can go to the Facebook page and share your experience with others. 
If you wish to share anonymously, email your act of kindness to hourstoshare@gmail.com and we will share only the act of kindness and not anyone's identity. 
Should you want to simply donate to the event and online community you can also make a donation in exchange for a warm fuzzy feeling and grade A karma. 

As mentioned in our campaign video,  hOurs To Share is a registered not-for-profit organization, and all funds raised by this event will be invested back into hOurs To Share to help pay for insurance, website development, advertising and promotional materials of approximately $1,500.00.

Q: What if we don't reach our goal? 
A: You will still receive your gel wrist band, t-shirt, warm fuzzy and great karma. 

Plus all remaining funds will be donated to Canadian Cancer Society. A transparent follow up of all expenses will be posted on www.facebook.com/hourstoshare

The Impact

In September 2010 when my first child was two and half months old I was unable to work from a groin injury in my hip. It turned out the injury was caused from a tumour the size of a kiwi on my hip bone above my hip joint. 

Remission for me didn't come until December 30th, 2011. Here are some ways family and friends helped my family:

  • fresh and frozen meals were dropped off
  • one family passed around a hat for donations
  • a hand written letter from a friend
  • my aunt made me a quilt and family members wrote messages of hope on it
  • friends and relatives from far and wide visited, others called
  • groceries were donated
  • a second cousin I never met held a bottle drive to help our Christmas
  • some dropped off gifts and crafts to cheer up our home
Getting cancer isn't easy, but being a friend can be. Here are some idea joggers for your act of kindness:
  • bake a pie
  •  make a healthful meal 
  • help their spouse/family members
  • if cancer is scary for you, get over yourself and do an act of kindness
  • share good stories of someone who's passed away
  • do housework, yard work, banking, shopping, wash the car
  • listen and listen, then listen some more
  • watch a comedy with them
  • drive them to appointments
  • make their holiday meal
  • babysit 
  • think, really think what that person or family might want

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you feel like you just can't contribute a donation, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • share this link on Facebook, Twitter and good old fashion email https://youtu.be/xiA1NAQ9PZI  

Thank you! 

#hOursToShare FAQ's 

Q: Where's all the money going to? 
A: The board and committee members are all volunteers. No one is getting paid and ALL of our expenses will be 100% transparent on Facebook.

Q: Do I have to do something on Oct. 3rd, can another day work? 
A: Any day works to do something fun or practical to someone who's been impacted cancer.

Q: Is this a one time event? 
A: No, but we wish it was. We wish no one would ever get cancer again and that the whole world without prompting would show empathy to all impacted by cancer. So until that happens we hope to remind the world we have ‪#‎hOursToShare‬.

Q: Do I have to share my act of kindness publicly? 
A: Nope. But if you want to, feel free to use #hOursToShare when you do.

Q: Your Indiegogo page says I can buy Warm Fuzzies and Free Range Organic Karma, is this even legal? 
A: Our legal team says this is a grey or gray area depending how your country spells it.

story:
Over the past year and a half, life events and career shifts have got me thinking about what I want to do moving forward. And one of the (many) exciting things I'm now working towards is becoming a certified yoga instructor.

I'll be doing my training at the Ekahi Centre from February 25-May 7. But I could use your help with tuition and some startup costs. 

As a thank you to everyone who helps my on this new journey I'll be hosting a yoga class just for you (date TBD), with tea and  snacks and socializing after. 

I already have a space, and will be teaching yoga classes on Saturdays and Sundays at the Kelowna Traditional Martial Arts Center, starting May 13th. 

My fundraising goal is $3,000 to cover the cost of tuition, but I have a few stretch goals as well:

  • An additional $1,000 to cover the cost of rent for the first few months
  • An additional $500 to use towards mats and blocks 

There is no expiry date on the punch passes, and you can purchase them for someone else too. 

Thanks so much for helping me on this new journey. I look forward to having you along for the ride.

And one of the (many) exciting things I'm now working towards is becoming a certified yoga instructor.I'll be doing my training at the Ekahi Centre from February 25-May 7. But I could use your help with tuition and some startup costs. As a thank you to everyone who helps my on this new journey I'll be hosting a yoga class just for you (date TBD), with tea and  snacks and socializing after. I already have a space, and will be teaching yoga classes on Saturdays and Sundays at the Kelowna Traditional Martial Arts Center, starting May 13th. My fundraising goal is $3,000 to cover the cost of tuition, but I have a few stretch goals as well:
An additional $1,000 to cover the cost of rent for the first few months
An additional $500 to use towards mats and blocks 
There is no expiry date on the punch passes, and you can purchase them for someone else too. Thanks so much for helping me on this new journey. I look forward to having you along for the ride.

story:
A few months ago, our beautiful 22 year old wife, daughter, niece, grandaughter, cousin and friend was diagnosed with stage IV ovarian cancer. Unfortunately, she was supposed to start a new job just days after she was diagnosed. Instead, she was sent to surgery and faces another surgery the first week of October. She just barely graduated college and now can't work. Just driving to treatments has been a financial burden for her. She has to give up some of her and her husband's independence by moving back in with extended family. Not what you want to do as a newlywed.

This is her story:

I am 22 years old, I just graduated with my bachelor's degree in Exercise Science. I was a collegiate athlete on the track and cross-country teams. Shortly after my last college track meet I felt a large lump in my lower pelvic region. I went to the doctor the next day where they found 2 large tumors via CT scan. Exactly one week later I was in a major debulking surgery where they removed 3 large tumors (there was a 3rd they didn't see on the scan), my omentum, my left ovary and half of my right ovary. I was in the hospital for 9 days before I was finally well enough to return home. A month after surgery I started chemotherapy. I will have 6-8 months of chemotherapy. Mid-September they will do another PET scan to determine when they would like to do my second surgery. Because they weren't sure exactly what variety of ovarian cancer I had when they did the 1st surgery they did not remove all my reproductive organs. Upon determining my cancer type they decided that a complete hysterectomy was required. I will most likely have my second surgery to remove my ovary, uterus and spots on my lungs and liver sometime in October.

The funds raised here will be used for a few things (depending how much is raised. First and foremost they will be used to help with my insurance deductible/co-pay of $10,000+. If I qualify for the study I am trying to get into they will be used to cover travel expenses to and from Pennsylvania where the study is located. I am really hoping to get into it because they are studying a type of treatment that would work like a person specific "vaccine" against the cancerous cells. I would need to cover airfare and a 1-night (hopefully) hotel stay about twice a month. If those expenses are covered then I will use any leftover funds to put towards adoption. I won't be able to have children of my own and my husband and I really want to have a family together. I know that adoption is quite expensive so we need to start saving now!

If you can't donate money, then try and get educated about Ovarian Cancer. It is such a hard cancer to detect because the symptoms are so vague and tumors aren't present until the later stages. Getting diagnosed early can absolutely save your life. Get regular gyno check-ups and make sure your doctor does pap smears and pelvic exams to check for ovarian cysts!

story:
Please find text in english below.

Jeder der sie kennt weiß, wie sehr Heike in den vergangenen Jahren für ihr Leben, für ihre Gesundheit kämpfte, und für alle die Menschen, die ihre Hilfe benötigen.

Heike arbeitete als Kinesiologin äußerst erfolgreich vor allem mit austherapierten Kindern und war ihr Leben lang gemeinnützig tätig für hilflose Menschen und Tiere. Jetzt benötigt SIE Hilfe um dieses Leben wieder aufnehmen zu können.

Mit erstaunlicher Kraft widersteht sie den Schmerzen und wirkte all die Jahre medizinisch nicht erklärbare Heilung an sich selbst, und half so vielen Menschen mit ihren Fähigkeiten und ihrem enormen Wissen.

Heike möchte weitermachen, wieder ein Leben führen in dem sie helfen und arbeiten kann. Dafür hat sie keine Kraft mehr. , weil die Krankenkasse ihre notwendigen Behandlungen nicht übernimmt.


Ihre Hauptdiagnosen sind: Lupus Erythematodes (Autoimmunkrankheit), chron. Borreliose, Mitochondriopathie, mehrere autoimmun induzierte Entzündungen an Herzmuskel und anderen Organen, EBV, HSV.


Viele Jahre nahm sie immunsuppressive Medikamente, um ihren Körper davon abzuhalten sich selbst zu attackieren, was durch die Autoimmunerkrankung der Fall ist. Die Medikamente einzunehmen ist aus medizinischen Gründen nicht mehr möglich, da Heikes Immunsystem und Stoffwechsel inzwischen zu schwach sind. Sie werden Heikes gesundheitlichen Zustand extrem verschlechtern und damit mehr Schaden anrichten als dass sie helfen.

Die Apherese half Heike, da diese die Antikörper und Entzündungseiweiße mechanisch aus ihrem Blut filtert. Die Krankenkasse bezahlt diese Behandlung nicht, obwohl die Verbesserung nachweisbar war und eine Hermuskelentzündung dadurch geheilt wurde, da sie nicht im Leistungskatalog aufgeführt ist.

Die Apherese hilft Heike, indem sie ihr Blut von Antikörpern und Toxinen reinigt.

Heikes Familie hat schon einige dieser Blutreinigungen für sie bezahlt und sie fühlte sich viel besser. Die finanziellen Möglichkeiten der Familie sind nun erschöpft. Wenn diese Therapie nicht weitergeht wird sie keine Spaziergänge mehr machen können um wenigstens in der Natur zu regenerieren und somit an Lebensqualität verlieren, was lebensnotwendig ist um weiter zu kämpfen und gesund zu werden.

Um weiter leben und helfen zu können benötigt sie diese Behandlungen und dafür braucht sie Geld, welches sie alleine nicht aufbringen kann.

Freunde und Familie hoffen durch Spenden die nötigen Mittel für Heikes Therapien zu erhalten!

Heikes Liebe zur Natur und zu den Menschen halten sie jeden Tag aufrecht um weiter zu kämpfen. Für diejenigen die sie seit Jahren begleiten auf ihrem Weg ist es sehr schwer mit anzusehen, wie ein Mensch von solcher Lebensfreude und mit einer solch positiven Lebenseinstellung daran gehindert ist ihren so unterstützenswerten Weg weiter zu verfolgen.

Wenn Sie Heike helfen, dann helfen sie ebenso all den Kindern denen Heike seit Jahren hilft, denn sobald ihr Gesundheitszustand sich stabilisiert wird sie, so viel ist sicher , ihre Arbeit endlich wieder aufnehmen und wesentlich dazu beitragen, dass die Lebensqualität vieler Menschen sich maßgeblich verbessert. Wir warten händeringend auf diesen Moment!

Wir lieben und schätzen Heike, ihr Engagement, ihre ehrliche, aufrichtige und warmherzige Lebensweise und bitten Sie um Ihre Hilfe und Unterstützung!

Danke


------------------------------------ english --------------------------------------------


Everyone who knows her knows how much Heike struggled in recent years for her own life and her health and nevertheless she aided other people who needed her help .

Heike worked very successful as a kinesiologist especially with so called untreatable children an she worked charitable for helpless humans and animals. Now SHE needs our help resume this life .

With amazing strength she withstands the pain and worked all these years medically unexplained healing to herself , and so she was able to help many people with her skills and enormous knowledge.

Heike wants to continue to re- live a life in which she can operate and have effects . For this she has no power because the insurance company does not accept her necessary treatments .


Her main diagnoses are : lupus erythematosus ( autoimmune desease ) , chron. Borreliosis ( Lyme desease ) , mitochondrial dysfunction, several autoimmune- induced inflammation of the heart muscle and other organs , EBV, HSV .



For many years she took immunosuppressive drugs to prevent her body from attacking itself – this is the case in an autoimmune disease ( lupus here ). The immunosuppressive drugs are standard and paid by the Health System, but it is for medical reasons no longer possible to use them because Heikes immune system and metabolism are damaged now. They would deteriorate Heike´s condition extremely in this weak state of health , and thus causes more damage than help.



The apheresis here

helped Heike , because it filters the antibodies and inflammatory proteins mechanically out of her blood . The health insurance does not pay for this treatment because it is not listed in the catalog of services, although the improvement was detectable and cured a Myocarditis and let her feel much more alive again.

Heikes family has already paid some of those blood cleanings for her and she felt much better and healthier. The financial resources of the family and friends are now exhausted. If this treatment does not go on she won´t be able to make any more walks to regenerate in nature at least , and thus lose the quality of life which is vital to continue to get healthy again.

To be able to regenerate and live on these treatments are urgently needed and for this we need money they we, family and friends of Heike, are not able to afford alone any more.

Now we hope to get the necessary funds for Heikes therapies today by donating!

Heike's love to the nature and to the people held her upright every day to fight on. For those who accompany her for years , it is very difficult to see how a person with so much soulfulness and such a positive attitude for life is prevented from living a healthy and supportive life because of missing money.

If you help Heike she is able to help children and other humans needing her protection as she did it the years before, because as soon as her health she is stabilized, that's for sure , she will go on to use her abilities to improve the quality of life of other people significantly again. We who know here are desperately waiting for this moment!

We love and appreciate Heike , her commitment, her honest, sincere and warm-hearted way of life and ask for your help and support!

Thank you

story:
I've overcome a lot of difficult times and struggles that Ive shared in detail with a select few of our friends. I am currently trying to raise just what I need to get by and help me and my family with the struggles we endure. I'm trying to raise money just a few dollars at a time, Knowing That I am NOT the only one hurting financially. Due to continuous Dr. Appointments. I've been diagnosed with pancreatitis, a second mass was located and removed from my left kidney,. I had to put school and work on hold. My whole life, all I've known is how to take care of other people. Mainly my mother. The worst feeling I've ever felt has not been the physical or emotional pain. No, the worst feeling I've felt is not being able to take care of myself and those I know and love. I've been denied by the Church I grew up in, even local charities and state charities that I loved donating to when I was working full time

I figured I would take a chance and ask those of you that know my heart. Given me a hug, or handshake and instead of asking for more than I need. I would ask for the bare minimum to get me back on my feet.

 I just ask for a $1-$5-10 donation with a realistic goal 

If anything, thank you for reading this and always being a friend indeed when a friend was indeed.

Sincerely

Mikey

story:
Zu meiner Person:

• Dr.med. Werner Ch.Nawrocki, Arzt für Naturheilverfahren, Homöopathie und  
    Akupunktur, eigene Praxis seit 1974, • geb. 1946, Germany, verheiratet
• seit ca. 25 Jahren privates Forschungslabor:Entwicklung von neuen biologischen
  Substanzen auf spagyrisch, alchemistischem Wege
• internationales Patent für Charismon®(Oil of egg) seit achtzehn Jahren
• Seminare und Vorträge in Europa, USA, Australien u. China(spirituelle
   Psychologie, Fasten,Schweigen, Meditation, Alchemie)
Funding für folgendes Projekt:
Ziel: Biologisches Mittel (Tropfen, Salbe) für/gegen Arterienverkalkung(Herzinfarkt, Schlaganfall, Durchblutungsstörungen).Dieses Mittel nimmt die Schmerzen weg und öffnet bereits verschlossene Blutgefäße) und kann auch örtlich als Salbe aufgetragen werden(Beine, Herzgegend)
  • Beschreibe, wobei die Unterstützer dir helfen werden.

Denke daran, dich kurz zu halten. Stelle dir folgende Fragen: Wenn jemand hier aufhört zu lesen, wäre derjenige dann bereit, Geld zu geben?

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Es wird recht viel Geld benötigt. Die bisherigen Projekte mit dem Eiöl(25 wiss. Arbeiten und eine medizinische Doktorarbeit) wurden über eine nicht nur allgemeinnützige, sondern sogar wissenschaftlich förderungswürdige Gesellschaft(Phameres e.V.: Pharmazeutisch,medizinische  Forschungsgesellschaft) finanziert.

Das bedeutet, jeder Deutsche kann die Spende steuerlich absetzen!!!!

Wir benötigen für die weiteren Studien an Kliniken ca. 2-300tausend Euro.

Das Geld wird nur für die wiss.Studien benötigt, denn alle bisherigen Helfer und ich selbst arbeiten ehrenamtlich.

Das Ziel, diesen Stoff auf den Weltmarkt zu bringen zum Wohle der Menschheit!

Mein alchemistischer Lehrer, Prof.Dr.h.c. Albert Riedel,ursprünglich aus Dresden, hatte mir diese Aufgabe gegeben, die ich unbedingt erfüllen möchte!

Von dem Eioel, einem internationalen Patent, sagte Prof.Dr.Kitsche, Offenbach sinngemäß:"es ist zu schade, dass nicht jedes kranke Kind dieses Mittel bekommen kann."

Er hatte eine klinische Studie mit dem Eiöl durchgeführt.

Die Funding Mittel gehen alle an die Phameres e.V., auch wenn nicht die ganze Summe erreicht wird.

Die Folgen

Das Ziel ist, ein Mittel- wir können es Nahrungsergänzungsmittel nennen, denn als Medikament kann es nicht zugelassen werden- was sehr schade ist- wie mir ein Spezialist für Medikamenten-Zulassung erklärt hat, da es organisch ist und nicht hundertprozentig standardisierbarist-: also ein Mittel für arterienverkalkte Blutgefäße, das auch bereits prophylaktisch eingesetzt wird und keine Nebenwirkungen hat!!!!

Da dies gegen ein wissenschaftliches Dogma verstößt("Alles was wirkt hat auch Nebenwirkungen") konnte ich bisher keine Pharmafirma in der Welt finden(ich war bei über 2o Firmen in Deutschland, der Schweiz, Kanada,USA), die daran interessiert ist, das Mittel auf den Markt zu bringen.

Vor allem glauben sie nicht, das es wirklich funktioniert, da es nur ein "kleiner
Doktor gefunden hat und kein Professor auf derWelt es kennt!!

Wie gesagt den Grundwirkstoff gibt es seit über 20 Jahren und er wird sehr erfolgreich in der Kosmetik und als Nahrungsergänzungsmittel eingesetzt.

Jetzt geht es darum, weitere Schritte zu wagen, damit das Mittel noch mehr Menschen helfen kann!

Wir haben wirklich sehr viele "Wunder" mit dem Mittel erlebt, mit Erfahrungsberichten von Anwendern bestätigt!!!!

  • Risiken & Herausforderungen
  • Wir sollten versuchen, an der Macht der Pharmafirmen vorbei diesem Wirkstoff zu seiner Blüte zu verhelfen!
  • Das wird nicht einfach, es kann auch gefährlich werden, aber gerne biete ich es ja auch den Pharmafirmen an, wenn Sie es zum Wohle der Menschen auf den Weltmarkt bringen und jedem Menschen zur Verfügung stellen, ohne dass es allzu teuer ist!
  • Bisher haben wir über 20 Jahre hart für den Erfolg gearbeitet und wir werden auch weiter kommen, wenn wir über Funding und dann über die Phameres e.V. weitere Gelder zur Verfügung haben.
  • Ich kann es alleine mit meinen Seminarteilnehmern nicht mehr schaffen!

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

• Jeder, der Geld hat oder jemanden kennt, der entweder Geld hat(steuerlich abzugsfähig!!!!!) oder der gute Beziehungen zu Menschen mit Geld hat oder der Kontakte zu aufgeschlossenen Menschen in Pharmafirmen hat ist herzlich gebeten uns zu helfen!

Oder auch: Vielleicht kann man auch nur den Himmel um Hilfe für unser Forschungsprojekt bitten(völlig frei, ohne jede Bezeigung zu irgend einer Kirche oder Organisation, nur einige Freunde, meine Frau und ich stecken dahinter!!!!)

Danke!


Dr.med.Werner Ch.Nawrocki
star@Dr-Nawrocki.de
+49 69 5601089
Faxc +49 69 5604158
Francstr.6
D-60320 Frankfurt
Germany

story:
About Lexi and her family

Lexi's mother, Lisa, is a long time friend of my husband.  This is Lisa's daughter, Lexi. Lexi is 12 years old. Both pictures (seen above) are actually her and were taken only about 7 mos apart from each other. 

Lexi has juvenile rheumatoid arthritis, as well as ulcerative colitis, an inflammatory bowel disease where her own body attacks her digestive system causing it to ulcerate and bleed. Lexi has been hospitalized 11 times since last November, each time with unbearable joint pain, stomach pain, and profuse bleeding. She required 3 blood transfusions within just a 2 week time span, and to try to give her at least SOME measure of relief, the doctors treated her with massive doses of steroids and immunosuppressor medications. Now, not only does she have this painful autoimmune disease, she also now has three additional debilitating diseases from the medications. She developed Cushings syndrome, a steroid caused disease where you get "moon face", gain a "fat pad" (often called a buffalo hump) on the back of your neck, and at 12 yrs old she now has purple stretch marks all over her body. She also developed adrenal insufficiency, which means if her body is under any kind of trauma or stress, her adrenal glands will not work and she will have organ failure unless an emergency dose of steroid is given quickly. Lastly, she was diagnosed 3 weeks ago with avascular necrosis, a loss of blood flow to the bones of her knees, shoulders, and ankles. This means that her bones are degenerating and as her physical therapist terms it, the bones look like "swiss cheese." She already uses a wheelchair about 50% of the time, now it looks as though her future is a permanent wheelchair. All of these "additional" life altering diseases because there is no cure to colitis.

What We Need

Lexi was recently approved to go to the Cleveland Clinic by Medicaid.  She will see a pediatric orthopedic specialist, Dr. Gurd, to help with her juvenile rheumatoid arthritis and some of the other diseases she contracted as a result of being on medications to fix the original diseases!  Lexi and her family were going to drive to Cleveland, but their van just won't make it.  Plane tickets are roughly $320 each (not counting taxes and service charges) and they need a hotel for Lisa to stay while Lexi is treated. This whole trip is just going to be too expensive for them. Lisa is an out of work Special Education Teacher and her husband works construction, when he can get work at all.  That's why this family needs help.

  • We would like to raise at least $2,000 to cover the cost of the plane tickets, taxes, hotels and food for the 7 day treatment time and then some.
  • Even if we don't reach the entire $2,000 goal, the funds that are raised will be sent directly to the family.  Indiegogo takes a percentage of the funds that are raised.If we reach the goal they take 4% of the total and if we don't reach the goal, they take 9% of the total.  I plan to personally cover the cost of either fee out of my own pocket so what you see as the total money raised will be exactly what the family gets.

The Impact

This money will make a huge difference to this family. They are already low on funds because they have been unemployed and their healthcare bills are so high.  This small amount will be a ray of sunshine in this little girl's life.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you may not feel comfortable giving money directly through indiegogo or to the family.  If you still wish to help out financially, the family would appreciate a donation to the Crohns and Colitis foundation (CCFA) because we HAVE to find a cure. 1.4 million other Americans deal with Crohn's disease or colitis every day, but it is all of these side effects that we are working to eliminate! Please help us and donate if you can - the CCFA is one of the few A-rated nonprofit organizations in the country and your donation is tax deductible. You can go to Lexi's donation website http://online.ccfa.org/Lexi and read more about how she was diagnosed. While this will not benefit Lexi directly, you can know that you did your part to solve the larger problem of what caused her disease.

What if you don't have any money to donate?  That's understandable too.  If you could help this blog post  http://www.pinksith.com/2013/09/help-princess-lexi.html go viral or  this campaign on indiegogo go viral that would be awesome. Tweet it to your friends, share it on Facebook, Pin it in Pinterest, Stumble it on Stumbleupon, Share it on Reddit, I don't care how you do it. The more people that see this plea, the better chance we have of reaching our $2,000 goal and possibly raising money for CCFA too!  

Thank you for your help!
story_txt:
About Lexi and her family
Lexi's mother, Lisa, is a long time friend of my husband.  This is Lisa's daughter, Lexi. Lexi is 12 years old. Both pictures (seen above) are 
actually her and were taken only about 7 mos apart from each other. Lexi
 has juvenile rheumatoid arthritis, as well as ulcerative colitis, an 
inflammatory bowel disease where her own body attacks her digestive 
system causing it to ulcerate and bleed. Lexi has been hospitalized 11 
times since last November, each time with unbearable joint pain, stomach
 pain, and profuse bleeding. She required 3 blood transfusions within 
just a 2 week time span, and to try to give her at least SOME measure of
 relief, the doctors treated her with massive doses of steroids and 
immunosuppressor medications. Now, not only does she have this painful 
autoimmune disease, she also now has three additional debilitating 
diseases from the medications. She developed Cushings syndrome, a 
steroid caused disease where you get "moon face", gain a "fat pad" 
(often called a buffalo hump) on the back of your neck, and at 12 yrs 
old she now has purple stretch marks all over her body. She also 
developed adrenal insufficiency, which means if her body is under any 
kind of trauma or stress, her adrenal glands will not work and she will 
have organ failure unless an emergency dose of steroid is given quickly.
 Lastly, she was diagnosed 3 weeks ago with avascular necrosis, a loss 
of blood flow to the bones of her knees, shoulders, and ankles. This 
means that her bones are degenerating and as her physical therapist 
terms it, the bones look like "swiss cheese." She already uses a 
wheelchair about 50% of the time, now it looks as though her future is a
 permanent wheelchair. All of these "additional" life altering diseases 
because there is no cure to colitis.


What We Need
Lexi was recently approved to go to the Cleveland Clinic by Medicaid.  
She will see a pediatric orthopedic specialist, Dr. Gurd, to help with 
her juvenile rheumatoid arthritis and some of the other diseases she

story:
30 Glycolic Introduction

30 Glycolic has been offering our clients skin care kits since 1989 to address a number of different skin conditions.  Our kits give our clients the products to address dry skin, oily / acne prone skin, acne scarred skin, skin lightening, pregnancy acne and a generic weekly peel kit.  Our kits are two or three step systems that harness the power of glycolic acid skin peels and combine them with our moisturizers to make your skin beautiful. 

If you can you can apply lotion and wash it off, then you can use our system.  Five minutes a week to more beautiful skin.

The business has been in existence since 1989 and has had a Better Business Bureau rating of A+ since 2008 (see link http://www.bbb.org/tucson/business-reviews/cosmetic-sales-by-internet/30glycolic-in-tucson-az-20009274#bbbseal). 

We are relaunching the product and this Indiegogo project is for paying for new packaging, to generate funds for new advertising and hopefully to get some buzz around products.  The bottles seen in this project are samples of the packaging we will purchase with the proceeds from this project.  Depending on the proceeds from this project and from other sources, our hope is to raise enough money to get even better bottles.  So, do not be surprised if you get your bottles and they are even better than the ones you see on this Indiegogo page!  We will also give a portion of the proceeds to freshstart.org, a worthy charity to help children that need reconstructive surgery.  See the bottom of this page for more information.

30 Glycolic System

Before I started using the 30 Glycolic system, I used to have dry, flaky skin.  Whether you have dry skin like I do or other conditions, a lot of skin problems are caused by the inadequate exfoliation in your skin.  Our skin care kits give you everything to get spa-like and dermatologist results in the comfort of your own home for six months at the cost of one or two visits. 

The system consists of cleansing your skin with our provided (depending on kit) cleanser and toner, the skin peel and our moisturizer that addresses your specific skin challenge.  By buying the products in a bundle, we take away the guesswork of how to assemble the products needed for your problem and provide a significant value that is cheaper than buying each product separately.  Each of the 8oz kits in this project have enough product for approximately six months of weekly Glycolic Acid Skin Peels.  We only use pharmaceutical grade Glycolic Acid and give a 90 day money back guarantee (see http://30glycolic.gostorego.com for more details).  Our products are made at a FDA approved laboratory, made in the USA and are animal cruelty free.  

To simplify this project, we are only offering our Dry Skin, OIly / Acne Prone Skin and Acne Scarred Skin Kits.  See 30glycolic.com for more information on our Weekly Peel, Pregnancy Acne and Anti-Wrinkle Kits.  We also sell our kits with 40%, 50% and 60% Glycolic Acid solution on our website.  We will make our wonderful moisturizers available through this campaign for those who may not be ready for our skin peels, but would still like to have some of the benefits from our moisturizers.

Included in all our kits

All of our kits include the pH prepping solution, the 30% Glycolic Acid Peel and Post Peel Neutralizer.  During the day, your skin is exposed to pollutants that can bring to your skin to a non-neutral state.  Our pH Prepping solution brings your skin to a neutral state before the application of the Glycolic Acid.  The Glycolic Acid Peel is a small molecule that exfoliates your facial skin cells, exposing new, glowing skin for our moisturizers to hydrate your skin.  The Post Peel Neutralizer stops the action of the acid and ends the peel process. 

Dry / Combo Skin Kit

Our Dry Skin Kit clears your face of ugly, dull, gray skin.  It gets rid of flaky, dead skin cells that prevent moisturizers from reaching and exposing your radiant youthful skin - breaking the vicious cycle that keeps your skin look unsightly.

Our Dry Skin Kit contains the following products:

  • Balance Toner and Balance AHA Cleanser
  • pH Prep Solution
  • 8oz 30% Glycolic Acid Peel
  • Post Peel Neutralizer
  • Chiffon Cream moisturizer
  • Nighttime Royal Alpha Balance Cream
  • Royal Chiffon Cream
The Balance Toner does not use alcohol and is designed not to dry your skin.  Our AHA Cleanser cleans your skin while using glycolic acid to give you a mild daily exfoliation.  Our Chiffon Cream moisturizer uses Hyaluronic acid, a naturally occuring molecule that binds with 1000x its weight in water molecule, retaining moisture to hydrate your skin cells.  The Royal Chiffon Cream adds Royal Jelly to our Chiffon Cream.  Royal Jelly is a natural product created by bees that has been shown to have anti-bacterial properties and helps prevent acne breakouts.  The Nighttime Royal Alpha Cream has Royal Jelly and Glycolic Acid to provide gentle exfoliation between skin peels. 

Oily / Acne Prone Skin Kit

Our Oily / Acne Prone Skin Kit exfoliates your skin to make sure dead skin cells do not clog up your pores.  It also clears dirt, oils and bacteria that block your pores.

Our Oily / Acne Prone Skin Kit contains the following products:

  • Mint Toner and Mint AHA/BHA Cleanser
  • pH Prep Solution
  • 8 oz 30% Glycolic Acid Peel
  • Post Peel Neutralizer
  • Chiffon Cream moisturizer
  • Nighttime Royal Alpha Balance Cream
  • Royal Chiffon Cream
The Mint Toner does not use alcohol and is designed not to dry your skin.  It includes peppermint oil, a natural astringent, that helps reduce the production of skin oil or sebum.  The Mint AHA/BHA Cleanser includes both Glycolic Acid and Salicylic Acid to provide mild daily exfoliation and cleans sebum from your skin.  Our Chiffon Cream moisturizer uses Hyaluronic acid, a naturally occuring molecule that binds with 1000x its weight in water molecule, retaining moisture to hydrate your skin cells.  The Royal Chiffon Cream adds Royal Jelly to our Chiffon Cream.  Royal Jelly is a natural product created by bees that has been shown to have anti-bacterial properties and helps prevent acne breakouts.  The Nighttime Royal Alpha Cream has Royal Jelly and Glycolic Acid to provide gentle exfoliation between skin peels. 

Acne Scarred Skin Kit

Our Oily / Acne Prone Skin Kit contains the following products:

  • pH Prep Solution
  • 30% Glycolic Acid Peel
  • Post Peel Neutralizer
  • Nighttime Royal Alpha Balance Cream
  • Cellular Rejuvenation Cream

The Acne Scarred Skin Kit is a two step system that starts with the exfoliation.  The system includes the Nighttime Royal Alpha Cream, a moisturizer with Royal Jelly and Glycolic Acid to provide gentle exfoliation between skin peels.  Royal Jelly is a natural product created by bees that has been shown to have anti-bacterial properties and helps prevent acne breakouts.  Our Cellular Rejuvenation Cream contains Hyaluronic acid, a naturally occurring molecule molecule that binds with 1000x its weight in water molecule, retaining moisture to hydrate your skin cells.  It also contains soy, Vitamin E and the amino acids needed for the building of collagen in your skin to give it a smooth, firm and flake-free look.  

Giving Back

A portion of our proceeds go to Fresh Start Surgical Gifts Foundation, an organization that enriches the lives of children and young people living with physical deformities through the gift of reconstructive surgery. Please support this worthy charity.  For more information, check out www.freshstart.org.

If you can't contribute...

Please consider liking our page from http://30glycolic.gostorego.com or to this Indiegogo campaign or the other multitude of ways to get the word out on social media provided by Indiegogo!  Thank you!

story:
Hi, my name is Jonathan Powell. I got married less than a year ago to my beautiful bride Megan. Six months after our wedding, Megan was diagnosed with SNUC (Sinonasal Undifferentiated Carcinoma) cancer. Not only is it rare for a female, it is also extremely rare for her someone her age. I was told by her doctors that she is the youngest woman in California to ever be diagnosed with this specific cancer at age 25. Although she is the strongest person I know, this cancer is extremely aggressive which makes her treatment aggressive as well. To this date, she has undergone three surgeries with no guarantee that more surgeries might be necessary. Right now, Megan has begun simultaneous chemotherapy and radiation. This whole ordeal started with Megan waking up at night with heavy nose bleeds. Her first ENT doctor spotted a mass in her right nasal passage which was eventually diagnosed as SNUC. He said the tumor looked very unusually and because of her age, it was very unlikely to be cancerous. Because of this, we assumed it was a benign mass. One morning, about six weeks later, he called her into the doctor’s office for her results. She went in thinking it was just a benign tumor. January 7th 2014 (A day that will live in infamy) the doctor explained to her she had SNUC cancer. Needless to say, Megan was completely caught off guard to the deafening news; she was numb. From that day on, she knew our life would never be the same. My mother-in-law picked her up from the doctors and brought her to me and we all just sat in silence. We agreed to a couple days of unleashing our emotions but then the fight was on. 

 The first surgery Megan underwent was for the original tumor. This surgery went pretty smoothly but was basically a biopsy. Due to the extremely rare nature, accompanied by the lack of research and development of SNUC, a tumor board consisting of fifty or sixty Doctors was convened on her behalf to discuss her options. During her tumor board meeting, we found out that with the type of chemo she would undergo meant having children in the future would be off the table, due to destruction of her ovaries. This was devastating for us since we were already on the path to start a family. Luckily, the timing worked out perfectly and we were able to harvest seven embryos. I say we were lucky because the timing fell exactly on the week IVF was possible before her other surgery was to take place. The third surgery was her facial sinus tumor surgery to remove the entire mass. This surgery she was extremely scared going into because a craniotomy was on the table. A Craniotomy is where they access the tumor by taking out a piece of your skull. Thanks to the experience and expertise of her surgeon Dr. Wynn, she was able to avoid this invasive procedure but there is a catch. If the chemo and radiation does not kill this aggressive cancer then the craniotomy is back on the table. 

 Financially this has been a huge burden on my wife and I. Thanks to the Affordable Care Act (ACA) , Megan was able to stay on her Dads insurance but this will run out shortly due to her turning 26 May 1st which means we will have large co pays due to the nature of her now preexisting condition. Two years before we got married Megan and I opened up a local business where Megan was born and raised. Just when we began to see the fruit of our labor, her diagnosis took a huge toll on us. The IVF was unfortunately not covered through insurance as well and cost us $17,000.00. Of which we had to borrow within a couple of days to make sure the timing worked out. Each doctor has his/her own distinctive list of all these products, nutrients, lotions, mouthwashes, and supplies to help Megan through her recovery and deal with side effects of Chemo and radiation. This has been financially bearing on us. I often have sleepless nights were I wonder why this is all happening and what else I could be doing to ease some of the stress she is under. Because we are business partners and life partners, Megan still insist on working through her recovery. This is bearing on me because I know the best thing for her right now is to be in a stress free environment. I work at least 80 hours a week between our business and a part time job I work at night. Luckily, we have family and friends who help out tremendously by getting Megan to her treatments and appointments on time since I am often away working. Unfortunately their time and effort doesn’t out weight the huge financial burden placed upon us at a critical time in your lives. It is very hard for me to wave a white flag and ask for help. Especially from people I may not know. To be completely honest, l would rather suffer in silence but this isn’t about me or my pride. As her husband, I can’t say that I did everything in my power to get her better if I do not allow people to help who are willing. My wife and I do Relay for Life every year, I just never imagined I would be the one in need. I guess life is funny that way. The money we raise would be put towards all the supplies for her recovery such as: vitamins, shakes, burn lotions (due to radiation), travel (every day to radiation), mouth washes and special toothpastes for dry mouth caused by radiation and accumulating medical bills and co-payments. 

 I love my wife so much and it hurts me to see her go through this battle. I love her, and I want her to feel comfortable and not have to constantly worry about our finances. We are not the type of people who usually asks for help, but in this case, I have no choice but to do everything in my power to get her on the path of recovery. Please donate to our cause, with the one man’s promise that your good deeds will be played forward.

because I know the best thing for her right now is to be in a stress free
environment. I work at least 80 hours a week between our business
and a part time job I work at night. Luckily, we have family and
friends who help out tremendously by getting Megan to her treatments and
appointments on time since I am often away working. Unfortunately their time
and effort doesn’t out weight the huge financial burden placed upon us at a
critical time in your lives. It is very hard for me to wave a white
flag and ask for help. Especially from people I may not know. To be
completely honest, l would rather suffer in silence but this isn’t about me or
my pride. As her husband, I can’t say that I did everything in my power to get
her better if I do not allow people to help who are willing. My wife
and I do Relay for Life every year, I just never imagined I would be the one in
need. I guess life is funny that way. The money we raise would be put
towards all the supplies for her recovery such as: vitamins, shakes, burn
lotions (due to radiation), travel (every day to radiation), mouth washes and
special toothpastes for dry mouth caused by radiation and accumulating medical
bills and co-payments. 
 I
love my wife so much and it hurts me to see her go through this battle. I love
her, and I want her to feel comfortable and not have to constantly worry about
our finances. We are not the type of people who usually asks for
help, but in this case, I have no choice but to do everything in my power to
get her on the path of recovery. Please donate to our cause, with the one man’s promise that your good deeds will be
played forward.

story:
The Pitch: Why Donate

Do you want to attend rooftop yoga classes in a beautiful space surrounded by a gorgeous garden and led by highly-trained teachers without paying an arm and a leg for a fancy retreat or a trip out of town?

OR

Do you want to host your own events on a secluded rooftop surrounded by a lush, green garden? 

OR

Do you enjoy supporting local entrepreneurs in their efforts to bring one-of-a-kind businesses, spaces, and experiences to DC?

If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, then this is the fundraiser for you!

East Side Yoga opened this February in the Capitol Hill neighborhood, and is already making waves as one of the most beautiful, retreat-like spaces in town. Now that the interior space is up and running, we've set our sights on upgrading our outdoor space to create DC's first rooftop yoga studio! Once we've completed the rooftop, not only will we offer regular rooftop classes and special events (like our Yoga Happy Hours!), we will also make the space available for event rentals. 

Help us create this one-of-a-kind space so that we can bring DC yogis the ultimate yoga experience, and offer all Washingtonians a gorgeous and unique alternative to the usual bar & restaurant scenes for their socializing and event planning needs!

The Details: What We're Trying To Do

As you can see from the photos, we have already started creating our rooftop oasis.  But we don't have enough space to host classes (yet), and we can't let our clients walk among our garden and truly enjoy it. Read on to find out why.

The roof membrane is still exposed on the majority of the roof deck (that's the silver part you see in the photos) and we can't let our clients walk on it. By covering the membrane with special rubber pavers designed to allow proper drainage, we will be able to allow our clients to explore the entire rooftop and really enjoy the garden. And more importantly, the rubber surface will be perfect for outdoor yoga sessions!

In addition to adding the rubber floor to the roof, there are some important upgrades we need to make to the space. We will install a security gate at the top of the stairs to keep our rooftop safe from uninvited visitors; the design of the gate will match the sunburst pattern of our existing window security bars. We will also install a security camera system.

The lighting outdoors needs some serious upgrading as well, and our plan includes  bistro-style globe string lights, mason jar lanterns, and solar-powered fairy lights overhead and among the plants to help maintain the serene, retreat-like ambience that we have already created in our interior studio. The rooftop gets a LOT of sun during the day, so we will install canvas sun sails to shade areas of the space while still allowing the plants to get much-needed sun. And we will commission more custom-built planters to complete the garden, and purchase tables & seating for use during events. 

What We Need From You

To cover the entire cost of the rooftop makeover, we need about $30,000. This would cover the material and labor costs of all of the items listed above.

The Perks

1. Access to one of our very first rooftop yoga classes, which will be exclusive to donors only.

2. As many rooftop classes as you feel like purchasing, including unlimited monthly options.

3. If you donate at a high enough level, you can also earn a spot on our Gratitude Wall: a special, permanent installation in the studio lobby that contains the names of all of the people who helped make East Side Yoga a reality, including our most generous donors.

The Backstory

A native of Austin, TX, our founder Alia J. Khan is a recovering attorney-turned-entrepreneur. She began practicing yoga when she began practicing law, because she knew she needed a way to balance out the stress of her new career, and obtained her 200-hour teaching certification from Tranquil Space in 2012. After nearly 5 years of working as an associate at an AmLaw 500 firm here in DC, Alia knew that the legal world was not the place for her. She embarked on a long and winding journey to find her dream career, making stops in the worlds of food writing and real estate along the way. Through her professional adventures, teaching yoga has always been a passion that fulfilled a very important part of her. But she knew that teaching yoga full-time would never fully satisfy all of her professional ambitions, so her search continued.

Alia had always dreamed of owning her own business, though she used to think that she wanted to open a restaurant. Two years of writing about the restaurant industry rid her of that notion completely, but her entreprenuerial spirit still burned strong. Her undergraduate degree was in business, and she longed to return to her business roots after her foray into the law. While using her real estate knowledge to help her partner search for office space for his business, she stumbled across a listing for a former dance studio just five blocks away from her home.

The moment she set foot in the space, Alia knew that she had to open a yoga studio there. After years of living on the Hill and crossing town to get her yoga fix, she was convinced that her neighborhood had a real need for the type of studio that she could open and the community she would build around it. And so, East Side Yoga was born!

Alia designed the East Side Yoga space and worked with local contractor GL Barnhart Construction to make it a reality. Using locally-sourced, salvaged materials, the GLBC team custom-built furniture, fixtures, and finishes that have truly made our space unlike any other in DC. Alia calls it her Farmhouse-Spa-Chic style, and has invested a lot of energy into making our clients feel like they have truly escaped from their everyday lives. A visit to East Side Yoga is a mini-retreat that you can treat yourself to every day!

No Money? No Problem. Help Us Spread the Word!

We understand that some of you just can't contribute right now, and that's OK! You can still help us out by simply spreading the word about our studio and our campaign. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools or simply copy the link to this page and share with any email lists, groups, and/or social media platforms that you may be on. 

Thank you for supporting East Side Yoga!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tamiah Bridgett and 16 years ago, I “went natural.”  For those who don’t understand the term, I stopped using sodium hydroxide chemicals to achieve straight hair.  It was the best decision of my life and it literally led me to my life’s purpose.

You see, shortly after going natural women began asking me for style advice as they too wanted to be free from chemical relaxing.  At that time, there was no YouTube and there were few blogs on the subject.  In my hometown, I became a go-to person on styling natural hair.  I’d been working as a manicurist through college and graduate school, so the beauty industry was familiar to me but I never thought I’d go into hairstyling.

Fast-Forward to 2010.  I was working as a therapist and still assisting women with transitioning to their natural hair in droves.  So, I decided to start having Meetup events in my neighborhood.  Each time we met, more people came.  An attendee suggested that I put together an online community during the winter months to keep contact and It’s a Natural Thang was born on Facebook.   We remain a closed group as emotional safety is still important to me, but gain about 1,000 members annually.  We are pressing our way to 6000 members internationally!

I returned to beauty school with the intention of doing state advocacy to get more education on styling natural hair in beauty schools, but instead, was presented with an opportunity to apply for a start-up accelerator program.  I’d had this idea to transform the blow dryer.  Large name beauty companies have tried to create hair tools for natural hair but they still miss the mark.  Little did I know it, but I’d been working on a conceptual prototype for some time from tweaking my own tools!  In the late summer of 2015, I was accepted into the Alphalab Gear accelerator and Diversamē Inc was born. 

I contracted with engineers to take the concept of a dryer for textured hair into a working prototype form and here we are!   Our tool has been tested in multiple salons in the Pittsburgh region including The Natural Choice, Diva Den and Philip Pelusi!  Mr. Pelusi endorsed the Diversamē Drying Tool for its innovation and function. We are also endorsed as Dermatology Approved from Dr. Melanye Maclin, Dermatologist who is known for her work in Chris Rock’s Good Hair documentary, Hype Hair Magazine and the Steve Harvey Show.

Contributing to this campaign will help us bring an amazing tool into the market.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are embarking upon this crowdfunding venture to raise the funds we need to go into mass production. 

When people find out about the  Diversamē Drying Tool, the two questions I get most are, “when is it coming out?”  and “How can I help?”

Here’s the answer.  The dryer will be out as soon as we can raise the funds needed for manufacturing.  Here’s where you come in!  We need to raise at least $15K to take Diversamē to the next level.  We have considered everyone’s budget so there is a contribution tier for all!

Each contribution comes with cool recognition perks that continue throughout each tier.

$10 receives a shout on our campaign page and social media!

$25  prior perk+ e-book Myths and Misconceptions of Natural Hair Care

$50  prior perk+ Diversamē T-shirt

$85 Early Bird Price for Diversamē Drying Tool

$110 prior perk+ Diversamē Drying Tool

$250  all perks+ Diversamē Drying Tool and 30 min. hair consultation with Tamiah

$500 all perks+ Diversamē Drying Tool, 3 months Supply of Bella Nutri formulated by Dr. Maclin. as well as a monthly consultation per monthly supply with Dr. Maclin.  Bella Nutri  is clinically tested to provide  anti-aging skin renewal and hair regeneration at the cellular level.  

 

$1000 all perks+  Diversamē Drying Tool 30 min. hair consultation, a 6 month supply of Bella Nutri as well as a monthly consultation per monthly supply AND  Tamiah’s favorite things box filled with items from Sweet T’s Beauty, Good Body Stuff and Nikki’s Magic Wand.

$2500 all prior perks including the Diversamē Drying tool + 1 year supply of Bella Nutri/12 consultations with Dr. Maclin,  Hair styled by Tamiah and name our next dryer model!

The Impact

Your contribution matters so much to the success of Diversamē  as it loans market validity.  Contributing proves to the “big guys” that the textured hair market is underserved and that we will invest in a company that considers and is concerned about our hair care process. 

The  Diversamē  Drying Tool will have worldwide marketplace impact.  The face of the average American is changing and much of the hair textures across the globe are on the Curly Continuum, a term I’ve coined to express the vast nature of curly hair types and textures.  In an age of customization, it’s time that hair tools address the needs of those previously forgotten!

Risks & Challenges

 As a tech start-up company.  We have encountered many obstacles.  In spite of them all, we were still able to go from concept to functional prototype in under a year. Most of all we have gained the support of the Curly Continuum!  

If we don't meet our goal of $15K we will use whatever funds we have to go towards production as we seek further investment.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If by chance you are cannot financially contribute to our goal you can still help us bring Diversamē to market.  Word of mouth is what grew It’s a Natural Thang and it can do the same for Diversamē.  Please spread the word about this campaign and why it’s important.  Share the links.  Collect email addresses to help us spread the word! 

Share, share and share again!

Thank you all in advance for your contributions and support!

story: This campaign has ended
story_txt: This campaign has ended

story:
Ladies and Gentlemen,

We have all had dreams, a goal we pursue until we hopefully reach it. For some it is being a lawyer, others maybe an author, or perhaps a chef. Many of us strive to achieve these goals everyday with a smile on our face and a fire in our hearts. Success can come at any point in our lives if we are open to it. Usually the largest of our goals is the hardest to fulfill but the most fulfilling to be completed. My dream is and has always been to play professional soccer.  

My name is Eric Alexander Ross, born the nineteenth of November in 1990 in Germany. I am the older of two children with a beautiful younger sister named Marli, who is my one of my best friends. We are kin to Michael and Cecile Ross both of whom were in the Air Force. Growing up my mom made my dad promise not to try to sway me on playing a certain sport seeing as he played football, basketball, and baseball. So I was introduced to them all. I remember growing up enjoying soccer a lot, but never really got deep into it. The year I was in seventh grade around the girl I had a crush on also played soccer but when tryouts rolled around she made the team, while I did not. Shattered, I went home and started practicing.

Eleven years later I have: Won the Big South Conference with a Division 1 school. set two scoring records at Milton High School, been selected as 1 of 5 All-Fulton county players for All-State, went to nationals for USSL, been to England and Australia for tournaments, and dreamed big. Most recently I went over to England with the Mid-City Lions to train and play against semi-professional and professional teams. We ended the trip with winning the Keele Cup, which is the largest international tournament in the world, and partnering with Northwich Victoria. Myself and two other players had the opportunity to train with the first team and were showed interest in. I need to get back over to England as soon as possible to play with Northwich Villa, the reserve team to pay my dues and move up to the first team. The longer it takes me to raise the money for the plane ticket and visa though, the longer it is until I get into the roster.

The cost of the trip is around $4000. This would include my plane ticket, visa, and any other expenses I encounter along the way including the cost of living in the first few months. I will be working non stop to help raise the money and everything I get will go into this fund.

I have never wanted anything as bad as I want this. If you took the time to read this I want to thank you and ask that you help. Help doesn’t have to be money, it can be telling your friends, or sharing on facebook. If I have to I'll put up a picture holding a sign saying "If I get a four thousand 'Likes' and everyone who liked it just donated a dollar, I get to go to England to play soccer and will be the most radiant person on the face of the planet " I will. Any money I cannot raise is coming out of my pocket and as a broke college student. To share this use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you again.

Eric Ross
