story:
Sandra was Diagnosed with stage 3 Pancreatic Cancer. This is a trying time for her as she fights her cancer. It  has put a huge strain on her and her husband both financially and emotionally. This is a fundraiser setup with the purpose to help with medical bills, and to give her husband time off from work so he can be there to support her. 

Here are their short Biographies:

Sandra Caperton

Sandra Caperton’s journey as a counselor started with her own struggle with addictions. Sandra, a recovering alcoholic addict, knows what it’s like to face those challenges – and to overcome them with help.

A graduate of Cloverleaf High School, Sandra grew up in Medina County. Sandra and her family moved to Ft. Myers, Fl. In 1980, It was there that she came to grips with her addictions and began turning her life around. Her husband, also a recovering alcoholic, and to whom she has been married for 37 years, supported her as she began the road to recovery.

Sandra was well into recovery when she started college, she wanted to do something positive with her life. “College helped me do that,” she said, but admitted it wasn’t easy sitting with 18- and 19-year-olds and taking remedial classes when she was 46

Sandra returned to Medina County to be closer to family and finished her graduate work in 2008. She holds a master degree in social work from the University of Akron, specializing in behavioral health, addiction and dual disorders, and is a licensed independent social worker and licensed chemical dependency counselor.

She began working for Solutions Behavioral Healthcare as an intern, and was hired as a full-time therapist upon graduation. She has had a rewarding experience there as a counselor for almost five years, but starting her own practice is something she’s always dreamed about.

In October 2012 her dream was realized when she opened Brite Outlook Counseling Center in Medina. She was working hard to get her practice opened and ready to help those struggling with addiction. In early December she began feeling sick, her energy was sapped, and it became difficult to work long hours.

On December 18th she went into the hospital for what she thought would be a routine gallbladder operation. But there were problems with the common bile duct, and on the 21st she underwent another surgery. This operation was unsuccessful, and she was transferred to the main campus of Cleveland Clinic. The surgeon there performed another operation on Christmas eve. Biopsies were taken and she was diagnosed with stage 3 pancreatic cancer, and has no medical coverage at this time.

Sandra is now on chemo therapy and radiation treatment for her cancer. The odds are not in her favor, but as with other challenges in life she is meeting this one head on. She is confident that she will triumph over the disease and return to her dream of helping those afflicted with addiction to alcohol or drugs recover as well.

Although she is being helped through the HCAP program, and the Cleveland Clinic Foundation, she has many other expenses, including prescription drugs and other medical providers. Sandra is most grateful to her friends at Solutions, friends in AA, and her family for their support during this difficult time in her life. 

 

David Caperton 

David Caperton was born in November 1945, the youngest of 8 children in a Medina County farm family. He has spent most of his life in this community. David is a Viet Nam veteran having served in the U.S. Navy.

David and Sandra were married on April 24, 1975 after both of them had failed first marriages. He had 3 sons, and Sandra had 2 sons, together they have a daughter. David believes that the failure of his first marriage was caused by his alcoholism. He found recovery on Sept 8, 1977 and has lived a sober life since that date.

David is grateful for being given a second chance to be a good husband and father to these 6 children. Both David and Sandra have worked hard to be good citizens and give back the wonderful gifts they have been given.

Now at the time in their lives that they should be able to relax and enjoy life they have met with tragic illness in the form of pancreatic cancer with Sandra. He needs to be able to spend as much time with his wife as possible, but since he is their only source of income he must work during this time of trial.

Cleveland Clinic has been wonderful, but there are still many expenses not being covered, outside medical providers, very expensive prescriptions, etc, and Sandra has no medical insurance.
story_txt:
Sandra was Diagnosed with stage 3 Pancreatic Cancer. This is a trying time for her as she fights her cancer. It  has put a huge strain on her and her husband both financially and emotionally. This is a fundraiser setup with the purpose to help with medical bills, and to give her husband time off from work so he can be there to support her. 
Here are their short Biographies:
Sandra Caperton




Sandra Caperton’s journey as a counselor started with her own struggle with addictions. Sandra, a recovering alcoholic addict, knows what it’s like to face those challenges – and to overcome them with help. 
A graduate of Cloverleaf High School, Sandra grew up in Medina County. Sandra and her family moved to Ft. Myers, Fl. In 1980, It was there that she came to grips with her addictions and began turning her life around. Her husband, also a recovering alcoholic, and to whom she has been married for 37 years, supported her as she began the road to recovery. 
Sandra was well into recovery when she started college, she wanted to do something positive with her life. “College helped me do that,” she said, but admitted it wasn’t easy sitting with 18- and 19-year-olds and taking remedial classes when she was 46 
Sandra returned to Medina County to be closer to family and finished her graduate work in 2008. She holds a master degree in social work from the University of Akron, specializing in behavioral health, addiction and dual disorders, and is a licensed independent social worker and licensed chemical dependency counselor. 
She began working for Solutions Behavioral Healthcare as an intern, and was hired as a full-time therapist upon graduation. She has had a rewarding experience there as a counselor for almost five years, but starting her own practice is something she’s always dreamed about. 
In October 2012 her dream was realized when she opened Brite Outlook Counseling Center in Medina. She was working hard to get her practice opened and ready to help those struggling with addiction. In early December she began feeling sick, her energy was sapped, and it became difficult to work long hours. 
On December 18th she went into the hospital for what she thought would be a routine gallbladder operation. But there were problems with the common bile duct, and on the 21st she underwent another surgery. This operation was unsuccessful, and she was transferred to the main campus of Cleveland Clinic. The surgeon there performed another operation on Christmas eve. Biopsies were taken and she was diagnosed with stage 3 pancreatic cancer, and has no medical coverage at this time. 
Sandra is now on chemo therapy and radiation treatment for her cancer. The odds are not in her favor, but as with other challenges in life she is meeting this one head on. She is confident that she will triumph over the disease and return to her dream of helping those afflicted with addiction to alcohol or drugs recover as well. 
Although she is being helped through the HCAP program, and the Cleveland Clinic Foundation, she has many other expenses, including prescription drugs and other medical providers. Sandra is most grateful to her friends at Solutions, friends in AA, and her family for their support during this difficult time in her life.

David and Sandra were married on April 24, 1975 after both of them had failed first marriages. He had 3 sons, and Sandra had 2 sons, together they have a daughter. David believes that the failure of his first marriage was caused by his alcoholism. He found recovery on Sept 8, 1977 and has lived a sober life since that date. 
David is grateful for being given a second chance to be a good husband and father to these 6 children. Both David and Sandra have worked hard to be good citizens and give back the wonderful gifts they have been given. 
Now at the time in their lives that they should be able to relax and enjoy life they have met with tragic illness in the form of pancreatic cancer with Sandra. He needs to be able to spend as much time with his wife as possible, but since he is their only source of income he must work during this time of trial. 
Cleveland Clinic has been wonderful, but there are still many expenses not being covered, outside medical providers, very expensive prescriptions, etc, and Sandra has no medical insurance.

story:
UPDATE: We are at the point of no return. The donor is taking her medications and so am I.  The airline tickets are non refundable and we have spent about $400 on medications alone already with more to come. 

 

Eight years ago I got carsick. I took a pregnancy test and it came out positive. Then another, then another. All positive. One day I started spotting and went to the OB.  They did an untrasound and could not find a baby in the uterus. We did blood tests that showed that there was little growth and it was growing outside where it should not be and would be a life threatening situation. They gave us medication to end the much wanted pregnancy.  One year later the same thing happened except the medication didnt work. I was carrying my medical records as I was walking down the aisle getting married to my husband because the physician was in fear of the ectopic pregnancy rupturing and me bleeding to death. Five days later I had my left tube removed.  

The next year we got pregnant again. We were excited since, with my "bad" tube gone we knew the chances of another tubal were low. But it was, and it left me with a severely damaged right tube.

We moved on to In Vitro Fertilization.  We got pregnant the first time around but the heartbeat was lost at 9 weeks.  Four months later we tried again and at 4 weeks we lost the baby again in an early miscarriage.

So we have two problems with having children. One is the fact that I no longer have functional tubes, and the other is that in the time it's taken us to go through all these ectopics I've gotten older - too old. We can solve both these problems with an egg doner via IVF. But that's expensive.

So we need your financial assistance.  We found a wonderful donor and a good clinic. Now we just need the money!

What do you get? You get naming rights! If you donate, you get to vote on the name of our child(ren) If you donate more, you pick one of the names that are voted on (my husband and I will also jointly put one - and only one - name on the list).

The doctors gives us an 80% chance this will work, and a 20% chance of multiples The total cost is $7000 (we're going out of country to keep costs down), but we can cover most of it. We just need a some help. 

Also, in the event of multiples, don't worry, you'll get to vote/suggest names twice. :)

 

Time is running out this will more than likely be our last attempt in trying to have a child.

And if you cannot help, please, contact your insurance companies or just talk to your friends about how IVF should at least be partially covered by health insurance. No one should be denied a family.

And lastly...

 

THANK YOU!

story:
What price do you put on the personal safety of your loved ones and yourself? I'd like it to be FREE.

My name is Dawn Jensen and I have been working on a way to improve personal safety issues by way of a mobile phone (cell phone) app. 

The app is a personal monitoring system that can let selected friends and loved ones know your movements without the need to get involved in lengthy conversations involving lots of questions. Let parents know when you are going out and when you get home safely, and everyone is happy - no fights, no third degree; and yet the peace of mind that lets you know that you can quickly call for help if it is needed. Or let the kids know you are safe if you live at home alone or are travelling. Quick, easy and discrete messages that keep those close to you in the loop without being obtrusive; and yet have the ability to find you quickly if you need to be found. Out running, cycling, horse-riding or walking alone, Home Safely Now is a must have. It works well for work situations too. If your work involves situations that could get touchy, or if you work late, then this app can be your best friend. There are so many uses for this app. Check out the website - www.homesafelynow.com - to find out more about what the app offers.

And the price! Well, I want this app to be FREE.  I want everyone to have the choice to use Home Safely Now - no matter what age, what gender, what lifestyle, what nationality or what belief system they have.

Let's work together to make the world a safer place,without fear of harassment, intimidation or attack. Together we can save lives. At the very least Home Safely Now will allay fears and make for happier, trusting relationships.  

I am only one person. So I need help from other people who see the value in having a personal safety device at their fingertips. Please join me in raising money to make this project a reality. I believe that one person can make a difference - but many people, working together, can change the world. 

Become a Hero. Raise money - save lives.

It doesn't matter how big or how small your contribution is. From $1 to thousands of dollars - every contribution will help make Home Safely Now an available device. By supporting the Home Safely Now campaign, you know that you are helping to keep yourself, your loved ones and complete strangers a little safer. Become a hero. Join the campaign now. 

How much do we need to make this campaign a success? 

  • $63869 is the projected cost of developing the Home Safely Now App; generating a moderate marketing campaign; listing the product for sale in the App Store and on Google Play; and paying for the overheads and running costs for 6 months while we develop and list the App. (I am not drawing a wage from this campaign. Additionally, I am contributing privately to extra administrative costs and to the business setup costs involved in this project. I believe in this business; and I am backing it with whatever private funds I can muster. But I don't have enough to bring the Home Safely Now App to fruition without the help of caring contributors.)
  • To thank you for your support, inspiration and contributions, we have some exciting PERKS for you. (However, contributions can be made without requiring PERKS, if that is what you would prefer to do.) Even a contribution under $10 will help us towards our goal of creating a safer world. But for a contribution of $10 or greater, you be appointed as a Home Safely Now Hero.  We want to acknowledge our Heroes. See your name on The WEB. For contributions over $25 you will be rewarded with great gifts and/or special experiences. Check out our PERKS section for full details.  
  • The Home Safely Now campaign is a Flexible Funding Campaign. Having stepped out of our comfort zones to start this campaign, my team and I are committed to making it work. I am determined to develop this app to its full potential, and success in this campaign will make that happen sooner. Raising less than the $63869, will mean that the worldwide roll out of this App will be slower. (We are starting in Australia, testing and improving the app here. But we expect to quickly roll it out to Europe, USA, Canada, and New Zealand within 18 months; and to Asia and the rest of the world within 30 months.) The more help we receive, the quicker we can work to keep people safer in all countries. As long as we can show support for the project, we can apply for traditional lending and funding, if we need to. So, any amount of support will catapult us towards ultimate success. 

Home Safely Now has great Partners

At Home Safely Now, we believe that life should be fun; and everyone should be able to work, play, travel, meet people, party, and live safely - without fear of harassment, intimidation or attack.

Our motto says it all:

The strong should not harm the weak; and the weak should not harm the strong. 

We have partnered with the successful developers at Buzinga Apps to develop a user-friendly, reliable, secure device that will continue to be upgraded as demand changes and as more research reveals trends and requirements. Home Safely Now is backed by the latest Cloud technology to assure users that the best possible security backup is at hand. Easy to use and with potential for quick adaptation to world-wide coverage, Home Safely Now will be the new must-have app.

We have secured the assistance of other professionals who will advise, support and contract to deliver a superior Phone App and associated media. 

By supporting our campaign, you can help protect other people like you. Maybe you will even help save lives. Be one of our Heroes. Join the Home Safely Now Indiegogo campaign today.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute to our campaign, but everyone can help spread the word.:

  • Get the word out to all your friends and family, to work associates, and to everyone you meet. Personal safety is too important to leave to chance. Scream it from the rooftops. We need funds. Please help Home Safely Now grow and develop.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

I sincerely thank every one of you for considering this opportunity to make the world a better place, and I hope that many of you will be able to contribute whatever you can to funding and promoting a great cause. Together we can make the world a safer place. 

Stay safe,

Dawn.

story:
Sacred Plants, Culture, and Human Rights

We are at a crossroads that will determine what our legacy of sacred plants will look like for future generations. 

The sacred plants – Ayahuasca, Peyote, Iboga, Psilocybin, among others– have helped humanity heal from illness and to evolve as conscious beings for thousands of years. However, prohibition also has a long history that dates back 500 years to the time of the Inquisition, an approach that is now being re-affirmed by the 2013 Report of the United Nations Office of Drugs and Crime, which erroneously lists sacred plants next to dangerous and synthetic psychoactive substances. 

However, an important breakthrough is also taking place in Mexico. The 2nd International Congress on Traditional Medicine & Public Health, to take place on April 3-5th in Toluca, Mexico will unite leading scientists & indigenous doctors to present the research basis for a policy review. The congress is a key milestone towards establishing an effective dialogue and putting forth an initiative that dispels the myth of “drug” completely from these medicines and that promotes an understanding of their potential within a medical context. Today, we need your support and donations to make this year’s Congress possible.

Call to Action: Support our 2014 Congress

Many of us have been touched by the healing power of the sacred plants through personal experiences. We also share a vision of seeing the end of prohibition and the reintegration of the wisdom of traditional medicine into medical science for the benefit of Humanity. If you have found a healing benefit for your own life in the sacred plants, we urge you to help us move forward a framework of therapeutic & spiritual use by making a donation.

Nierika A.C, a non-profit multidisciplinary association based in the State of Mexico with a 15-year history of supporting the preservation of indigenous healing traditions of sacred plant use, is collaborating with the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico, Department of Anthropology and Department of Medicine to bring this dialogue to the forefront of public opinion in Mexico. 

The intended outcomes of the congress are as follows:

1) To present comprehensive scientific research on the therapeutic use of sacred plants that will serve as a foundation for policy review and as a basis to support the regulated medical and cultural use of these medicines in Mexico;

2)  To increase multidisciplinary dialogue between Western scientists and traditional indigenous doctors and promote the intercultural models of healing & integration;

3)  To build intercultural alliances that unite tribal interests aimed at the conservation of sacred plant habitats in Mexico, the U.S., and South America, and to discuss sustainable management strategies for the sacred plants.

Our historic 1st International Congress: "Peyote: Traditional Medicine or Drug" took place at the Autonomous University of the State of México in Toluca in 2010.

Impact: Bringing Sacred Plants out from the Shadow of Prohibition and into the Light of Research & Therapeutic Application

Scientific research supports what traditional cultures already know – that the sacred plants are invaluable medicines that can serve as powerful catalysts for health and human transformation. 

Researchers from multiple disciplines such as anthropology, sociology, psychology, medicine, and psychiatry will play a key role in this year's congress calling for new research on psychoactive plants. Joining them will be a council of representatives from multiple indigenous nations with traditions of sacred plant use. Representation from indigenous nations from North and South America will include; the Wixárika, Yoreme-Yaqui, Otomí, Purépecha, Chichimeca, Mazatec, Cametsa (Colombia), Lakota (US), Diné (US), Cree (Canada), and Po-Chunk (US) nations, as well as the Native American Church of North America and Canada. 

The congress will cover a range of topics including; Ethnohistory of Sacred Plants, Legal Aspects of Sacred Plants, Health and Sacred Plants, and Art and Artistic Expressions related to Sacred Plants. Our framework will be to discuss how national and international policies may consider the use of sacred plants as a human right to health and to access the best available treatments for certain health conditions. 

Highlights from 1st Congress in 2010

The 1st International Congress for Traditional Medicine and Public Health: Peyote, Traditional Medicine or Drug?, took place in 2010. This historic event was the first of its kind and succeeded in bringing together indigenous nations with traditions of ceremonial use of peyote from Canada, the U.S., and Mexico. 

Scientific sessions at the 2010 congress covered topics such as the long term effects of peyote use in indigenous populations, the role of peyote in traditional medicine and public health, ethnographic reviews of peyote traditions and analysis of the international legal framework for the therapeutic and religious use of peyote and other sacred plants.The scientific portion of the conferences was complemented with roundtables with healers and spiritual representatives of more than ten indigenous nations that use peyote as religious sacrament. The remarkable lineup of speakers at the 2010 congress included  Dr. John Halpern from Harvard University, Dr. Rosa Giove from Takiwasi Center, and Dr. Jose María Fabregas from Spain. 

A Wixarika (Huichol) delegation attended the 2010 congress and will attend again this year with your support and donations. 

Donate Today & Help us Cover Travel & Lodging Costs for Indigenous Delegates

We need to raise $13,000 to cover the travel, food, and lodging costs for the international delegation of indigenous leaders at this year's congress. We invite you to support this historic event with a generous donation TODAY. You can receive a number of "perks" in gratitude for your donation, including the opportunity to experience sacred plant ceremonies with the help of traditional healers during a retreat this spring 2014. 

How Will the Funds be Spent?

Amount

Type of Expense

$4,000.00

·  Travel and lodging for 10 Wixarika authorities from Jalisco Mexico.

$1,500.00

·  Travel and lodging for Cametsa Governor and traditional healer from Sibundoy, Colombia.

$1,500.00

·  Travel and lodging for 2 Yaqui authorities from Sonora, Mexico.

$1,200.00

·  Travel and lodging for 2 Seri delegates from Sonora, Mexico.

$1,200.00

·  Travel and lodging for 2 authorities from the Diné nation Albuquerque, New Mexico.

$1,800.00

·  Travel and lodging for 2 Lakota ceremonial leaders.

$400.00

·  Travel and lodging expenses of 1 Mazatec indigenous healer from Oaxaca.

$500.00

·  Travel and lodging expenses for a group delegation of Purrépechas from Michoacan.

$300.00

·  Travel and lodging for a group delegation of Otomi from Mexico State and Queretaro State.

$300.00

·  Travel and lodging expenses for 1 Olmeca indigenous healer from Oaxaca.

$300.00

·  Travel and lodging expenses for 4 delegates from the Chichimec nation of Mexico state.

The total funds needed to cover the costs listed above totals $13,000. Our total projected costs for the Congress event total almost $19,000 and we need the support of our community to help us cover these costs. We are prioritizing sponsoring our indigenous delegates due to their limited economic resources that may prevent them from attending if their costs are not covered by our organization. If we do not raise 100% of the funds, we will limit the number of participants that we will sponsor in order to remain within our budget. We will do everything we can to minimize expenses and find less expensive alternatives to allow for representation from each of the indigenous nations we've listed.

A Wixarika leader and Lance Long, Po-Chunk tribal leader at the 2010 Congress. 


This year’s congress titled, “Sacred Plants, Culture, and Human Rights”, will take place on the campus of the Department of Anthropology at the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico, April 3-5th in Toluca, Mexico and will be attended by international scientists, doctors, academics, government representatives, and indigenous leaders from North & South America. A declaration will be drafted as a result of the congress to continue our advocacy efforts to bring these plant medicines out from the shadow of prohibition and into the light of research and therapeutic application.

The time has never been as critical as now for us to take a stand against the erroneous classification of traditional medicines and sacred plants, and to work together to build new models of intercultural medicine and exchange for the benefit of human health.  Please consider making a donation to our Indiegogo campaign to support our 2014 congress and help us meet our goal of raising $13,000.

You can still participate in the congress as a participant. We are currently finalizing our program of keynote speakers and conference presenters. For more information please visit our website at www.nierika.info.

Other Ways You Can Help

To make a donation directly to Nierika's bank account please see the following information:

Cuenta a nombre de/Account Name:Nierika AC

Con domicilio en/ Address: Casahuate sn, Colonia: Ocuilan de Arteaga, Municipio de Ocuilan, Mexico, Cp. 52480 Tel 7141910014

Numero de Cta/Account Number: 92-00184961-4

Banco de la Cta/ Bank Name:  Banco Santander  Suc. 5187 Malinalco 

Clabe Interbancaria/ Password for Interbank deposit: 014440920018496141


Help us spread the word about this campaign to your friends!

Contact us for more info at nierikaac@gmail.com.

For more info on the 2nd International Congress for Traditional Medicine & Public Health please visit our website: www.nierika.info/english or click HERE.

To make a  donation to support travel & lodging expenses for our indigenous delegation please select the level at which you can support and receive one of our perks as a symbol of our appreciation.
story_txt:
Sacred Plants, Culture, and Human Rights
We
are at a crossroads that will determine what our legacy of sacred plants will
look like for future generations. 
The
sacred plants – Ayahuasca, Peyote, Iboga, Psilocybin, among others– have helped
humanity heal from illness and to evolve as conscious beings for
thousands of years. However, prohibition also has a long history that dates
back 500 years to the time of the Inquisition, an approach that is now being re-affirmed
by the 2013 Report of the United Nations
Office of Drugs and Crime, which erroneously lists sacred plants next to
dangerous and synthetic psychoactive substances. However, an important breakthrough is also taking place in
Mexico. The 2nd International Congress on
Traditional Medicine & Public Health, to take place on April 3-5th in Toluca, Mexico will unite leading
scientists & indigenous doctors to present the research basis for a
policy review. The congress is a key milestone towards establishing an effective dialogue and putting forth an initiative that dispels the myth of “drug” completely from these medicines and that promotes an understanding of their potential within a medical context. Today,
we need your support and donations to make this year’s Congress possible.Call to Action: Support our 2014 Congress
Many
of us have been touched by the healing power of the sacred plants through
personal experiences. We also share a vision of seeing the end of prohibition
and the reintegration of the wisdom of traditional medicine into medical
science for the benefit of Humanity. If
you have found a healing benefit for your own life in the sacred plants, we urge you to help us move forward a framework of therapeutic & spiritual
use by making a donation.Nierika A.C, a non-profit multidisciplinary association based in the State of Mexico with a 15-year history of supporting the preservation of indigenous healing traditions of sacred plant use, is collaborating with the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico, Department of Anthropology and Department of Medicine to bring this dialogue to the forefront of public opinion in Mexico. The intended outcomes of the congress are as follows:1) To present comprehensive scientific research on the therapeutic use of sacred plants that will serve as a foundation for policy review and as a basis to support the regulated medical and cultural use of these medicines in Mexico;2)  To increase multidisciplinary dialogue between Western scientists and traditional indigenous doctors and promote the intercultural models of healing & integration;3) 
To build intercultural alliances that unite tribal interests aimed at the
conservation of sacred plant habitats in Mexico, the U.S., and South America, and to discuss sustainable management strategies for the sacred plants.Our historic 1st International Congress: "Peyote: Traditional Medicine or Drug" took place at the Autonomous University of the State of México in Toluca in 2010.Impact: Bringing Sacred Plants out from the Shadow of Prohibition and into the Light of Research & Therapeutic Application
Scientific
research supports what traditional cultures already know – that the sacred
plants are invaluable medicines that can serve as powerful catalysts for health
and human transformation. 

Researchers from multiple disciplines such as anthropology, sociology, psychology, medicine, and psychiatry will play a key role in this year's congress calling for new research on psychoactive plants. Joining them will be a council of representatives from multiple indigenous nations with traditions of sacred plant use. Representation from indigenous nations from North and South America will include; the Wixárika, Yoreme-Yaqui, Otomí, Purépecha, Chichimeca, Mazatec, Cametsa (Colombia), Lakota (US), Diné (US), Cree (Canada), and Po-Chunk (US) nations, as well as the Native American Church of North America and Canada. The congress will cover a range of topics including; Ethnohistory of Sacred Plants, Legal Aspects of Sacred Plants, Health and Sacred Plants, and Art and Artistic Expressions related to Sacred Plants. Our framework will be to discuss how national and international policies may consider the use of sacred plants as a human right to health and to access the best available treatments for certain health conditions. 
Highlights from 1st Congress in 2010The 1st International Congress for Traditional Medicine and Public Health: Peyote, Traditional Medicine or Drug?, took place in 2010. This historic event was the first of its kind and succeeded in bringing together indigenous nations with traditions of ceremonial use of peyote from Canada, the U.S., and Mexico. 
Scientific sessions at the 2010 congress covered topics such as the long term
effects of peyote use in indigenous populations, the role of peyote in
traditional medicine and public health, ethnographic reviews of peyote
traditions and analysis of the international legal framework for the
therapeutic and religious use of peyote and other sacred plants.The scientific
portion of the conferences was complemented with roundtables with healers and
spiritual representatives of more than ten indigenous nations that use peyote
as religious sacrament. The remarkable lineup of speakers at the 2010 congress included  Dr. John Halpern from Harvard University, Dr. Rosa Giove from Takiwasi Center, and Dr. Jose María Fabregas from Spain. A Wixarika (Huichol) delegation attended the 2010 congress and will attend again this year with your support and donations. Donate Today & Help us Cover Travel & Lodging Costs for Indigenous DelegatesWe need to raise $13,000 to cover the travel, food, and lodging costs for the international delegation of indigenous leaders at this year's congress. We invite you to support this historic event with a generous donation TODAY. You can receive a number of "perks" in gratitude for your donation, including the opportunity to experience sacred plant ceremonies with the help of traditional healers during a retreat this spring 2014. How Will the Funds be Spent?



Amount


Type of Expense




$4,000.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for 10 Wixarika authorities from Jalisco Mexico.




$1,500.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for Cametsa Governor and traditional healer from Sibundoy, Colombia.




$1,500.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for 2 Yaqui authorities from Sonora, Mexico. 




$1,200.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for 2 Seri delegates from Sonora, Mexico.




$1,200.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for 2 authorities from the Diné nation Albuquerque, New Mexico.




$1,800.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for 2 Lakota ceremonial leaders.




$400.00


·  Travel and lodging
  expenses of 1 Mazatec indigenous healer from Oaxaca. 




$500.00


·  Travel and lodging
  expenses for a group delegation of Purrépechas from Michoacan. 




$300.00


·  Travel and lodging
  for a group delegation of Otomi from Mexico State and Queretaro State. 




$300.00


·  Travel and lodging
  expenses for 1 Olmeca indigenous healer from Oaxaca.




$300.00


·  Travel and lodging
  expenses for 4 delegates from the Chichimec nation of Mexico state.



The total funds needed to cover the costs listed above totals $13,000. Our total projected costs for the Congress event total almost $19,000 and we need the support of our community to help us cover these costs. We are prioritizing sponsoring our indigenous delegates due to their limited economic resources that may prevent them from attending if their costs are not covered by our organization. If we do not raise 100% of the funds, we will limit the number of participants that we will sponsor in order to remain within our budget. We will do everything we can to minimize expenses and find less expensive alternatives to allow for representation from each of the indigenous nations we've listed.A Wixarika leader and Lance Long, Po-Chunk tribal leader at the 2010 Congress. 

This year’s congress titled, “Sacred Plants, Culture, and Human Rights”, will take place on the campus of the Department of Anthropology at the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico, April 3-5th in Toluca, Mexico and will be attended by international scientists, doctors, academics, government representatives, and indigenous leaders from North & South America. A declaration will be drafted as a result of the congress to continue our advocacy efforts to bring these plant medicines out from the shadow of prohibition and into the light of research and therapeutic application.
The time has never been as critical as now for us to take a stand against the erroneous classification of traditional medicines and sacred plants, and to work together to build new models of intercultural medicine and exchange for the benefit of human health.  Please consider making a donation to our Indiegogo campaign to support our 2014 congress and help us meet our goal of raising $13,000.
You can still participate in the congress as a participant. We are currently finalizing our program of keynote speakers and conference presenters. For more information please visit our website at www.nierika.info.

Other Ways You Can Help
To make a donation directly to Nierika's bank account please see the following information:

Cuenta a nombre de/Account Name:Nierika AC
Con domicilio en/ Address: Casahuate sn, Colonia: Ocuilan de Arteaga, Municipio de Ocuilan, Mexico, Cp. 52480 Tel 7141910014
Numero de Cta/Account Number: 92-00184961-4
Banco de la Cta/ Bank Name:  Banco Santander  Suc. 5187 Malinalco 
Clabe Interbancaria/ Password for Interbank deposit: 014440920018496141


Help us spread the word about this campaign to your friends!
Contact us for more info at nierikaac@gmail.com.
For more info on the 2nd International Congress for Traditional Medicine & Public Health please visit our website: www.nierika.info/english or click HERE.

To make a  donation to support travel & lodging expenses for our indigenous delegation please select the level at which you can support and receive one of our perks as a symbol of our appreciation.

story:
What Does it Do?

Well as simply put as possible, it kind of does everything. With LifeLink it's not about how much it does (because it does a lot!) but the way in which it does these things. The main goal is to link everything together and provide a single, simple, cohesive organization experience for everyone.

Calendar

In LifeLink, everything revolves around the calendar, since in reality, everything revolves around time. The calendar has all of the functionality that you would expect it to have from any other calendar app but shines in its ability to pull data from every corner of the LifeLink app.

School

LifeLink is the ultimate school organizer tool. It keeps track of your class schedule, homework assignments, test dates, extracurricular activities and everything in between. Because everything is linked together, homework assignments automatically are added to your reminders and your class schedule is automatically added to your calendar, making it unlike anything else!

Work

Reminders

Diet

Exercise

Sleep

Finances

Social

Notes

LifeLink Forecast (Stress)

LifeLink includes a neat little feature called the LifeLink Forecast. LifeLink Forecast uses a hierarchical system of equations and algorithms to give you an idea of how stressful the upcoming day or week is expected to be. It even has a "zoom" view so you can see approximately how stressful your day will be hour by hour. Forecast operates in the now, so the moment you add a new assignment or new task, Forecast will update itself to reflect the changes.

We put a lot of time and thought into this little feature. In fact, we spent more time and effort on Forecast than on any other part of LifeLink. It is such a little feature but it is one that defines LifeLink as a whole. Forecast shows off the amazing things that are possible with LifeLink. It's what makes it a truly smart organizer.


The Vision

The idea behind LifeLink was to create something truly unique and useful. We want to build something that would really benefit people, and this is how LifeLink was born. LifeLink will be the most powerful organization tool that there is. It is in essence, the organizer of organizers. No overlapping functionality, no fragmentation of functionality and no nonsense. The main goal we have in mind with LifeLink is to finally provide a simple, cohesive, and pleasant organization experience that is powerful enough to organize everything you throw at it.

“3-Dimensional Software”

Software in its current state operates mostly in what we call “2-dimensional processing”. It hones in on one thing at a time, such as being solely a calendar, solely a reminder list, or solely a financial tracker. It’s like a sphere, if you look at in 2-dimensions, it looks like a circle, but there is so much more to it than that. Software has recently began to incorporate some “3-dimensional processing” which recognizes that a there is more than one side to things. A calendar event is not just a calendar event. It fits into other categories and has influence over other things and is itself influenced by other things. Perhaps the best example of this would be an appointment for a visit to the doctor. In our minds we are not just thinking of the time of the appointment and the location. We are also thinking about how much the appointment will cost us, how it may conflict with other events in our lives, and how it fits into the grand scheme of things. This is the type of processing that we have designed LifeLink to perform. This is the type of process that attempts to mimic the way that we think.

The Campaign

LifeLink is a pretty large project. Each individual part of the app has the amount of functionality that a single standalone app has, and there are 10 or more portions of LifeLink fit that description. Our team in its current state, would take roughly 5 years to complete it on our own. That’s simply too long which is why we have turned to you for some help. We would like to bring in developers to greatly speed up the process.

We would like to put together 10 small groups of developers to handle the development of each part of the app simultaneously. This would allow us to get LifeLink finished in about a year. The design and user interface have already been completed, which is one big check off the list, and the math behind it has been completed as well, leaving only the programming to be done. We essentially have the entire blueprint of the app completed and we simply need it to be constructed by developers.

We feel like LifeLink is far more than just another app. It’s a train of thought; something that would inspire others and help move software in the right direction.

The Perks

Believer! - $5

Thank you for believing in us! We are extremely thankful for you contribution and your name will be featured on the believer page of our website!

Please note: Your name will only be placed on our website with your permission.

First!!!!! - $25

The first thing you get is access to the Betas the second they go live! You will also get a free 1 year premium LifeLink membership, and once the year is up, rates will be discounted by 75%. Your name will also be featured on the believer page on our website!

Please note: Your name will only be placed on our website with your permission.

Get Access! - $15

Receive a free 6 month LifeLink Premium membership and 50% off of memberships after your 1 year expires! Your name will also be placed on the Believer page or our website!

Please note: Your name will only be placed on our website with your permission.

Best Friends Forever! - $50

Not only will you get access to the Betas and have your name posted on our website, but you will also be our friend forever with a lifetime Premium LifeLink membership!

Please note: Your name will only be placed on our website with your permission.

Lots of Love! - $80

You get to be our best friend forever (receive everything mentioned in that perk) and you will also receive this really awesome LifeLink t-shirt just to show how very much we appreciate you. We really can't thank you enough!

In Case it Gets Chilly - $150

You’re going to get everything mentioned in the “Lots of Love” perk as well as a super comfy LifeLink hoodie just in case it gets a little chilly outside.

Shout Out! - $500

First things first, you will get everything in the “Lots of Love” Perk as well as an amazing LifeLink Hoodie. That’s the beginning though. We would also like to give you a personal shout out on all of our social media pages as well as have some 1 on 1 time with you via Google Hangouts!

LifeLink Hall of Fame! - $6,000

Everything inside of the “Shout Out” perk is yours and you will get a special tribute to you on our home page! We will also fly you out here to Orlando for a party on launch day. We will put you in a hotel and you will meet the team over dinner!

Please note: Launch day is not official yet but will be announced after the beta period begins.

Frequently Asked Questions

What’s left to do?

We have completed the design of the application for Android, IOS, and The web (finishing up the design for Windows Phone and Windows RT). We have also completed nearly all of the math behind it. Essentially we have the completed blueprint and are in the process of constructing it.

When will the LifeLink Beta version be released to contributors?

We're going to be completely upfront and honest here. LifeLink will take some time to get out to you. (Read "The Campaign" above for more information) Our target launch date for the Beta is June 21, 2014. We feel like it should be ready for public betas by then, though we cannot make any firm promise that it will launch on this date. We will keep you updated on the progress of LifeLink and will announce the Beta launch date in mid-April.

When is LifeLink expected to be completed?

Our goal is to launch LifeLink to the public on November 27, 2014 (exactly 1 year after the launch of this campaign). Please keep in mind that this is only our target launch date and is subject to change. We will not release a half-baked product and will take as much time as is necessary to complete a quality product.

Why is there a limited amount of Beta access?

We have decided to limit the number of people who can sign up for the Beta in order to ensure that there is no overload when the Beta launches. We want to make sure that we can have the app tested without causing too much traffic and it will make it a bit easier for us to manage.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We understand that there are many of you who would like to see LifeLink become a reality but are unable to contribute to the project financially. We would first like to thank you for giving us a moment of your time and taking a look at our project. It would also be greatly appreciated if you could just share this page with your friends and family to help us spread the word.

If you are a developer and have what it takes to work on the LifeLink team, then we want you! Starting January 15, 2014, we will begin recruiting developers to join our team. If you are interested, please send an email to nujra01@gmail.com for more information.

We would like to thank everyone that has contributed to the project in any way, whether it be financially or just passing the word along. You are helping us make LifeLink a reality and that is something that we could never thank you enough for!

story:
Need to raise $2,000 for Score System

Money, and the pursuit of it, has always been interlaced with motorsports and racing.  In the center of this global recession, with many brands suffering and most marketing budgets slashed, sponsorship and funding for racing can be incredibly hard to come by, and even when some is secured, it is often not quite enough.  It especially takes a toll on the budget strapped grassroots racing establishments. 

Unfortunately our industry (karting) has not been a profitable one for the past 6 or 7 years.  In fact, my husband and I both have outside income (jobs) to support our family and subsequently fund the track when needed these days. You might be asking: Why are we holding on to a business that isn’t making money?

We, like most track owners and operators at the grassroots level of motorsports, do it for the love of racing and for the kids.  Our payback is seeing the excitement in young kids as they pursue their dream of becoming a race car driver.  We get to realize and help build something special with them, as well as see self-esteem blossom, determination grow and positive family bonding transform lives.

Years ago when I was a Property Manager I adopted a philosophy of helping others that I learned from the late Zig Ziglar.  He would say: “You can have everything in life that you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want.”  The following quote from Joel Osteen also keeps me going when I start to feel sorry for myself because I gave up my career in real estate and I don’t get to drive a nice new car or get to take vacations like I used to:

“Being successful doesn’t make you great.  What makes you great is when you reach back and help somebody else be great.” 

With over 20 years in the karting industry and having had our own children race competitively, we have a lot of knowledge to share.  We offer a fun, enriching and competitive sport for the aspiring racer. In addition to offering driving clinics to our youth racers we plan to add career path coaching, team management, and marketing plans for them and their parents with new workshops and webinars for the coming year.  Our children are now grown, but Kaley – our youngest – still helps out a lot at the family business with one-on-one coaching and driver development programs that she has created from her years of experience on the kart racing circuit.(She currently races Sprint Cars.)

While karting might be perceived as a hobby for some people, for others it is regarded as a steppingstone to the higher ranks of NASCAR and Formula One. Professional NASCAR drivers Jeff Gordon, Dale Earnhardt Jr., Danica Patrick, Kyle Larson and others started out racing competitive go-karts — and our young KAM racers dream of stepping up to the "big leagues," too.

At KAM Kartway we pride ourselves in developing drivers more than anything.  These kids have big dreams.  And for that reason any and all support of our racing program is greatly appreciated and all donations and sponsorships are used for that purpose. 

There is a current opportunity for a track improvement that has been presented to KAM that we are asking for help with…..

We have a generous sponsor willing to donate $2,000 for a Scoring and Timing System at our race track if we can secure matching funds to complete the purchase.  This scoring system will take our track to the next level and is the technology that we urgently need.

now grown, but Kaley – our youngest – still helps out a lot at the family
business with one-on-one coaching and driver development programs that she has
created from her years of experience on the kart racing circuit.(She
currently races Sprint Cars.)
While karting might be perceived as a hobby for some people,
for others it is regarded as a steppingstone to the higher ranks of NASCAR and
Formula One. Professional NASCAR drivers
Jeff Gordon, Dale Earnhardt Jr., Danica Patrick, Kyle Larson and others started
out racing competitive go-karts — and our young KAM racers dream of stepping up
to the "big leagues," too. 
At KAM Kartway we pride ourselves in developing drivers more
than anything.  These kids have big dreams.  And
for that reason any and all support of our racing program is greatly
appreciated and all donations and sponsorships are used for that purpose.  
There is a current opportunity for a track improvement that has
been presented to KAM that we are asking for help with…..

We
have a generous sponsor willing to donate $2,000 for a Scoring and Timing
System at our race track if we can secure matching funds to complete the
purchase.  This scoring system will take
our track to the next level and is the technology that we urgently need.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hermo Malaguit, the inventor of sink magic. I care about my family, my world community,  and the environment I have been a healthcare worker for over 24 years.l help assist in providing diagnosis to multitudes of hospital patients.

I am passionate about water conservation and I want to soraed the word out there that sink magic will help save at least 40 gallons per day per household, that a whopping 14,600 gallons per year, imaging 1 million people using sink magic, the water saving is astronomical!( approximately 14.6 Billion gallons per year )


The magnitude of the benefits  from a small gadget and a small amount of $30 will create a grass root movement collectively help in saving massive amount of water yearly! And as a side benefit, since dishwashing is easier, people do not have to buy non-biodegradable disposable plates to throw in landfills, saving us precious landfill real estate for the future generation!

 

We need $30 contribution and you will get a single unit of Sink magic PSWD.

The funding will be apportioned into professional marketing and product education of people just like the other known name brands.

The uniqueness of the perks is not the ""price"  but the knowlege and deep emotion you are letting go and expressing. When you contibute, I can assure you that you will be satisfied with your decision. When you use sink magic, you are on your way to reducing water consumption for the rest of your life.

Our goal, whether we reached it or not, we will find a way to keep educatiing people in water conservation. There is a saying "Ignorance is not an excuse, but Knowlege is power!" 

The Impact

I am sending an appeal to our many friends who are deeply concerned about the environment and overall wasteful water over usage. Please use sink magic and see how must you can help reduce water usage.

Please read and follow the links of many bloggers who have experience sink magic convenience. You will be amazed about what they are saying.

 Review~ SinkMagic

March 13, 2013 by pankuch1605 10 Comments

            How do you clean your dishes?  Do you have a routine?  Does life sometimes interfere with your routine?

 Let me introduce you to SinkMagic.  As a Mom, if you are like me, You start a project and always get the “Hey Mom come here for a second”.  This is an awesome product for all of you Moms out there that want/need to save time with a mundane chore such as dish washing.  This innovative device is a portable sink water diverter.  This product will provide ease and convenience through the automatic creation of a basin as you wash your dishes enabling rapid completion of your chore.

     3 easy ways you use Sink Magic

  • Plug n Go Technique- means you do not need to make a basin of water, after plugging in Sink Magic, you start washing immediately.  You will find that the water will automatically collect into a basin which aids in pre-soaking the other dishes while you scrub the other.  You will also notice that the water will keep replenishing without overflowing, It’s like magic.
  • Plug n Soak Technique- How many of us cannot find the time to do things we need to do?  This technique is very handy when you don’t have time to  to wash the dishes after your meal.  This is not an issue, simply plug in Sink Magic. You will create a create a basin, soak your dirty dishes and leave.  You can then come back to complete the chore when you have the time.  
  • Dishwasher Helper- You create your basin, then immerse your dishes before putting then in the dishwasher.  No pre-scrubbing!  Genius!

          Please watch the video to see for yourself exactly how Sink Magic works.  This video was made by and with the inventor of the product.

   This video and the product really impressed me.  I remember the old way I used to wash dishes.  I would stick that metal drain plug, fill with water and soak my dishes.  When I had the time to come back to them, the water would be cold and nasty.  I would have to stick my hand in that ucky water to pull the plug so I could start washing the dishes.  If I would start washing right away the sink would over flow and that would be a big mistake.  This is where Sink Magic comes into play.  The Sink Magic way is so easy.  Wet, Plug and Use.  If I had did this from the start, I would be done.  Same pile of dirty dishes, created a basin for the dirty dishes up to the brim.  No time to wash, soak them and come back later.  When you come back, all you have to do is lift the dish and start washing immediately.  Their is no sticking your hands in cold ucky water, The warm water you use will warm the cold water and feel very nice on your hands.  You just saved time, money and effort.  Do not forget the soapy dish goes to the opposite sink where the third and final rinse will take place.  The water will be soapy clean and can be used as a soaker for future dirty dishes.

 I highly recommend this product to all Moms.  We have so much on our plates(no pun intended) and our time is at a premium.  You want to save time anywhere you can.  This product does just that.  I am a creature of habit.  I really dislike change but Sink Magic has changed my life for the for the better.  Spending time with my family and not being rushed to complete these kind of tasks, has really helped.  It is really a fun product.  I even have my kids taught how to use it.  Yes, they are young but this is a chore they are happy to help with.  They think it is very fun.

 You can purchase a Sink Magic for yourself.  Right now they are having a sale on their site.

Pro’s~

  • Saves time, money and effort 
  • Very affordable
  • Easy to use.

Con’s~  None

My Impression~  My whole family gives this product a thumbs up.  Washing my dishes has never been easy.  This product has saved me valuable time, which I can now spend with my family.  We take so much for granted. When you can save at something to give time to something, that means so much.  

Disclosure~  I received the above complimentary product for the purpose of a written review.  All opinions are 100% my own.  Whether or not you agree, I only recommend products I personally use and feel would be good for my readers.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

To all my friends and other people who cannot help monetarily, I would like to request that you all "share and like" sinkmagic to help promote awareness of this important campaign. You're comtribution will be greatly appreciated too.

Please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Update: We have reached our benchmark of $3,500 after only five days! The support the Riot feels from the community is amazing! We still have many expenses to cover on the road to World Cup VI, and our new benchmark goal is $6,000. Can you help us reach our goal?

Check out our new video: The Inglorious Riot - A Quidditch World Cup Story !!!!!

This campaign is to raise funds for quidditch team The Boston Riot to reach World Cup VI in Kissimmee, Florida! We have been unable to fully fund our way, and our opportunity to compete at World Cup VI is in jeopardy. We need your support to get there.

 

 

The Boston Riot: Who We Are, and How We Got Here


The Boston Riot is the story of a collection of dedicated young quidditch players out of Boston, Massachusetts. The team originated in Fall 2012, as a "B" team for Emerson College headed up by captain Ben Nadeau to accommodate the level of talent at the college. However, the group became independent under the leadership of coach Rose Pleuler, assistant coach Jackson Maher (of Emerson College Quidditch) and co-captains Todd Mitchell and Jagger Kugler. The Riot set their eyes on World Cup VI and said: We can do this. The team has flourished with the enthusiasm and dedication shown by each and every member of the team. 

With other Northeast powerhouses such as Emerson, Boston University, and Tufts in the area, the Riot has learned quickly from defeat, and are a stronger team for it. Inherent underdogs, the Riot knows how to have fun and also how to compete at a high level.

The Riot reached the Northeast Regional tournament hopeful but aware of the obstacles ahead. After all, only 11 teams would qualify for World Cup, and we had veterans BU and RIT in our pool on the first day. But we started off the day with momentum, beating the Badassalisks 80*-0 and RPI 150*-0. We left Day 1 third in our pool.

That meant on Day 2, if we could win our first game, we would qualify for World Cup. It was within reach. Our opponent: University of Rochester, who had ended Day 1 first in their pool, and ranked 5th overall. Thus began the most nerve-racking and exciting game of quidditch we have played to date. Relying on a scrappy defense with keeper Tyler Trudeau and seasoned beaters (to name a couple) Bobby O'Neil and Rebecca Contreres, we kept the score low. After our first snitch grab by seeker Brandon Cardwell was called off, we were able to make our victory official with a grab by seeker/keeper Louie Contino, winning the game 50*-40.

The Boston Riot is officially World Cup bound.

The team couldn't have dreamed of a more amazing quidditch experience. However, we have been unable to fully fund our way, and our opportunity to compete at World Cup VI is in jeapordy. We need your support to get there.

Please support the Boston Riot! 

 

What We Need!

Your donation will help pay the way for these main expenses:

  • Flights
  • Hotel accommodation
  • Transportation to the fields

Our expenses come to be about $325 per player. This is more than our donations cap, because we want to keep our expectations realistic. Any and all contributions to this team will be greatly celebrated!

We've provided some fun perks to our donation caps, please take a look!

 

You can Support The Boston Riot by making some noise about our goal, and supporting us on our media pages:

http://www.facebook.com/TheBostonRiot

https://twitter.com/Boston_Riot

 

"Playing with the Riot is like playing with a bunch of puppies that attack in formation and are good at tackling." Bobby O'Neil, Beater

"I cried tears of joy when we qualified for world cup. All of our hard work had finally payed off." Tyler Trudeau, Keeper

"The Riot is more than a team to me, it's a family. A super dysfunctional family, but the kind that gets a TV show made about it and everyone loves and wants to be a part of." Ryan Smythe, Chaser/Beater

"I like Bobby O'Neil as a beating partner more than I like My Little Pony and I REALLY like my Little Pony." Rebecca Contreres, Beater

 

The Team

Rose Pleuler; Senior, coach

Jackson Maher; Junior, assistant coach (unrostered)

 

Jagger Kugler; co-captain, Keeper

Todd Mitchell; co-captain, Beater

Alex Uriati; Chaser

Alison DeStefano; Chaser

Austin Mohn; Beater

Ben Wessels; Chaser

Bobby O'Neil; Beater

Denver Stoddard; Chaser

DJ Pollard; Chaser

Emily Oliver; Chaser

JD Knapp; Chaser

Leeanne Dillmann; Chaser/Beater

Louie Contino; Keeper/Seeker

Madeleine Wojdak; Beater

Marissa Herman; Beater

Nina Pellechio; Chaser

Ryan Smythe; Chaser/Beater

Sean Clampett; Keeper/Chaser

Sean Mack; Seeker

Tyler Trudeau; Keeper/Chaser

Z Kuester; Beater

 

Unrostered team members:

Frank Gao; athletic trainer

Patrick Sheehy; Chaser

Jes Slavin; Chaser

Carter Olson; Chaser

Brooke Lydon; Chaser

Tim Lawson; Chaser

Rebecca Contreres; Beater

Liz Fisher; Chaser

Brandon Cardwell; Seeker

story:
(Video: Teaser trailer of "First Breath - Last Breath" documentary, currently in post-production!)

A note about funding

Unlike other online platforms (such as Kickstarter), this is a "Flexible Funding" campaign, which means that we receive all contributions, whether or not we hit our goal. But the more we receive, the more we are able to achieve. Thank you so much for your support!

The pitch

Who we are: A revolutionary performance ensemble that continues to seek to change the face of performance, offering aspects of performance that lie beyond the mask of popular culture.

What we need: Support with completing several projects, including music recordings, videos, and a documentary, that are integral to us gaining visibility and developing global exhibition and performance opportunities.

What we offer: We are committed to our art and will continue to invoke vulnerability, pursue authenticity, and reveal what is possible (and in some instances, what is impossible) in performance, art, and our daily lives. And for this campaign, we are offering a range of creative perks that allow various levels of immersion into our art and creative process.

 

About Bad Unkl Sista

Having grown up teaching alongside my mother in the dance studio adjoining my house, I experienced dance as a part of my daily life. I continue to dance, choreograph, design wearable art ("couture"), build art installations, and evolve both as an artist and as a human being. I have remained unconditionally devoted to my creative practice for over 25 years, and my commitment to art and community keeps expanding each day.

I founded Bad Unkl Sista ten years ago. We utilize elements of Japanese Butoh, physical theater, and other influences to create unique fusions of music, movement, costuming, and theater. Our performances strive to defy categorization and move each witness to a state of extraordinary and memorable being.

 

Our campaign

Bad Unkl Sista is at a critical point in our growth. In 2011, Goyo Aranaga joined Bad Unkl Sista as Music Director. Adding live original music to our productions has created a perfect extension to the Bad Unkl Sista performance aesthetic. In 2012, we staged an opera-scale production, "First Breath - Last Breath" and realized a new level of potential. We are now capable of presenting our work at a much larger scale, and are ready for a broader audience.

We are working on several essential projects, including music recordings, videos, and a documentary, that are integral to us gaining visibility and developing opportunities with promoters, museums, festivals, and large-scale projects — locally and around the world.

After years of dedication to our art and service to community, our vision is within reach!

 

What this means to us

Our vision has always been to change the face of performance, offering aspects of performance that lie beyond the mask of popular culture. We are not interested in entertaining. Instead, we want to give the gift of substance that can be taken into the world as an inspirational lifeline for future generations on our planet.

We are committed and will continue to invoke vulnerability, pursue authenticity, and reveal what is possible (and in some instances, what is impossible) in performance, art, and our daily lives.

 

How funding will be used

We are seeking to raise $25,000 to finance completion of many projects (using material from our 2012 production "First Breath - Last Breath") that will be used to promote Bad Unk Sista Sista and support 2013 tour bookings:

- Original music (CD + download). This 70+ minute release has already been recorded and mixed, and is awaiting mastering and duplication ($2,000).

- Remixes (CD + download). 20+ wildly talented and wonderful DJs and producers have signed up to create their own personalized reflections of our recorded material. Needed: mastering and duplication ($3,000).

- Concert video. Hours of high-definition footage shot during "First Breath - Last Breath" will be edited and finished, resulting in an 8-10 minute video of performance highlights ($5,000).

- Music video. Additional footage from other projects will be crafted into our first video featuring Bad Unkl Sista original music ($4,000).

- Documentary. A camera crew followed us for two months as we concepted, choreographed, designed, composed, rehearsed, and staged "First Breath - Last Breath". We are now in our second round of editing, and will use funds to complete audio and video post-production ($3,500).

- Image licensing. Funds will enable us to license images from the photographer who documented the show and has done amazing work for us over the years ($1,000).

- Press kit design and presentation. We will design and develop both online (digital) and offline (printed) versions of our press kit ($1,500).

We will also be working with a publicist to distribute the our materials. The intention is to broaden our audience, culturally and professionally. We already have three confirmed spring performances in Europe — Copenhagen, Amsterdam, and London — and want to expand from there. We are also exploring museum installations and conducting workshops and teaching programs that include physical theater, Butoh and music. The remainder of the funds ($5,000) will help support this effort.

Our CD release party is scheduled for December 18, 2012 at Z Space in San Francisco. This will include an intimate performance by Bad Unkl Sista and the premiere screening of our documentary. Supporters at all levels will receive a special invitation to this event!

 

What we are offering

We have crafted some creative and valuable perks for this campaign:

- Private lessons and workshops

- Custom, one-of-a-kind costume designs

- "Butohgrams" (Butoh-inspired telegrams, delivered in person)

- Original songs/music compositions

- Bad Unkl Sista private performances

Stickers and t-shirts are also available, as well as recordings (and remixes) of original music from "First Breath - Last Breath".

Of course, there is always the possibility that we do not reach our goal. If this happens, all funds will still go towards the completion of several projects and initial marketing efforts. Every dollar will be used to send our work out into the world!

 

Please share

We hope that you are able to contribute at this time, and would appreciate your support by also helping to spread the word about Bad Unkl Sista and our Indiegogo campaign. There are many share tools here on Indiegogo, plus phone calls, email blasts, tweets and Facebook posts. Thank you!

 

With warmth and appreciation,

Anastazia Louise, Founder and Artistic Director

Goyo Aranaga, Music Director and Managing Director

 

(Photo credits: Eric Gillet, Sean McCarthy, F'kir Eldercake, Faern, Adam Cooper-Terán, Nathan Bennett, Guillermo Godinez.)

A note about funding
Unlike other online platforms (such as Kickstarter), this is a "Flexible Funding" campaign, which means that we receive all contributions, whether or not we hit our goal. But the more we receive, the more we are able to achieve. Thank you so much for your support!
